Title: Professional Dog Groomer
Description:
The Dog Stop Plus® is in need of enthusiastic groomers. Grooming is offered seven days a week, so weekends are a requirement, and applicants should be willing to work 3-5 days per week. Grooming applicants willing to work at multiple locations will be given priority. We offer 50% commission on all grooming services, paid time off, and 401k benefits.  
 
Dutіеs Inсӏude:
• Full Nose-to-Tail Makeovers (this includes bath, nail trims, and full body cuts) for all breeds
• Walk-in nail trims and gland expressions
• Baths for all size dogs
• Customer relations - develop relationships with clientele and their dogs. You should be able to explain to customers the best cut/grooming option for each dog.
• Managing busy grooming schedules and communicating progress to receptionists and clients.
• Maintaining a clean grooming room
• Keep track of inventory
• Upkeep grooming tools  
• Organize and update client profiles
 
 
Personal Attributes Include:
• At least three years of grooming experience with a wide variety of sizes and breeds of dogs
• Strong communication skills, ability to communicate clearly and professionally with owners
• Responsible with extreme attention to detail
• Strong work ethіс
• Up-beat, enthusiastic personality
• Must love dogs!
 
Please respond with your résumé, three professional references, and a paragraph explaining why you'd be a great fit for our team. If you have a grooming portfolio displaying your skill, please send that as well.

Title: Wicked the Musical - Merchandise Sales Associates Needed
Description:
Wicked the Musical - Merchandise Sales Associates Needed

Part-time Sales Associates needed for the hit Broadway touring musical "Wicked". Araca Merchandise LP is a theatrical merchandising company, with a fast-paced, high-energy and fun retail environment.  Our Sales Associates must be friendly, outgoing, articulate, engaging and adaptable.  

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

•	Handling cash and credit transactions
•	Assisting theater patrons with merchandise-related questions
•	Counting, restocking and folding inventory
•	Quick basic math
•	Maintaining displays, merchandise arrangements, and kiosk appearance
•	Engaging theatre patrons in a friendly and polite manner
•	Following procedures set forth by Theatre and Araca Management

Qualified Sales Associates will have:

•	One year of retail and/or sales experience
•	A high school-level or equivalent diploma
•	The desire to be a strong team-player
•	Excellent interpersonal, creative problem-solving, and organizational skills 
•	Strong communication and time-management skills
•	An understanding of urgency & speed in transactions, while maintaining accuracy
•	Availability to work at least six (6) shifts per week
•	The ability to lift a 25 lb. load

Compensation is $11/hour

To apply, please attach your resume and cover letter highlighting your retail and/or sales experience.

Araca Merchandise LP is a drug and alcohol-free workplace and an equal-opportunity employer.

For further information about The Araca Group, please check out our website www.araca.com.

For further information about "Wicked," please check out the show's website .

Title: CNC Machine Operator
Description:
Job Posting Title: Turn/Mill Machinist II on 2nd Shift
Department: Manufacturing
Shift: 2nd
Hours: 2:45 PM - 10:45 PM, Daily and weekend overtime may be required
 
Tasks
Under the direction of the Supervisor, Manufacturing:
• Set up and operate all related equipment and hand tools
• Move all materials, either physically or mechanically, necessary to complete assignments
• Perform inspection of machined products
• Remove burrs and sharp edges from work piece using file or hand grinder
• Perform program edits and/or changes as required
• All employees are expected to:
• Adhere to and follow all company safety policies and procedures to assure commitment to 100% safe work
• environment.
• Support the Lean Enterprise/25 Keys initiatives and continuously strive to improve Customer satisfaction through
• improved quality, reduction in waste and improved productivity.
• Perform tasks in a quality manner to meet external and internal Customer specifications and requirements.
• Perform in a flexible and cooperative manner toward team objectives and the goals of the company.
• Communicate effectively and respectfully with those you come in contact with in all matters.
• Complete all necessary documentation, electronic data entries and communications accurately and timely.
• Maintain regular attendance and perform duties in a timely manner, arriving and departing for assignments and
• meetings as required.
• Be aware of all standard procedures and practices associated with the position and work to maintain compliance.
 
Requirements
• High School diploma or GED
• 2 years manufacturing experience
• Demonstrated knowledge of manual and NC controlled lathes with the ability to select appropriate manufacturing methods, tooling, feeds, and speeds: set-up and operation
• Proficient verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to read blueprints and follow routers
• Ability to read and understand operating procedures
• Ability to perform basic shop math
• Ability to edit and troubleshoot CNC programs
• Trade School Certificate Preferred
 
Kennametal is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran www.kennametal.com

Title: New Sport Clips in Broadview Heights - Assistant Managers and Stylists
Press Operator
Description:
11:25 AM

Description of Responsibility

Assemble tooling and powder for order being pressed. thoroughly clean previous tooling as it is removed and set-up press to run new order. Inspect tooling as needed and maintain presses, make adjustments to eliminate quality defects.  Set-up automatic pick-off and weight control units adjust according to order label.   Scan production information. Operate press and tip set as needed.

Knowledge and Skills

	• Able to do basic math. 
	• Ability to read and understand defect criteria, insert identification, blueprints, routings and operating procedures.  
	• Ability to use a personal computer and various software such as SAP MII, locate information in QMS, and on the Kennametal Intranet ISO Procedures, and work instructions.   
	• Is able to handle green (soft) inserts with fingers without chipping. 
	• Understand proper use of  30X Microscope.
	• Communicate with set-up persons, inspectors, supervisors, and managers.  
	• Proficiency reached in twelve (12) months or less. 
	• Must complete classes in insert identification within six (6) months or less within starting the position. 

Education and Experience

	• Must have High School diploma or GED.

Work Environment

Environment with controlled temperatures and dust collection systems. Safety glasses with side-shields required. Safety shoes required. Gloves, cut resistant gloves when necessary.

Title: Experienced RN Hiring Event
Description:
Together with our family of brands, we're hiring experienced RNs in metropolitan centers and rural settings across seven states. Explore RN opportunities in Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. 

Our opportunities span a variety of specialties and clinical settings, each with room for growth and continuing education. Sign up for a phone interview and find out why our 38,000-strong team of nurses love where they work and live. Relocation benefits available.



During our call, we want to learn more about you. In addition, we can share information about our organization and our open nursing positions. We offer continuing education allowances, tuition reimbursement and career development for new specialties.
  
Our nurse recruiting team looks forward to learning about you!


• Nursing degree from an accredited school of nursing required upon hire.  All Registered Nurses without a minimum of a bachelor of science in nursing (BSN) must obtain a BSN or higher within 6 years of hire
   - An RN with 20 years of RN experience will not be required to obtain a BSN
   - Exceptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis at each facility by the most senior administrative nursing leader in consultation with the Human Resources leader
• Current license to practice as a Registered Nurse
• Current BLS certification (specialty areas may require additional certification)


• 2+ years recent RN experience
• BSN degree is a plus

We offer a comprehensive range of benefits. See our website for details: 


We are multiple organizations brought together by one goal: to simplify health for everyone. With award-winning facilities in seven western states you have endless opportunities to realize your full potential.
Our diverse family of organizations will transform the way health care is delivered. Over 160 years ago, our founders set out to give the best care possible to the communities they came to serve. We are committed to continuing their legacy as we work together to create healthier communities by providing compassionate, extraordinary care.

Title: Pet Care Specialist
Description:
We are looking for amazing people to join our Team!

Nikki's Collar Club, is a local pet care business that provides loving, superior quality and service to our clients and their furry family members. With clients currently in the Northeast suburbs of Cleveland OH. Nikki's Collar Club has won numerous awards for the outstanding service that we provide to our clients.

We are currently looking to fill multiple positions with independent contractors that meet the following minimum qualifications:
Reside within ten miles of our Lyndhurst Ohio office
Have a reliable/insured vehicle
Two or more years of animal care experience (not just owning your own pet)
Able to work independently
Own a dependable smart phone
Ability to manage your pet care assignments while providing amazing customer service

*Daily Pet Care Specialist- Monday-Friday (Full-time)
We have an immediate full-time opening for a Pet Care Specialist Monday- Friday with hours between 7:30am-4pm. Start and end time can fluctuate, so being flexible is important.
Requirements: Must be physically able to provide exercise for client's dogs each day. Walks could range between 20-45 minutes. Walkers are also responsible for checking the dog's food and water supply to make sure basic needs are met after their exercise. Cat care may also be requested from the client
Salary: $200.00 to $500.00 /week

*Pet Care Specialist- Saturday and Sunday (Part-time)
We have an immediate part-time opening for a Pet Care Specialist Saturday and Sunday with hours between 7:30am-6pm. Start and end time can fluctuate, so being flexible is important.

*Overnight Pet Care Specialist - As needed
Our pet sitters are called upon when we have a request by a client to provide an overnight stay in the pet owner's home.
Requirements: Our pet sitters are expected to arrive between 5-7pm and stay overnight in the clients home while providing care as needed. Care includes feeding, walking and companionship to the pets while the clients are away from the home.

If interested in one or all of the positions above, please apply directly on our website at Nikkiscollarclub.com/job-opportunities.html
*When applying, please indicate which position you are applying to on our site

Title: REAL ESTATE MANAGING BROKER WANTED
Description:
Are you currently a licensed Ohio real estate broker?

Would you like to have all of your MLS, licensing, insurance, and continuing education fees paid for?  

And KEEP 95% of your commissions on sales?

Join our brokerage and WE'LL PAY FOR ALL OF THE FEES required to maintain your Ohio broker's license!

The annual expenses to maintain an Ohio broker's license could cost you approximately $5,500 per year.  But work with us, and we'll cover them all!

Our company needs a broker of record on staff, but our systems are very automated so the actual work requirements are minimal. In return for your services, we will pay all your realtor, license, continuing ed, E&O insurance and MLS fees for as long as you work with us.

This is a great fit for someone who does only a few transactions a year and wants to stay in the business, or is "semi-retired" from active sales but wants to maintain their license. We are a small and well-respected company, and are looking for the right person for a long relationship!

We look forward to speaking with you!

Title: Maintenance Supervisor
Description:
A premier real estate company has an immediate job opening for a Maintenance Supervisor  for an apartment community in Euclid, Ohio.  

The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR is responsible for the overall upkeep and maintenance of the Apartment Community.  The responsibilities of the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR are:

A.	Keep property is best maintenance condition
B.	Maximize efficiency of the Maintenance Staff.
C.	Minimize the expenses whenever possible.
D.	Protect the Owner's Property.

The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must be a "hands-on" maintenance person.  The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must be able to just about anything that pertains to Building Maintenance, such as plumbing, electrical, painting, heating, air conditioning and appliance repair.

It is the responsibility of the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR to coordinate and monitor all aspects of the Maintenance Program.  In this regard, the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must work closely with the Maintenance staff in order to ascertain full knowledge and control over the entire maintenance program.

The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR will work closely with the Property Manager.  Good communications between the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR and the Property Manager is crucial for the proper and efficient operation of the Apartment Community.  The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR works directly with the Property Manager and for the Maintenance Director. 

The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR responsibilities and authority include but are not limited to the following:

A.	ATTITUDE

1.	Maintain a professional, courteous, knowledgeable and helpful attitude with the Residents and fellow employees.  Promote this attitude in all of your personnel.
2.	Do not socialize with Residents but maintain a professional manner.  Do not discuss company business with them or engage in idle talk or rumors.
3.	Be honest and truthful in all communications with the, Property Manager. Dishonesty will not be tolerated.

B.	RESIDENT CARE

1.	Assist Residents with problems and requests to the best of your ability and to limits of your authority.
2.	Maintain curb appeal of the exterior of the building and common areas of the building.

C.	MANAGEMENT

1.	Continually supervise maintenance and personnel.  Take action to improve the general appearance of the property, always be alert for any deferred maintenance problems.  Establish daily employee goals.  Show each employee exactly what you want him or her to do so they know what is expected.
2.	Require all full time employees to adhere to the scheduled hours of work.
3.	Monitor employee compliance with the policies of Retiree Housing Management.
4.	Encourage employees to submit suggestions for improving work conditions or job efficiency.
5.	Discuss employee performances with the Property Manager if problems arise and possible written reprimand and or dismissal is necessary.  Advise the Maintenance Director so that he can help you follow the proper dismissal procedure.
6.	Report any employee injury to the Property Manager and Maintenance Director immediately.
7.	Present to the Maintenance Director ideas on improvement projects and labor needs.

D.	POLICY

1.	Comply with the dress code and or wear uniforms.  Work attire must be neat and clean at all times.
2.	Adhere to scheduled hours of work.

E.	SCHEDULING WORK

1.	Daily 
(a)	Complete all Maintenance request and fill out completely or assign to proper staff person. Track progress and make sure it is completed properly and paperwork is turned in.
(b)	Schedule contractors and sign off on completed work orders and invoices.
(c)	Order all materials and supplies.  Check in order, sign invoice and give to the Manager.
(d)	Cover building Emergency on-call as scheduled

2.	Weekly
(a)	Meet with the Property Manager once a week. Discuss work procedures, priorities, goals and special jobs to be completed.  Assist Management in distributing notices.
(b)	Complete all turn units and schedule contractor as needed.  Oversee units to completion and notify office when ready to rent (3-5 day) turnaround.
(c)	Fill out main office paperwork and submit to Property Manager
(d)	Make recommendations to Maintenance Director to improve general conditions of property.
(e)	Communicate with Maintenance Director three (3) times a week or more often if needed.
(f)	Assist Pest Control (when applicable)

3.	Monthly:

(a)	Complete and total walk through of Bldg, filling out preventative maintenance schedule for bldg and complete all needed work found. 



4.	Bi-Annually
(a)	Assist in apartment inspections with the Property Manager
(b)	Complete total filter change (Spring & Fall)

F.	INSPECTIONS

1.	Walk grounds weekly and look for missed trash, maintenance problems and damages.  Complete work as needed.
2.	Watch for non-residents running the bldg and for solicitors on the property.  Report to the Property Manager.
3.	Review maintenance work of employees periodically for quality.
4.	Assist Property Manager twice a year for apartment condition inspections.

G.	PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
1.	Working off ladders up to 20 feet off the ground.  Working off stepladders up to 10 feet inside apartments.
2.	Work under sinks and around appliances by bending down or lying on your back.
3.	Moving appliances including refrigerators, washers, dryers and ranges.
4.	Lifting and carrying up to 80 pounds
5.	Bending over appliances or mechanical equipment for repairs or cleaning.
6.	Walking and or standing for an entire workday
7.	Climbing flights of stairs to access work on higher floors
8.	Assembling small parts in appliances, mechanical equipment, plumbing and electrical fixtures, etc.
9.	Reading repair instructions
10.	Logging or describing in writing work hours, repairs made and or materials used.
11.	Working in clement weather
12.	Operating hand and power tools
13.	Painting 
14.	Cleaning 



H.	SAFETY

1.	Be safe and always think safety
2.	Furnish all employees needed safety equipment, such as a set of goggles, or particle masks for their use.
3.	Periodically check employees for use of safety equipment.

I.	TOOLS

1.	Supply your own tools for all common maintenance repairs.  The Bldg will furnish specialty tools only for unusual repairs.  (i.e. drain snake, extension ladders)

J.	TURNOVER

1.	Perform as much work as possible in house with your Maintenance personnel.
2.	Clean, paint, make repairs to the vacant Apartments to the satisfaction of the Property Manager
3.	Check and repair all electrical and pluming fixtures, window and door locks, etc., to ensure they work properly.
4.	Change all vacant unit door locks.
5.	Complete all work and make unit ready in 3-5 days from move out

K.	CONTRACTOR
1.	Work with Contractors as needed.  Ensure that the resident's safety is always a prime consideration, and work is done per LBP O&M Policy (where needed)
2.	Complete work associated with the Contractor's work as needed.
Compensation: Compensation based on experience and qualifications

Title: Care Coordinator for System of Care
Description:
Bellefaire JCB is looking for a Care Coordinator for System of Care who will be responsible for providing care coordination services to clients and families identified by the Cuyahoga Tapestry System of Care (CTSOC). Care Coordinator will coordinate formal and informal services for the child and family in accordance with the principals of the High Fidelity Wraparound model associated with the CTSOC project. This includes, but is not limited to, engaging families in Wraparound model, planning, implementing and monitoring service provision, and collaboration with involved partners.

Qualifications include a minimum Bachelor's Degree in Social Work or related field. Valid Ohio LSW required. A valid driver's license with approved driving record (less than 6 points), personal transportation and insurance, if required to drive on behalf of the agency required. Strong clinical skills including expertise in systemic family therapy, crisis intervention, family education, and linking/ advocacy skills required. Ideal applicant will have experience in the Behavioral health field and experience working with children, adolescents and their families.

At Bellefaire, we value our employees and the work they accomplish on behalf of our mission and offer competitive benefits such as:

    A competitive salary

Title: Delivery Partners (Cars) NEEDED in Cleveland - Fun & Flexible!
Diesel Mechanic Technician
Description:
To begin your application, please use the following link:



With unmatched commitment to quality, service and value, Rockport Ready Mix takes great pride in providing individualized attention to supply the highest ready-mix product quality and service in Northeastern Ohio.

The Diesel Mechanic / Service Technician will be responsible for maximizing equipment safety and availability by performing all PM programs, diagnostics, inspections and repairs on trucks and equipment while utilizing the most efficient processes and resources.

Some equipment will be provided, however, most tools should be furnished by the mechanic.

Benefits: 
- Competitive benefits package
- Paid training

Responsibilities:
- Maintain a professional and technical knowledge of our trucks and equipment
- Diagnose electrical and mechanical problems and perform repairs and maintenance to various types of equipment including but not limited to: trucks, mixers, heavy construction equipment and vehicles
- Inspect, change and rotate tires as needed
- Perform routine preventative maintenance such as lubricating, oil changes, and failure analysis
- Perform routine brake inspections/ adjustments, repair and replacement on commercial vehicles following Federal DOT requirements.
- Create work orders on repairs and services providing legible and accurate information for work performed.
- Maintain repair reports in individual equipment files and folders.
- Input daily repair reports into tracking software.
- Use a wide variety of hand and power tools, cutting torches and welding equipment.
- Assist in the maintenance and repair of plant equipment.
- Comply with all Safety, Health, Environmental and other Company policies, procedures and requirements
- Encourage a positive working relationship with all personnel and customers.
- Maintain available and constant telephone access always, during and after work schedule

Required Skills and Experience:
- Valid Commercial Driver License preferred
- Two-year technical college or three years of related experience or training.
- Must be computer literate.
- Must have average mathematical skills.
- Excellent communication skills, reasoning, and aptitude for decision making
- Possess a level of determination to successfully complete tasks and projects on time.
- Reacts well under pressure.

This job is very hands-on. Diesel mechanics may be required to be physically active for long periods of time .

Title: Looking for a Photography JOB?
Description:
Looking for a job with your camera during the week? 
 
Stilio is a nationwide network that connects real estate photographers with real estate agents...think Airbnb for real estate photography. This is the best kind of job, the one that you are your own boss. Create a profile on the Stilio network and stay independent!

**How it works**
1. Agent finds your profile on Stilio.com and places an order
2. You receive order → confirm order → do the shoot
3. Upload your products to Stilio.com
4. Client pays you through the Stilio payment system
5. Stilio delivers completed products to your clients (including free virtual tour)

Watch our How it Works video on Stilio.com.
 
**How to get started**
1. Sign up - There is no fee to be a part of the Stilio network. Stilio only charges a small per photo fee when you complete an order (see Stilio.com for details).
2. Complete your profile - Set your own pricing, availability, select the products you want to offer, choose areas of service and travel fees, add profile and cover pictures, set your own terms and conditions...in other words, create your own real estate photography business in just a few clicks!
3. Get approved - Stilio reviews each and every photographer application. 

 
**What do you get?**
- Payment/invoicing tools
- Calendar + messaging
- Complete guide to real estate photography 
- A personal profile where agents can find you
- Free virtual tours for your clients
- Free photo delivery + storage
- The option to use Stilio's world class editing services (with 12hr turnaround)

Title: CDL CLASS A HAZMAT DRIVERS $1700-$2500 WEEKLY (for dry van and reefer)
Description:
TWENTY 4 SEVEN EXPRESS INC. is looking for CDL Class A Over the road Driver. 

Twenty 4 Seven Express is a smaller outfit focused on bringing the best miles and gross to our drivers. The key to success both as a driver is to keep moving without down time and sitting around waiting for loads. We offer pre-plans from our dispatch team, this way you are always pre booked ahead to know where you are moving next. Our company is dedicated to make sure you make what you deserve and keep you busy if you are away from home and your family. Our drivers make anywhere from $1500-$2500 weekly, however these drivers are focused and well experienced. The miles for the week (7 day work week) are 3000+ Miles so you will need to be able to handle these miles on week to week basis. We pride ourselves to be a company that always pays you on time and gives you the earnings that you deserve to be out over the road. No log book violations will be allowed, or if you had recent log book violations you will not qualify for this position. If you are hard working and get under paid don't miss out a great opportunity to work for a great outfit and start making $100K+ annually. 

Here are the Requirements for this position: 

- 3 year experience is a must with a CLASS-A CDL
- Driver has to have Hazmat/Tanker Endoresements (if you dont have these you have to show proof of applying for these before hire date) 
- This Position is for a Reefer or Dry Van Trailer
- Driver has to be able to handle 3000+ miles a week. 
- Driver has to have knowledge how to operate on paper log books.
- Minimum of 2 week stay out time is required. 
- No Recent Log Book Violations
- No out of service violations for log books for the past year. 

Job Description

- 48 state hauling 
- Two trucks available only 
- .47C for Van and .48C for reefer. a mile start pay with raises for the first 6 months
- Pay Day Every Friday with direct deposit. 
- Minimum of 3000 miles a week
- Paper Log Books
- Pre-Plans for loads
- 1099 Pay (we dont hold anything back)
- $1000 Escrow (taken $100 a week until $1000 is collected) Returned 45 days after your last check.
- $100 Milage Bonus for the month
- $100 Good Inspection Bonus (level 1, level 2, or level 3) (immediate pay)
- Driver has to have a Smart Phone 
- Driver has to have a working e mail on his phone


Job available right away and will be given to first person that applies with clean background and clean MVR. We need to talk before you are sent a Application since you will need to be cleared by our Insurance Company to get hired on. 

CALL OR E MAIL US TODAY 

312-714-6121

Title: General Manager - Assistant Managers - Shift Managers
Description:
Accepting Applications for the following locations: Parma, Ohio
Growing popular fast casual food restaurant chain SONIC AMERICAS DRIVE-IN 55 years in the drive-in restaurant business seeking new vital team members for a company expansion. 
We are currently looking for quality Leaders to help with expansion and to strengthen our team. 
We are the best and only want the best. 
Opportunities to advance are endless and rewards are tremendous. 
If you feel you have what it takes and want the opportunity to grow with our company please respond to this post with your resume for an immediate interview.

Whether you aspire to be one of our iconic Carhops or a General Manager, our drive-in locations are the customer-pleasing front lines of career opportunity. It's where we directly fulfill the Bacon Cheeseburger and Chocolate Shake needs of America. And that's a deliciously rewarding feeling.

It's fast. And it's fun. If that's the way you roll, then let's go. We're ready to feed that passionate drive of yours with a world of training, benefits and development opportunities. Buckle up -- let's take a road trip to a fun, challenging and rewarding long-term career.

We stick to what made drive-ins so popular:
Made to order American Classics - Signature Menu Items! 
Speedy Service from Friendly Roller Skating Carhops!
Heaping Helpings of Fun and Personality! 
2pm - 4pm HAPPY HOUR 1/2 Price Fountain Drinks and Slushes!
BREAKFAST Served ALL DAY - LUNCH -- DINNER!
Full Menu Served ALL DAY!
Made Fresh For You!

Being an Assistant Manager is the cherry on top of a Strawberry Banana Split Molten Cake Sundae. You'll assist the drive-in's General Manager in managing drive-in operations. You will also be involved in training and supporting other employees to ensure we provide quality food in a clean, safe and efficient manner.

As a SONIC General Manager, you are indeed a general--leading your troops in a never-ending campaign to give America an infinitely more delicious dining experience. You will be involved in training and supporting drive-in employees, ensuring that food is delivered in a clean, safe and efficient manner and our customers have an excellent experience.

Requirements
- We ONLY Want STRONG LEADERS with the proven ability to train and develop managers through mentoring, coaching, etc. . .
- Excellence written and verbal communication skills
- Detail oriented and excellent organizational skills 
- Ability to learn quickly and adapt to company policies
- Hiring, training and maintaining a quality staff
- Provide a safe work environment for both staff and our guests
- Complete and manage administrative paperwork including profit and loss statements, daily planning, and scheduling
- Maintain inventory and Loss Prevention
- Must have excellent communication and leadership skills
- Proficient skills in planning, strategizing, rolling out programs, policies, and setting expectations
- Provide excellent attention to detail
- 3 to 5 years of restaurant management experience required for General Manager position and 1-3 years of restaurant management experience required for Assistant Manager/Shift Manager.

Assistant Manager & Shift Manager Responsibilities
-Support the General Manager with daily functions such as the operation of the restaurant with focus of creating Completely Satisfied Guests.
-Assist with hiring, training and maintenance of quality staff
-Optimize profits and sales in the restaurant
-Ensure a safe work environment for team members and guests
-Complete administrative paperwork, daily planning, implementing in-house marketing plans, and maintaining adequate inventories
-Participate in planning and preparing the delivery of the freshest, highest quality food, drinks, deserts and other products
-Maintain store cleanliness, service, sanitation and safety
-Provide regular cross training, direction and coaching to new and experienced Skating Carhops, Drive Thru and Kitchen team members
-Participate in performance evaluations of team members

BEHIND THE RED BUTTON

Not to brag or anything, but SONIC delivers the most uniquely cool drive-in dining experience in the History of Ever. Seriously, where else can customers press a big red button and then, minutes later, have delicious food delivered directly to their cars by a friendly, ultra-attentive carhop? Nowhere else, that's where.

We take immense pride in an experience that we carefully craft and promptly deliver. Truly, it's an art form. And those who work here are artists, painting sumptuous colors on the boundless canvas of their professional future.

Okay, maybe we're taking this art analogy a little too far. But we can't help it. If you're one of us, you'll understand.

PLEASE BE SPECIFIC AS TO WHAT LOCATION THAT YOU ARE APPLYING FOR.
All Management Applicants apply to this post with your resume or apply at: www.SonicDriveIn.com 
Include your resume with work history and relative management experience in the Quick Service Restaurant business.

Apply: to this post with your resume or appy at: www.SonicDriveIn.com 


Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers

Title: Get paid to be online! Work from home, Social Media Evaluator
Description:
Overview 

If you love social media and are an active user, now is the time to get paid for your time on social media platforms!  Social Media Evaluators with Appen evaluate the quality and relevance of information in their local area or country of residence in categories such as news feeds, advertisements and search results.  Tech companies around the world need the knowledge and experience of the very people who use their services.  Social Media Evaluators have a direct impact on the effectiveness and relevancy of the service these companies provide. 
 
The Social Media Evaluator is a work-from-home opportunity where all you need is a computer or smartphone and the desire to make a positive impact while working in the social media platforms you enjoy. 
 
These are entry-level positions and Social Media Evaluators can learn new technologies and receive income just by having the experience of participating in social media. 
 
Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a Appen's rapidly growing global Social Media Evaluation services providing critical data for the world's top internet search engine companies!
 
Work Schedule:
·       Social Media Evaluator positions are flexible, part-time and only require between 1 and 4 hours a day with your choice of 5 to 7 days a week up to 20 hours a week! 
 
Requirements:
·       Must be currently residing in and able to perform work tasks in the United States
·       Access to a computer or smart phone that is less than 3 years old
·       High-speed internet connection 
·       Ability to read and write in English to understand and perform work tasks to customer specifications
 
Characteristics for Success:
·       Ability and desire to work from home doing internet-based work within social media platforms
·       Active user on social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram
·       Good English spelling skills
·       Basic level of computer and/or smart phone operational knowledge
·       Ability and willingness to comprehend and follow instructions independently
·       Experience as a freelancer or other work-from-home opportunities
 
Compensation:
·       Dependent upon project 
 
Click here to apply directly at our website:



Click HERE to watch a short video to learn more about Social Media Evaluation.
 
Appen Rewards and Recognition:
 
FlexJobs - Recognized by FlexJobs as a Top 100 Company to Watch for Remote Jobs in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 including the #1 Ranking in 2017! 
 
Deloitte Technology Fast 50 - Three-time winner in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 Australia Awards from 2012 through 2014.
 
Momentum Mid-Market Awards - Finalist in the BRW Momentum Awards for Best Mid-Market Business $50-$100MM Category.  In addition, Appen was a finalist in the 2014 Australian Growth Technology Company Awards.
 
Australian Export Rewards - Inaugural winner in 2008 of the Prime Minister's Exporter of the Year Award and Australian Export Category winner, Information and Communication Technology Award.  
 
Appen's clients are the top technology companies in the world.  We are a global technology and language consulting firm, operating in 180 languages and we staff projects ranging in size from under one hundred to thousands of remote workers around the globe.  Appen's work provides the critical data our clients need to improve the technology experience in many platforms for all users. 
 
Note:  Appen is actively hiring for many clients.  We have other opportunities which may be contractor or employee status, or have different schedules and requirements.  Our team will evaluate your application and review all positions that might be a quality fit based on your skills and experience.  To see all our work opportunities, please visit join.appen.com.

Title: Line Haul Driver/ Regional Runs/Home Weekly
Description:
Is your career taking you where you want to go?
When it began in 1924, Saia (NASDAQ: SAIA) covered a two-state area: Louisiana and Texas. Today, Saia is one of the most successful carriers in the United States, providing regional and interregional LTL, non-asset truckload service, and third-party logistics. Much of Saia's growth has been accomplished through mergers and acquisitions and we're currently in the process of expanding to NJ and PA.  Headquartered in Johns Creek, GA, Saia is a growing corporation offering the best-in-class benefits and opportunities to inspire every member of our team. With over 9,000 employees dedicated to their jobs and our customers, you may discover your own career path at Saia.

The road to a great career starts with Saia!
Today, Saia's network of 148 terminals covers 34 states in the U.S. as well as Canada. Through our network of partners, we serve the balance of the U.S. including Alaska and Hawaii, plus Puerto Rico and Mexico. Through our three operating service groups - Saia LTL, Linkex, and Saia Logistics Services - we provide complete transportation and logistics solutions. 
As a company, Saia is dedicated to providing every employee the opportunity and environment to continue to grow and contribute, individually and as part of a team. Perhaps that is why the average employee tenure at Saia is 8 years, nearly twice the national average, and why more than 300 employees have been with us for over 20 years.
For more information on Saia, visit the Saia website at www.saia.com .  

Line Haul Driver/ Regional Runs/Home Weekly 
OTR and CDL Drivers don't miss this great opportunity to join one of the most successful LTL carriers in the U.S!   If you are looking for an opportunity to make more money and be home more often, we want to talk to you!  Working for Saia means the opportunity to partner with a successful company and enjoy stability and security for you and your family. 

But don't just take our word for it, here's what some of our drivers have to say:
"Solid company, good benefits, good upper management, good HR practices and excellent compensation in their Line Haul division" - Current Line Haul Driver
"Coming to Saia, the opportunity to be home is so much better!" - Current Line Haul Driver Trainer

If you are looking for an opportunity to make more money, provide excellent benefits for your family, and be home more often, apply today!

Pay
Pay Range $0.55 - $0.64 CPM
Start at $0.61 CPM with 1 year of OTR experience!

Job Responsibilities
As a Line Haul Driver you will be responsible for:
Operating various tractor-trailer combinations for extended periods of time, over long distances, between company terminals or yards, company facilities and customer facilities or work sites.
Picking up, transporting, and delivering freight
About 80% of our Line Haul Drivers have set runs and average about 2,200-2,500 miles a week.

Job Requirements
21 years of age or older
Current Class A CDL
1 year tractor trailer experience with some experience in the last 24 months
Doubles/Triples, Hazmat, and Tankers endorsements
OTR experience helpful

Benefits
At Saia, your success is our success! That's why we work hard to provide you with what you need to build an awesome career. We are committed to rewarding superior employee performance so that when you work hard, your achievements won't go unnoticed.  How committed are we?  Saia offers low cost, premium medical insurance that is just $37.50 to cover a family per week.  This includes a $500 maximum annual deductible, $25.00 co-pay for primary care doctor office visits and the weekly premium is 100% company-paid after 10 years of service!  We also match 50% of your 401(k) contribution up to the first 6%.

We are proud to offer the following benefits:
Health Insurance with Medical, Rx & Vision 
Dental Insurance
Free Life Insurance
Free Short-term Disability
401(k) with immediate vesting & company match
Immediate eligibility for Holiday Pay
Paid Vacation days and Personal/Sick Days
Employee Stock Purchase plan
Credit Union

Our Mission
At Saia Inc., success comes down to taking care of the people who matter most - our customers, our employees and our shareholders. The rest will take care of itself. 

"Provide best-in-class service - as defined by our customers - through quality processes in an environment that respects employees, advocates safety, recognizes excellence, and builds shareholder value."

Title: * No CDL? No problem! Get CDL Training + Truck Driving Job Here *
Description:
Looking for a great opportunity based in the Cleveland, OH area? PAM Transport is currently hiring truck drivers, and no previous experience is needed! We offer company sponsored CDL training, which allows you to go through trucking school to get the training needed to become a professional truck driver with PAM. 



- Earn up to $50,000 1st year
- $1,200 Sign On Bonus
- Company Sponsored CDL Training
- Best-In-Class Benefits
- Drive Newer Trucks




In about a month, you can earn a Class A CDL and be ready to hit the open road with a driver mentor for paid on-the-job training. Drivers at PAM Transport can earn up to $50,000 in addition to a $1,200 sign on bonus in their first year, with excellent benefits and advancement opportunities too.


One of the greatest benefits to working for PAM are the different career opportunities available in a driver's first year. Taking advantage of these options will help maximize an employee's earning potential:



-  - Employees have the opportunity to drive HazMat freight as a team which earns them more pay per mile than a general driver.

-  - Driver Mentors get paid to help new PAM drivers get real on the road experience.

-  - Purchase a rig, and run your own business!








PAM offers its experienced drivers a positive atmosphere with plenty of OTR and Dedicated lanes, as well as team driving runs and enhanced HazMat pay. This makes it a great place for drivers to grow professionally while advancing their career.

Title: Snow Removal Crew - Multiple Counties
Description:
What is the SGM Way? It's the art of delivering an Extraordinary Experience to our clients and team members. At Schill Grounds Management, we believe that Extraordinary Experiences come from Extraordinary People and that the foundation for Extraordinary People is an Extraordinary Culture.

We invite you to experience our Extraordinary Culture and discover what sets us apart from other companies. Our business continues to expand and we are looking for part-time Snow Removers to help us serve our commercial clients.

This position pays $15.00 per hour on a biweekly basis and services our clients in Cuyahoga, Erie, Huron, Lake, Medina, Ottawa, Portage, Summit, and Sandusky counties. Just let us know where you live and we will try to keep your assignments close to home.

As part of our Snow Removal Crew, you may do any of the following:
Manually shovel snow
Spread salt
Remove snow from storefronts using awning rakes
Operate small snow blowers
Operate walk behind snow sweepers

What will it take to be successful in this position?
Attention to detail and the ability to work in a team environment
An appreciation for working outdoors, you will be outside in Northeast Ohio winter conditions!
A working phone number and flexible availability. We will call you when we are gearing up for a weather event
Reliable transportation to your assigned work site

If this sounds like you, we can't wait to hear from you! 

And, if you enjoy working for us during the snow removal season, we do have crew member opportunities available during the landscaping season!

Title: Elevator Mechanic $51-75/Hour - We are not your typical Company!
Description:
Attention Elevator Mechanics! This is NOT your typical ad because we are NOT your typical company!

Due to our company's incredible growth, we are looking for a highly skilled elevator mechanic who is a hard worker, has excellent integrity, is team focused, and has a positive attitude.  It is important that the mechanic we hire desires and appreciates being a part of a wonderful team that cares.  

Our company proudly offers a competitive wage and benefit package as you will see below.  
Our excellent wages and benefits are very important; however, we feel that our value, as a company, greatly lies in our character and unique environment.  You will find us to be genuine, caring, and a refreshing change from what you may be accustomed to.  

Ask yourself: 

1.	How would I like to work for a company who genuinely cares about me and my family?  We are a family here!  The owners and employees truly care about one another. 
2.	How would I like having the security of not being laid off?  We understand the financial challenges that result from being laid off so our goal is to strive to keep our staff employed full-time. 
3.	How would I like to be home with my family more and travel less?  Our jobs are almost exclusively local.  If there poses a need for an out-of-town job, it is usually a brief one. 
4.	How would I like to work for a team-focused company?  We are so proud to have an amazing group of people here.  Our field staff and office staff all work extremely well together! 
5.	How would I like to have fun?  Yes, we definitely like to have fun!  Laughing is required.
6.	How would I like to actually enjoy coming to work each and every day?  Many of our staff members have communicated that they have never worked in an environment such as ours.  They love it here and plan to stay long-term!
7.	How would I like to be more than just a number?  We develop relationships with our employees not only on a professional level but we also foster these relationships on a personal level.  We do this by having fun and enjoying company-sponsored rafting trips, potlucks, and Christmas dinners that are not only for you but for your family as well.
8.	How would I like to be proud of the company that I work for?  We have the best in the business customer service - hands down!  And we attribute our success to this fact.  Not only do we care about our employees but we also care about our customers.  We provide personal, professional, and superior customer service.  This is of utmost importance to us!
9.	How would I like a refreshing change?  We understand the challenges that people face when relocating their family.  We also know that joining our company can be an opportunity for a new and wonderful journey with lots of great benefits.  Such benefits include the opportunity to work for our unique and family oriented company as well as live in a family-focused community.  The Pacific Northwest boasts a plethora of outdoor activities that are centered on our beautiful lakes, extraordinary wildlife, nearby ski slopes, and fresh air.  Lastly, because we care about the challenges that come with relocating, we will assist you with your relocation costs by providing a $5,000 moving incentive to make the transition easier on you and your family. 

We proudly offer the following excellent benefit and wage package: 
•	Paid Vacations 
•	Paid Sick Time
•	Paid Holidays 
•	Medical Coverage - 100% Company Paid (for Employees)
•	Health Savings Accounts
•	Company Sponsored Retirement Accounts w/ 3% company matching
•	Company vehicle provided
•	$5,000 bonus for relocation assistance
•	Continuing Education Assistance
•	A Non-Union Environment with No Dues, No Fees
•	$51-$75/Hour

Here is what we expect from the selected candidate(s):
•	MUST have a NEIEP Certificate or CET Certificate (from NAEC)
•	Have a minimum 5 years of experience in construction, modernization, or service/repair
•	Have an enthusiastic attitude
•	Be a team player
•	Have a desire to be the best!

We are a locally owned, family ran business.  The owners are truly good-hearted people who are a joy to be around.  They work very hard for the company, customers, and their employees.  They have the utmost integrity and care resulting in satisfied customers and employees who appreciate being a part of their company.  If this sounds great and refreshing to you, please call Corrie at (509) 951-6416.  Also, please provide your resume and copies of licenses and certificates.  We are excited to talk to you!   **PLEASE NOTE that only the applicants who hold a NEIEP Certificate or CET Certificate (from NAEC National Association of Elevator Contractors) will be considered.  Also, we are not accepting applications for apprentices or helpers as we have no openings for those positions.

Title: Skilled Craftsman
Description:
Hiring Immediately!!!

Large residential construction company based out of Pittsburgh, PA beginning work early December 2017 in the Cleveland DMA.
Hiring FULL TIME Skilled Craftsman who are experienced with Residential Construction settings and performing work in all facets of the business.
In this role, the Craftsman will work under the supervision of the Job Foreman.  Successful candidates will have the ability to:
•	Perform a variety of hands-on construction tasks at various projects based on the needs and under the direction of the Job Foreman, including but not limited to: general carpentry; installing, finishing and repairing drywall, roofing and flooring; interior and exterior paint and trim; installing and finishing exterior siding.
•	Utilize a range of hand tools and equipment to complete necessary work (e.g., saws, drills, sanders, cement mixers, jack hammers, demo hammers).
•	Forecast materials needed for the remainder of the job.
•	Communicate any production, quality, or cost issues with the Job Foreman in a timely manner.
•	Ensure quality standards are met.  Address deviations, errors, and necessary repairs to meet specifications.
•	Ensure safety regulations are met. Maintain clean and safe project sites.
•	Establish and maintain positive working relationships with vendors and subcontractors.

The Company has advancement opportunities and steady growth with Full Time work available over the next 5 years! 
The company sets high personal standards for employees and is looking for candidates with the same standards.
This is a unique opportunity for an experienced construction professional with excellent communication skills and a high attention to detail to utilize their experience, creativity, and technical skills with a growing company.   

All candidates to be considered will need to have reliable transportation and open to conduct work at job sites determined by the company. 
Pay rates can be discussed at the time of the interview and will be determined on an individual bases depending on job requirements and individual skills. 
This company is a top performing company and is looking for great long term, motivated candidates who will play a vital role in their continued growth and success.
Candidates who are available to start immediately (Prior to December 2017) will need to be available to work in the Pittsburgh DMA prior to the transition to Cleveland.

Title: Immediate Help Wanted (Great for Students) Apply Today
Description:
Are you looking for work?  I run an office here and we're looking for part time help. 
 

What we have available are part time positions (as low as 5 hours a week) in entry level customer sales and service. So what you would be doing if everything were to work out, is working with customers, answering any of their questions, explaining products to them, and helping them place orders.  There is no experience needed to start working and no cost to start. Must be comfortable working with people. 
 

The pay starts at $17.25 base-appt.  Let me be clear on this point: that is a flat rate, not based on sales or commissions. There is opportunity to earn more based on performance. Some conditions exist. Most people start with ZERO experience, so they like the fact that the pay not based on sales or results. New team members always say our simple, fun training gives them all the confidence they need.  We look for people that want to improve their resume and communication skills, not just those who want to make money (we DO offer pay-raises for top performers).  


We work with a lot of students & people who have other jobs, so our schedules are flexible. We have weekends, days, or evenings available. Talk with the manager about your ideal schedule. 
 

All ages eighteen and up are invited to apply with us

All you have to do is  to fill out an online application. A staff member will reach out to you via text to set you up with an interview with our company.  
 
You do NOT need any experience to apply. However, we are filling openings *immediately* so 

If you're eager to learn and looking for resume experience, we might be a good fit for each other. 

Good luck!

Title: Company Drivers Needed - Drivers Home Most Nights
Description:
Are you looking for more home time? Join Bulk Transit by calling (844) 662-7156 and get the home time you deserve!

Driver Benefits:
-Out and Back Runs
-Home most nights
-$1,800 sign on bonus- $150/wk first 12 weeks
-Detention pay- $15hr
-Monthly safety bonus and cell phone reimbursement- $165
-Assigned tractors
-Low cost health, dental, & vision (as low as $23/wk)
-401K retirement plan w/ 4% company match
-Life insurance
-PAID holiday, vacation, training, & orientation

Requirements:
-Valid CDL A
-One year Tractor Trailer Experience
-No more than 3 violations in the past 3 years

About Bulk Transit:
We are family-owned and operated since 1972. Our founder was a Truck Driver who still comes to the office every day. We began transporting dry bulk freight from our Ohio headquarters. Since then we have added two sister offices in New York and Texas, and more than 10 operation centers throughout Ohio, West Virginia, Kentucky, Michigan, Pennsylvania, Indiana, and New York from which to service our customers.
We still provide the same culture our founder installed many years ago. We deliver an outstanding work-life balance that attracts dedicated employees to Bulk Transit, and for the same reason they are staying for a long-lasting career. Our strength is in our size: We are small enough to react quickly to customer needs, yet big enough to have the financial backing that those needs may require. We are the best of both worlds: "not too big and not too small."

Title: Customer Service Representative - Seasonal (Work From Home)
Description:
Spiraledge is a leading internet retailer and healthy living company. As the parent company of fast growing e‐commerce sites SwimOutlet.com 🏊 & YogaOutlet.com 🙏🏼, Spiraledge Inc. has been recognized as a Gold‐Level Fit‐Friendly Worksite 🏆 at its headquarters in Campbell, CA. Both SwimOutlet.com and YogaOutlet.com have been named an Internet Retailer Hot 100 Company.

SwimOutlet.com is the largest online specialty store for aquatics in the United States and has the largest selection for swimming, fashion swim, beach and surf!

YogaOutlet.com is the fastest growing multi-branded online yoga retailer, offering a broad selection of yoga brands and yoga-inspired products to all levels of yogis and fitness enthusiasts.

Position Summary:

This is a remote position. However, it requires residence in California, Oregon, Ohio, Washington, or Connecticut and 2 weeks of full time training. 

The customer service representative responds accurately and efficiently to our customer needs regarding products and order inquiries via phone, e-mail and Live Chat. The ideal candidate has excellent communication skills, genuine empathy and the ability to represent our brand with pride. Representatives are expected to adapt to changes, contribute to improving the overall site experience, and follow through on resolving customer issues with good judgment and a sense of urgency.

Responsibilities:

•	Maintain high levels of customer service
•	Answer customer calls and respond to emails
•	Research required information using available resources
•	Manage and resolve customer complaints
•	Provide customers with product and service information
•	Process orders and resolve issues according to procedure
•	Identify and escalate priority issues and route calls to appropriate resource
•	Follow up customer calls where necessary
•	Document all call information according to standard operating procedures
•	Adhere to the work schedule with regard to start and stop times and breaks
•	Maintain a positive work atmosphere that strengthens the team
•	Perform other duties and projects as assigned
•	Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures and instructions

Qualifications:

•	B.S. degree with 1+ years of phone based customer service or call center experience a plus
•	Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
•	Strong written and verbal communication skills
•	Attention to detail and follow through
•	Proficient use of Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel and Windows software
•	Ability to utilize the computer and phone simultaneously with accuracy and efficiency
•	Ability to work independently and in a team environment
•	Ability to maintain a positive attitude when dealing with all customers and co-workers
•	Fast typing skills (40 + WPM)
•	Passion for living an active lifestyle or sports a plus! 

When applying, please submit your salary requirements in your cover letter.

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to sit, talk and hear frequently; use hands and fingers to type, write; reach with hands and arms for tasks such as keyboarding, opening filing cabinets, and some light lifting as necessary.

Seasonal Part Time Shifts Needed - Must be able to work one of the following shifts: 

1. Monday-Friday 3am-9am PST (6am-12pm EST)

2. Monday-Friday 7am-1pm PST (10am-4pm EST) 

3. Monday-Friday 2pm-8pm PST (5pm-11pm EST)

4. Monday-Wednesday 8am-2pm PST (11am-5pm EST) 
Sat 8am-5pm PST (11am-8pm EST) 

5. Wednesday 6am-12pm PST (9am-12pm EST)
Thursday-Friday 8am-2pm PST (11am-5pm EST)
Saturday 8am-5pm PST (11am-8pm EST) 

6. Monday-Tuesday, Friday 12pm-6pm PST (3pm-9pm EST)
Saturday 8am-5pm PST (11am-8pm EST)

Our Company is looking to open 60-80 venues nationally and also multiple locations overseas. If you like to be a part of our team, we are offering the right Restaurant Assistant General Manager a chance to grow with us so don't miss this opportunity located in the Chagrin Falls, Ohio area.

Title of Position: Restaurant Assistant General Manager

Job Description:

Our search for a Restaurant Assistant General Manager is focused on dedicated individuals who are consistently pushing for the highest standards and have a proven record for achieving service excellence. Those who enjoy a small-company-feel, are practiced at developing relationships, and have a steadfast focus on producing quality should apply. Your first exposure is a thorough and rigorous training program in one of our venues. The Restaurant Assistant General Manager candidate will not be expected to be an expert on day one, but will be given many opportunities within a short period of time to display your strength. From Restaurant Assistant General Manager development classes, to mentoring and guidance from your colleagues, we are creating well-rounded restaurateurs who are also savvy business people. You can find great growth opportunities within the company.

Benefits:

Competitive Salary: $50,000 - $60,000+, depending on experience
Medical / Dental Insurance Options
401(k)
Unlimited Growth Opportunity

Qualifications:

*Three plus years of full service casual restaurant General Manager or Assistant General Manager experience in a high volume atmosphere is a must!
*A true desire to mentor and develop others is a trait the Restaurant Assistant General Manager must possess
*The Restaurant Assistant General Manager must be proficient in achieving solid financial goals
*The Restaurant Assistant General Manager must be extremely guest oriented with the highest degree of honesty and integrity
*The Restaurant Assistant General Manager may be required to work some nights/weekends/holidays

Please forward your resume for immediate consideration!!
Compensation: $50,000 - $60,000, plus bonus plan and benefits package

Description:

Title: Building Engineer
Description:
Building Engineer


At CBRE, you are empowered to take your career path into your own hands. Enjoy workplace flexibility in a global organization with tremendous scale. Work in an inclusive and collaborative environment with supportive teammates. Come experience the employee advantage at CBRE.

CBRE has a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

As a Fortune 500 worldwide leader in real estate services, CBRE's more than 70,000 professionals provide exceptional outcomes for clients in 60+ countries. When it comes to real estate, CBRE sees potential everywhere. We turn scale into strength, expense into performance, and property into prosperity. Visit CBRE.com.

With access to top-tier market intelligence, planning, local site selection and asset strategies, our Global Workplace Services offering includes Enterprise Facilities Management (EFM), Project Management (PJM), Advisory & Transaction Services (A&T), and Management Consulting. We offer end-to-end expertise across all workplace types, scalable delivery, a commitment to world-class safety and ongoing innovations in building efficiencies, energy conservation and CRE technology.

Utilizes advanced skills to perform complex preventive maintenance and corrective repair of buildings, industrial systems, vehicles, equipment and grounds. Working under limited supervision, monitors building system operations and performance. Utilizes several trade skills such as carpentry, plumbing, electrical, painting, roofing, heating and cooling.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Complies with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agency and Company directives related to building operations and work safety.

Inspects building systems including fire alarms, HVAC, and plumbing to ensure operation of equipment is within design capabilities and achieves environmental conditions prescribed by client.

Oversees and inspects the work performed by outside contractors. Contracted work includes landscaping, snow removal, remodeling, HVAC, plumbers, and cleaning.

Performs assigned repairs, emergency and preventive maintenance. Completes maintenance and repair records as required.

Reviews assigned work orders. Estimates time and materials needed to complete repair.

Orders necessary materials and supplies to complete all tasks.

Maintains an energy management program to ensure measures are taken to operate all systems in the most efficient manner to keep operating costs at a minimum.

Maintains the building lighting system, including element and ballast repairs or replacements.

Performs welding, carpentry, furniture assembly and locksmith tasks as needed.

Responds quickly to emergency situations, summoning additional assistance as needed.

Performs other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate work and assign tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS
 
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and a minimum of four years of related experience and/or trade school training.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
 
Universal CFC certification is preferred. Additional certification in one or more of the following: electrical, mechanical, HVAC and refrigeration systems, process controls, mechanical power transmissions, painting, plumbing, carpentry or engine repair. Certifications/licenses as may be required by local or state jurisdictions.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
Requires basic knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate simple figures such as percentages.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situation where only limited standardization exists. Requires intermediate analytical skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Uses personal computer and / or PDA for work order system, email, ESS and training. Basic skills with Microsoft Office Outlook. Physical requirements include stooping, standing, walking, climbing stairs / ladders and ability to lift / carry heavy loads of 50 lbs. or more.

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer Women/Minorities/Persons with Disabilities/US Veterans


Apply Online:

Title: Dunbar Armored is hiring for Driver / Guard - Class A CDL!
Description:
Seeking a security-minded individual to fill the position of ARMED CLASS A CDL DRIVER/GUARD at our Cleveland, Ohio armored facility located in Valley View to operate our tractor trailer routes.

* Home every night!
* $16.50/hour with OPOTC Firearms Certificate
* Full-time, Monday - Friday
* Routes average 8 - 10 hours
* Shift starts as early as 1:00 AM and ends as late as 12:00 PM
* Overtime after 40 hours per week
* Competitive starting wage, full benefits package, 401(k)
* Company-supplied uniforms, paid training, paid time off, paid holidays

TO APPLY:

Step 1: Complete the on-line job application and assessment at .

Step 2: Call (216) 642-5700 for more information.

JOB SUMMARY
CDL Driver/Guards are responsible for the safe delivery and pick-up of customer valuables and/or cargo and provide transportation via tractor trailer. This position works Monday-Friday providing daily route service that begins and ends in the home city.
 
The essential functions of this position are:

1. Operate armored trucks in a safe manner, abiding by all federal, state, local and company regulations.

2. Deliver valuables to customers (banks, retail stores, restaurants, etc.). Interact with customers, representing the company in accordance with company standards, maintaining proper conduct, appearance (uniforms), personal hygiene, etc.

3. Complete paperwork accurately and in accordance and in accordance with procedures.

4. Maintain a security awareness at all times, whether driving a vehicle and watching for the hopper or outside of the vehicle delivering shipments to the customer.

5. Receive shipments and cargo at the beginning of the shift and check-in cargo and shipments at the end of the shift to the vault, ensuring the balancing of the receipts.

6. Perform necessary first line maintenance on the vehicle at the beginning and/or end of the shift.

7. May operate runs/routes dedicated to specific needs, i.e. Federal Reserve, BEP (Bureau of Engraving and Printing).

The minimum Knowledge, Education, Experience, Skills, and/or Abilities required to perform this job are, including any physical requirements:

1. Must be at least 21 years of age, per Department of Transportation regulations.

2. Must possess a valid Commercial Driver's License - Class A and maintain current license with a good driving record.

3. 2 -3 years truck driving experience with tractor trailer.

3. Ability to obtain a gun permit, where necessary. (A criminal conviction may prevent issuance of a gun permit.)

4. Experience in security field and/or transportation as a driver is preferred.

5. Must be able to qualify for any other work-related permits required by branch, such as Airport pass, Federal Reserve access, etc.

6. Must be able to read, write and understand English and perform basic math skills. Must have good communication skills and be able to communicate with customers and communicate with one's partner or base location via radio and/or two-way radio.

7. Must be able to lift bagged coin three to five feet, weighing 30-50 pounds a bag, several dozen times daily and carry bags from the vehicle to a customer or back.

8. Must be able to step in and out of an armored truck 40-70 times per day.

Dunbar is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their race, gender, religion, disability, veteran or other protected status. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities.

The essential functions of this position are:

1. Operate armored trucks in a safe manner, abiding by all federal, state, local and company regulations.

2. Deliver valuables to customers (banks, retail stores, restaurants, etc.). Interact with customers, representing the company in accordance with company standards, maintaining proper conduct, appearance (uniforms), personal hygiene, etc.

3. Complete paperwork accurately and in accordance and in accordance with procedures.

4. Maintain a security awareness at all times, whether driving a vehicle and watching for the hopper or outside of the vehicle delivering shipments to the customer.

5. Receive shipments and cargo at the beginning of the shift and check-in cargo and shipments at the end of the shift to the vault, ensuring the balancing of the receipts.

6. Perform necessary first line maintenance on the vehicle at the beginning and/or end of the shift.

7. May operate runs/routes dedicated to specific needs, i.e. Federal Reserve, BEP (Bureau of Engraving and Printing).

The minimum Knowledge, Education, Experience, Skills, and/or Abilities required to perform this job are, including any physical requirements:

1. Must be at least 21 years of age, per Department of Transportation regulations.

2. Must possess a valid Commercial Driver's License - Class A and maintain current license with a good driving record.

3. 2 -3 years truck driving experience with tractor trailer.

3. Ability to obtain a gun permit, where necessary. (A criminal conviction may prevent issuance of a gun permit.)

4. Experience in security field and/or transportation as a driver is preferred.

5. Must be able to qualify for any other work-related permits required by branch, such as Airport pass, Federal Reserve access, etc.

6. Must be able to read, write and understand English and perform basic math skills. Must have good communication skills and be able to communicate with customers and communicate with one's partner or base location via radio and/or two-way radio.

7. Must be able to lift bagged coin three to five feet, weighing 30-50 pounds a bag, several dozen times daily and carry bags from the vehicle to a customer or back.

8. Must be able to step in and out of an armored truck 40-70 times per day.

Dunbar is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their race, gender, religion, disability, veteran or other protected status. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities.
Compensation: $16.50/hour to start, $17.00/hour with OPOTC Firearms Certificate

Description:
employs over 22,000 teammates in North America and operates more than 2,200 company-owned stores.  
Are you a problem solver?  Have you worked hard to build your automotive experience, education and industry knowledge? You've passed the tests, now it is time to put those skills to work!  At Bridgestone we offer the most competitive development program in the industry designed with one thing in mind...YOU! •	Diagnose and repair to specifications - brake and hydraulic, exhaust, primary and/or advanced fuel ignition and electrical, suspension and alignment, air conditioning and computer systems.

•	Assist fellow technicians/mechanics in performing technical activities. 
•	Keep store management aware of mechanical repair problems as they occur. 
•	Maintain an organized and neat bay. 
•	Adhere to all company policy, procedure, safety and environmental rules. 


•	A High School Diploma or GED
•	At least 2-3 years of strong automotive mechanical diagnosis, problem-solving and repair experience. 
•	At least 1 ASE certification is required for this position. 
•	You'll also need a high level of motivation, energy and a customer-focused attitude.
•	Must have a valid driver's license. 
•	Pre-employment drug test/physical/ background check will help assure we build teams of people who can best work with others and serve customer needs.  

   




 

We understand that we offer more than just car service. We rescue people from bad days and we offer solutions for difficult situations. We are people of integrity and we believe that fundamental honesty is the keystone of our business. We are committed to doing the hard work necessary to earn the loyalty of our teammates and our customers by providing a positive experience every time. We are proud and passionate to represent the brand of Bridgestone. 


  To be the most trusted provider of automotive care in every neighborhood we serve. 



Kelly Debrowski

Title: Aseptic Operator
Description:
Position Summary

A Manufacturing Aseptic Operator is responsible for performing all necessary tasks within the classified areas for the manufacture of safe and effective sterile (injectable) pharmaceutical products. This Operator is a role model of quality, culture, and technique within the Aseptic Processing Area (APA), and the driver of day to day activities; in order to meet key performance objectives.  

Key Responsibilities

•	Develop knowledge of and understand regulatory requirements such as 21CFR part 210 and 211, cGMP's, FDA, OSHA and other regulatory agencies.
•	Understand site SOP's and cGMP's relative to the positions within APA, and partner with Quality to ensure processes and products are in compliance with all local, state, and federal rules and regulations.   
•	Participate in all aspects of Manufacturing within the APA core/processes.
•	Set-up, Operation, and troubleshooting of key manufacturing equipment: including (but not limited to) lyophilizer, autoclave, parts washers, filler, capper, CIP/SIP skid, etc.
•	Training compliance and ability to train new/less experienced Operators.
•	Assist in the execution of equipment/process qualification, validation, and protocols.
•	Assist in development and creation of departmental procedures (SOP's).
•	Perform tasks as per established Good Documentation Practices, and review of executed documentation (batch records, logbooks, etc.) prior to the end of the shift.
•	Ensure that daily production is running efficiently, both in terms of output and quality.
•	Oversee that processes are in CGMP compliance, and establish systems that identifies opportunities for improvement and makes constructive suggestions for change to improve process effectiveness to heighten quality.
•	Participate in investigations, and execute appropriate approved corrective / preventative actions for Aseptic Core related processes.
•	Ensure that the current requirements for Environmental, Health, Safety (EHS) issues are met within the production operations.
•	Include relevant stakeholders in decision-making in regards to equipment, processes and other daily operations.
•	Work methodically with an acute awareness of the direct and indirect impact of all actions performed.
•	Personnel engaged in the manufacture, processing, packing, or holding of a drug product shall wear clean clothing appropriate for the duties they perform. Protective apparel, such as head, face, hand, and arm coverings, shall be worn as necessary to protect drug products from contamination.

Requirements
•	High School Diploma or GED preferred
•	3-5 years of related work experience in a regulated environment preferred
•	Strong Leadership skills
•	Strong Mechanical abilities preferred
•	Willingness to work overtime (when required)

 Please apply on : 

Physical Requirements of the Role
Position requires continuous standing and walking.  Frequent bending over and lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs. Must be able to be gown qualified, and wear PPE (including respirator if required).  Any person shown at any time (either by medical examination or supervisory observation) to have an apparent illness or open lesions that may adversely affect the safety or quality of drug products shall be excluded from direct contact with components, drug product containers, closures, in-process materials, and drug products until the condition is corrected or determined by competent medical personnel not to jeopardize the safety or quality of drug products. All personnel shall be instructed to report to supervisory personnel any health conditions that may have an adverse effect on drug products.
