Title: Fabrication Lead 2nd Shift
Description:
This position is responsible for the daily shop level personnel tasking and work flow organizing of the planned production activity. This is primarily an on the floor position to provide guidance and assistance to the fabrication work area leads. Ensure the effective allocation of time and resources to accomplish efficient fabrication production. Maintain production coordination with the manufacturing support departments and overall plant management. Keep a focus on safety, quality and production costs. Work with the fab area leads to improve production methods for cost and quality. Instruct and mentor subordinates for technical and professional development. Assist in training. Provide feedback to the team members in conjunction with the area leads.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supervise fabrication department, which includes supervision over all machine operators and equipment used in manufacturing such as press brakes, turret presses, lasers, punch presses, and specialty equipment.
Develop and implement equipment and tooling plan to increase automation, improve quality and reduce labor. Project priority should be based on capacity bottlenecks, ROI and budget constraints.
In charge of all the day to day operations of machinery and tooling including repair, scheduled maintenance and purchasing of tooling, shop supplies and steel.
Manage CNC programmer to optimize programs for two Finn Power C5 turret presses and several Cincinnati press brakes.
Make sure all operators and leads are properly trained on equipment.
Implementing continuous improvement strategies while adhering to lean manufacturing principles.
Track and monitor daily production quotas while making adjustments in equipment and labor resources to continually improve efficiency and productivity. Share findings and results with management team. Schedule and monitor the work output of the second shift. Meet with second shift lead each day to review prior shift results and give work assignments for the new shift

Title: FIELD UNDERWRITER POSITION AVAILABLE - 100K to 120K FIRST YEAR
Description:
employment type: full-time or part-time

I am looking for a motivated field underwriter in the Cleveland area.  He/She must be passionate about improving their situation and also be passionate about helping others.  I am looking for a team player, yet a strong leader.  Someone who is willing to learn and apply new skills for this sales opportunity.

Each week we mail thousands of letters to people who just bought or refinanced a home in your area. Our letter clearly states that the client may qualify for a non-medical, mortgage protection product. We will pay off the mortgage in the event of their death or even make the mortgage payments in case of a disability or critical illness.  And at the end of the term they will receive all of their money back! 

Clients interested in our product will personally fill out our questionnaire and then mail it back to us.  

So, we need an individual who will take the letters we receive, call the homeowner to set up an appointment, and then go sit down with them at their home for about 45 minutes in order to help them pick out the best mortgage protection plan that fits their budget. 

Absolutely, no cold-calling! 

Typically, commission is about $450.00 per family you protect. Yes, it is full commission, but our average full-time underwriter will sell 5 to 7 mortgage protection plans a week.  You will always be sitting in front of interest, qualified buyers!  

Additionally, Fixed Indexed Annuities and Indexed Universal Life Policies are available for clients wanting to protect and grow their retirement savings.  Our training is comprehensive and you will be mentored every step of the way.  

I'm also looking for that special person who may want to build their own agency.  If you are willing to devote yourself to developing the leadership skills necessary as a manager, your income potential for this position is unlimited. Many of our managers have a passive income and will have it for life.  

You will need a state life insurance license or be willing to acquire one.  This should normally take you about two weeks.

If you meet the above requirements, please call me.  Be prepared to tell me about yourself and, more importantly, what is it about this position that interests you most.  I look forward to speaking with you.  

Please do not send a resume.  

Please do not send a text.

Call Grace Webb at 954-328-2708 between 7:30am to 8:30pm  Monday - Sunday

Title: ADMINISTRATIVE GENERALIST - KOPPLIN, KUEBLER & WALLACE
Description:
KOPPLIN, KUEBLER AND WALLACE the nation's premier Private Club Search and Consulting firm is currently looking for an experienced:
 

ADMINISTRATIVE GENERALIST
Job Brief
Kopplin, Kuebler & Wallace is seeking to fill a newly created position to enhance and support the firm's Search and Thought Leadership goals. This position is many things: Administrative Assistant, Partner Support and Marketing Developer / Coordinator. 
Job Description
We are looking for an experienced individual capable of overseeing a variety of administrative, operational and creative functions.  The incumbent must have exceptional time management, organizational and communication skills and thrive working independently.
Immediate Responsibilities Include:
•	Manage client to partner/partner to client communications including both written and phone contact
o	Provide follow up conversations with potential and identified candidates for each search assignment
o	Take forwarded calls from search directors and forward appropriate information to potential clients and candidates
o	Develop proposals/RFI's as directed by Partners
•	Manage candidate onboarding (screening/process orientation/communication/logistics/follow up)
o	Call potential new candidates and help to develop new sources of club management talent
•	Develop and implement strategies aiming to promote the organization's mission and "voice", primarily through Partner 
        speaking and presentation engagements, and other promotional means
•	Direct and oversee the distribution of marketing materials
o	Develop written materials, at the direction of the Partner, for each search assignment from beginning through conclusion
•	Create and publish firm newsletter 
•	Ghost Writing for Partner. Assist in writing articles for trade magazine and presentations for speaking engagements and 
        media support
•	Bookkeeping support for Partners (expense reports, billing etc.) 
•	Presentation preparation as needed, mostly in PPTX format, but others as needed
•	Forge and maintain relations of trust with clients and partners
•	Act as public relations representative of the company in ways that strengthen its profile in the industry
•	Devise remedial actions for any identified issues and conduct crisis management when necessary
•	Ensure procedures are implemented and in place for the effective management of all client communications and follow up
•	Develop and enhance social media presence
•	Create, maintain and distribute sales and marketing collateral
•	Help develop consulting processes (checklists) and best practices
•	Provide administrative support where needed and other duties as designed

Requirements
•	Independent Contractor with the ability to work from home and support a home office
•	Familiarity with the Club industry, along with having worked in it in a leadership capacity is highly preferred
•	Experience in developing strategies and plans
•	Ability to work independently in any setting
•	Available to work a flexible schedule, with some nights and weekends, committed to quick turnaround times
•	Maintain professional and hospitality standards in communication and branding
•	Ability to apply successful networking techniques
•	Understanding of basic bookkeeping and QuickBooks
•	Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
•	Proficiency in public relations, i.e. press releases and social media 
•	In depth knowledge of corporate governance principles and managerial best practices
•	An analytical mind capable for "out-of-the-box" thinking to solve problems
•	Proficiency in creative design
•	Understanding of Microsoft Suite and general software applications 
•	Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities
•	Degree in relevant field or at least 5 years of proven ability is desired

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN APPLYING, PLEASE REPLY TO THIS POSTING AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE.

We are family-owned and operated since 1972. Our founder was a Truck Driver who still comes to the office every day. We began transporting dry bulk freight from our Ohio headquarters. We still provide the same culture our founder installed many years ago. We deliver an outstanding work-life balance that attracts dedicated employees to Bulk Transit, and for the same reason they are staying for a long-lasting career. We are the best of both worlds: "not too big and not too small."

Title: Associate Technical Account Manager
Description:
Yardi Systems in Broadview Heights, OH is searching for a full time Associate Technical Account Manager to join their growing team!

The Associate Technical Account Manager will design, perform, and manage client software implementations, provide end-user training, customer support, and troubleshoot client issues; Document software defects and validate their resolution once corrected by programming. Translate unmet client needs into requirements for possible inclusion into future software releases. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Key contributor in the implementation and ongoing management of software solutions for Yardi clients, as well as the analysis and resolution of client issues by:      
Understanding client needs, business requirements, and priorities
Proactively owning and driving client implementations
Providing support to client inquiries related to complex software application questions and/or issues and ensuring customer expectations are exceeded
Determining if client issues are attributed to programming defects, inaccurate data, or client business practices
Developing solution recommendations based on clients' business needs in conjunction with the software product roadmap
Writing and executing SQL statements to understand and/or resolve data specific issues, if necessary
Leverage other program tools to implement and support the assigned applications (e.g., import data, request database backups and restores, etc.)
Identifying and owning client issues and seeing them through resolution
Providing analysis of customer issues to the development team, including steps to recreate the problem and the desired process outcome
Recording application support issues in the issue tracking system
Participating in quality assurance testing of resolved issues        
Assists the product manager with analysis and prioritization of product defects and enhancement requests for scheduling to future software releases
Participates in functionality testing of new software features
Articulates and documents unmet clients' needs for consideration as future software enhancements

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
Strong customer service skills
Strong project management skills
Strong analytical and problem solving abilities
Attention to detail
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Excellent English communication skills, written and verbal
Self-motivated team player
3+ years of professional work experience preferred
Accounting and/or finance related experience preferred
Ability to define, write, and execute SQL statements a plus
Experience with enterprise-level property, financial, and/or CRM systems a plus

PLEASE APPLY TO: 

Yardi Systems is a successful independent software company with a proven history of growth and market leadership in the multi-billion dollar global commercial real estate industry. We employ talented, motivated and innovative people that are focused on delivering superior solutions to our clients and are passionate about working with other highly skilled professionals in team environments.

If you are seeking an opportunity to join a winning team, work with the latest Microsoft technologies and develop your career, then Yardi Systems is the place for you. We have a pleasant and casual work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our corporate culture stresses integrity, respect, trust, responsibility, and fun.

Magnum offers Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance and a competitive 401K program, and also offers passenger and pet policies.

Title: 6 WEEKS OF FREE TRUCK PAYMENTS + A $500 SIGN ON BONUS!
Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! We'll tell it to you straight -- we have an awesome program -- we're proud of it -- you'll like working here, but it won't all be sunshine and rainbows.  What we can offer you is a good job; stability; good equipment; a down-to-earth, kick a@@ company owner who genuinely cares about drivers. We have a solid lease purchase program -- you won't be rich but you're going to be earning a good living, and you'll have the pride of owning your own truck.  




 


Let us tell you a little about our program. We offer two lease options:







  


  

We offer full service, 100%, bumper-to-bumper warranty on all of our equipment.  This means that drivers will never again have to pay out of pocket for maintenance, oil changes, PM's, or any repair bills while they are working towards paying the truck off.  Breakdowns will never break the bank! 


 

  
We offer new equipment.  The oldest truck in our fleet is a 2014.  We offer 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017s! :



 

  
For orientation, we provide you with a rental car or flight to one of our terminals.  We put you in a PRIVATE ROOM, in a nice hotel!  We provide all your meals while you're here.

Title: Senior Secretary
Description:
Presidents Office looking for Sharp, Experienced Administrative Assistant

Job Duties:
Greet and respond to visitors and callers routing to correct person and/or location or providing specific departmental information and general college-wide information.

Perform secretarial tasks: produce both simple and complex documents using various word processing and spreadsheet packages; establish and maintain files; schedule meetings and appointments; take and transcribe meeting minutes; sort and distribute mail; process college forms.

Compose replies to routine correspondence; research and compile reports and prepare summaries as requested. Generate, process, and/or forward college paperwork as required relying upon accepted policies and practices; determine documents requiring supervisor's review and/or signature.

Update and maintain computerized databases by performing data entry, adding and deleting files as needed and generating simplistic computer reports.

Provide support to standing committees or ad hoc task forces by scheduling meetings; preparing agendas; recording, transcribing, and distributing minutes; maintaining master files; etc.

Plan and implement special events such as receptions, dinners, or open houses.

Provide secretarial support for special projects; compile information; and produce reports.

Maintain adequate quantities of office supplies and materials.

Perform related duties as assigned.

What we are looking for:

Education/Training and Experience Required/Preferred

Associate's degree in office administration or another field complemented by additional post-high school secretarial training, three years of secretarial experience and well developed word processing skills.

An equivalent combination of education and experience that provides the knowledge, skills and abilities is acceptable.

B. 	Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of modern office practices, procedures, and equipment; basic principles of office management; correct English usage; proper document formats; proficient in current office software (i.e. Word, WordPerfect, Excel).

Skills in oral and written communications; preparing reports, operating word processing equipment; keyboarding at 55 NWPM; composing routine correspondence; maintaining files; updating and maintaining a database.

Abilities to maintain office decorum and confidentiality; operate standard office equipment; perform routine and detailed tasks in an accurate and efficient manner; meet deadlines; work independently; maintain effective interpersonal working relationships.

Mon-Fri 8-5

If interested please send resume to selm@hartmanpersonnel.com

Title: Paid On The Job Training!!
Description:
Get Paid While You Get Your CDL
Looking to become a professional truck driver? 
Join Roehl and you'll be paid $500 a week as you get your CDL. You are hired and paid as an employee on day 1.
You'll earn while you learn in our four-week CDL training program, located at our local terminal.
Once you have your CDL, you'll continue getting paid on the job training with a Certified Driver Trainer (between 2-3 weeks). From there, Roehl drivers with only nine months on the job are making $50,000 or more a year.  After you have your CDL, you'll start your on-the-job training as a long haul truck driver.
Join our team and grow with us!
If you were to go to a CDL school, you would not get paid while you are training AND you'd have to come up with the tuition for the school.  We're a stable company that provides full benefits - we invest in you.
Because the demand for this popular program is so strong, the first step is to complete our Get Started form on Roehl.Jobs  

If you contact Roehl by email, please include your first name, last name, email address, phone number, zip code and if you already have Class A CDL in your message so we can connect with you. You can also provide this information on our website.
You will then move through a learning and application process, where we ensure that you have a good understanding of the program, the basic qualifications and the characteristics of a truck driving job with Roehl so you can complete a thoughtful and informed application.
Premium Benefits
Roehl offers a complete benefits package to truck drivers, including one of the top profit-sharing contributions among US trucking companies, to support drivers and their families. In a truck driving job with Roehl, you'll find our benefits both comprehensive and affordable. Learn more about our pay, benefits and why so many experienced truck drivers choose Roehl. 
Career Path Opportunities
Want to advance your career? Whether you're an experienced driver, an owner operator or just starting out in the industry, with Roehl you'll find a wide variety of options both inside and out of the truck. Dedicated fleets offer many unique schedule, pay and freight options. In certain areas, local truck driving positions are regularly available for drivers with six months experience. You can also become a Certified Driver Trainer. From owning your own business to becoming an instructor - including non-driving positions  - your career path with Roehl is filled with options. 
 
About Roehl Transport and our Truck Driving Jobs
Roehl Transport provides professional truck driving jobs for those who are looking for a long-lasting career with a forward-thinking, driver-oriented company that is built on values. Our truck driver jobs include all levels of experience, as well as flatbed/specialized, van, refrigerated, and curtainside cargo.
•         Experienced Company Truck Drivers
•         Owner Operators
•         New Drivers CDL School Graduates
•         Learn to Drive a Truck (We will pay you while you get your CDL)
Roehl also provides career opportunities for non-drivers. Roehl is one of the 100 largest trucking companies in the nation. Our customers include some of the most prestigious brand names in America.

When you join Roehl you'll be part of a hands-on family business with people that are passionate about delivering the goods that drive America - we're giving trucking a new name.
Roehl Transport
Our drivers are leaders. 
Our leader is a driver.
Keyword search: Driving, transportation, drivers, cdla, cdl-a, class a, truckers, job, truck driver jobs, driving jobs near me, local truck driving jobs, best companies to drive for, salary, paid truck driver job, truck driving school, commercial learning permit, CDL training schedule, student truck driver jobs, paid CDL-A truck driver training, paid training

Title: Receptionist Needed Full Time
Description:
WE WANT YOU! Roadmaster Drivers School, a Premier National Commercial Truck Driver Training School and subsidiary of Werner Enterprises, Inc., is currently seeking a high-energy, enthusiastic Receptionist to join our Richfield, OH campus. 

What We Offer: 

•	Immediate full time position
•	Competitive wages
•	Health Insurance
•	Dental Insurance 
•	401(k) Retirement Plan 
•	Company provided life and AD&D insurance
•	Employee Perks Program through Abenity®
•	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
•	Paid sick time
•	Paid vacation time and other benefits
•	Opportunities for advancement

Job Requirements & Responsibilities:
The Receptionist is the first person students and visitors to our campus encounter. Our ideal candidate will be an upbeat, positive individual with the desire to provide high quality services to our students and staff.  In addition to the responsibilities listed be below, the Receptionist will assist the Office Administrator in the administrative department and provide clerical support to other staff as needed. 

Responsibilities include:
•	Welcoming and greeting customers as well as being a "brand ambassador" for RDS
•	Answering multi-line phone system
•	Distributing calls to appropriate personnel 
•	Maintaining and inputting accurate lead information in lead database
•	Data entry
•	Preparation of various reports
•	Filing, scanning and other standard clerical tasks as assigned 
•	Management of front lobby area
•	Assisting the School Director, employees and students with clerical support as needed

Qualifications:
•	Minimum High School graduate or equivalent 
•	Must have verifiable office administrative experience preferably in clerical & office information systems
•	Strong organizational skills
•	Strong customer service skills
•	Clear and effective written and verbal communications using phone and email
•	Excellent attention to detail
•	Good time management skills and ability to complete work in a timely, accurate, and thorough manner
•	Works well in a team environment
•	Able to maintain confidential information and other privacy concerns
•	Must have computer skills and proficiency in Word, Excel, Outlook

GET YOUR CAREER ON THE ROAD TO SUCCESS TODAY!!! If you are looking for a rewarding career as part of a winning team providing first class training services to the next generation of professional truck drivers look no further!  

Qualified candidates, please send resume, experience and qualifications to:

betsyb@careerpathtraining.com


Roadmaster Drivers School is a Drug-Free Workplace.   Successful completion of a company approved pre-employment drug screen is required of all candidates as part of the hiring process.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Women's Retail Assistant
Description:
Are you outgoing and enjoy a fast paced work environment with a great team of people who "have fun and get it done"? If so, we are looking for an addition to our growing small business team! Our Women's Retail Assistant position will challenge and reward the right person with a sense of accomplishment each and every day. This position will touch most aspects of our online retail business including:
 
o	Receiving, sorting and checking in the new women's fashion inventory that arrives every day
o	Carefully package and ship orders to our amazing customers
o	Helping customers that have questions on Facebook or via email
o	Assisting with inventory management and styling over 35 product lines
o	Share management responsibilities within a 45,000 member Facebook group
 
Here are some of the capabilities we feel are important to be successful in this unique position:
 
o	Amazing customer service - polite and fast written responses to customer requests and issues
o	Excellent written communication skills...we don't take or receive phone calls.
o	Decision making - able to decide what needs to be done to take care of the customer/situation.
o	Familiar with a retail work environment, hours and schedule. 
o	Must be able to work quickly, efficiently and accurately because well...it's fast paced!
o	Comfortable multitasking several projects at one time.
o	Must be able to work independently for those rare occasions your alone
o	Expert level Facebook user
o	Windows computer basics such as copy/paste, website navigation and fast typing
o	Lift and carry 40 pounds up and down stairs
 
This position will work from a home office located in Newbury. Hours and schedule will vary with between 36-40 hours per week. Some weekends (Saturday) may be required. If you feel you're the right person for this great opportunity, please email your qualifications or resume. 
 
Starting wage is commensurate on experience.

Title: Machine Operator (Press Brake)
Description:
Trailer Component Manufacturing, a Division of Buyers Products Company, and a growing   OEM trailer component manufacturer is seeking hard-working, dependable candidates with some manufacturing experience to join their Team as Press Brake Operators.    

Duties & Responsibilities   

•  Responsible for producing parts from metal by making precision bends, punches or cuts into material
•  Make adjustments necessary to machine to control speed, material, feed and path of cut
•  Ensure machine is producing quality parts and make necessary adjustments
•  Ensue machine is working to full capacity, stocked with needed materials
•  Quality check finished product to ensure it is ready for next step of production process You need 
•  Inspection of parts with protractor, calipers, height gauge
•  Read blue prints and product plans to ensure proper set up
•  Understand CAD/CAM technology
•  Follow safety procedures of the facility
•  Meet necessary production numbers 
•  Other related duties as assigned    

Skills & Experience

•  GED or High School diploma required, certificate from a technical or vocational school is preferred.  
•  2-3 years of experience in a manufacturing environment; preferably operating a press brake or sheet metal fabrication.  
•  Math Skills: Good math skills will help press brake operators understand complex instructions, how schematics work and make sure items are designed and built correctly.
•  Problem Solving Skills: Press brake operators will need to know why machines are not at peak performance, how to increase output and how to fix errors.
•  Attention to Detail: Press brakes are precision equipment. Being off by millimeters could be a critical error. Keen attention to detail is required.
•  Mechanical and Technical Skills: MUST understand CAD/CAM technology.
•  Stamina: Press brake operators often work long hours doing repetitive movements.

SUCCESSFUL Candidates will demonstrate the following; 

•  A high sense of urgency & integrity
•  Be a productive member of the Team
•  Demonstrate passion toward job/company
•  Be self motivated 
•  Flexible/Adaptable to a fast-pace, changing environment    

All positions are long-term temporary - direct hire with the client. Throughout assignment the Company is committed to:

•  Providing necessary training
•  Ensuring a safe environment 
•  Reviewing performance
•  Rewarding performance based on meritocracy
•  Retaining the best in the industry

ONLY INQUIRIES WITH RESUMES WILL BE REVIEWED

Title: Uber Driver Partner Needed (Flexible Hours & Weekly Pay)
Mechanical Assembler
Description:
Mechanical Assembler

Over the years, our company has grown to become one of the top manufacturers around. What makes us an industry leader is our ability to hire and train individuals that are willing to reach their full potential. With our top tier manufacturing plant, we have been able to sustain growth and add talented individuals to our team.

This position will require experience working with machinery. Individuals must be able to handle a physical working environment where you will work on your feet for an entire shift. The position will include working in a variety of functions that include, but are not limited to: operating presses and other machinery, operating tow motors, and mixing raw materials.

We are looking to fill the position of Mechanical Assembler immediately. Our current openings are available for all shifts and are full time, permanent opportunities.

Mechanical Assembler Qualifications

•	Must have a great mechanical aptitude
•	Must have mechanical assembly experience
•	Demonstrate abilities in communications, problem solving, and decision making
•	Must have experience working with hand tools
•	Experience working with micrometers, calipers, and blue prints is a plus, though not required
•	Ability to work overtime and weekends, as needed
•	Must be able to work independently in order to get the job done
•	Must be eager to learn and grow within a company
•	Must have reliable Transportation
•	Must possess a strong work ethic

Mechanical Assembler Benefits

•	Health benefits after a probationary period
•	Paid vacation after a probationary period
•	Paid holidays after a probationary period
•	Guaranteed Overtime
•	Promotion opportunities
•	Cross training opportunities
•	Overtime opportunities

Mechanical Assembler Pay

•	Up to $16.00 an hour based on experience

Title: ENTRY LEVEL MACHINE OPERATORS
Description:
Macedonia Plastics Company is in need of entry level Machine Operators. 

DUTIES MAY INCLUDE:
•	Start machines, monitor their operations, and record operational data.
•	Examine completed work pieces for defects, such as chipped edges or marred surfaces and sort defective pieces according to types of flaws.

Temp-to-hire. 
8 and 12 hour shifts available!

$9.50/hr.

Title: LOOKING FOR LUXURY AUTOMOTIVE PURCHASING AGENT! NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED!
Description:
We are a licensed and bonded dealership located in Chicago, Illinois. We do business all over the world. WE export high end luxury vehicles Worldwide! Now we are seeking qualified individuals to act as purchasing agents for luxury cars. Our company provides all funds needed for the transaction and pays a commission for your services. (WE DO NOT NEED YOU TO PUT UP ANY MONEY) Dealerships are not allowed to sell directly to re-sellers so you will be contracted by our company to act as a local go-between to facilitate the transaction.

MINIMUM AGE OF 35+ AND A VALID DRIVERS LICENSE REQUIRED

The ideal candidate will possess a professional demeanor and appearance, with experience negotiating large purchases.

YOU GET TO WORK ON YOUR OWN TIME AND WHEN YOU WANT TO WORK!! 95 PERCENT OF OUR EMPLOYEES WORK FROM HOME!!

Attention to details and clear, effective communication is key to this business.

We pay industry leading commissions and excellent referral fees, so we encourage all of our buyers to recommend people for our program. The majority of our business has been grown with friends and family through word of mouth, but we are always happy to expand the team.

WE HAVE INDIVIDUALS MAKING $10K A MONTH WORKING LITTLE AS 10 HOURS A WEEK!!

***PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR REAL EMAIL IN THE REPLY OR WE WILL NOT RESPOND BACK***

Have experience in working and cleaning automatic slicers

Professional, courteous, well mannered, pleasant to work with
Begin asap, part time

Title: Shipping and Recieving
Description:
Shipping and Receiving Associate

This company is known for their quality and exceptional customer service. They are committed to producing superior products. That is why they are looking for qualified Shipping and Receiving Associates who are driven and take pride in the work they perform.  Shipping and Receiving Associates will be pulling products from work orders as well as assisting in packaging and shipping.

They need employees who understand that each member of the team is important and that by working together they can continue to meet and exceed their customers' expectations.

Shipping and Receiving Associate Requirements

•	Must be able to work over-time when required
•	Must be able to read and understand written orders
•	Must be detail-oriented and able to work at a fast pace
•	Must have reliable transportation
•	Must have a strong work ethic
•	Individuals who are able to lift up to 30 lbs
•	Must be able to work independently and in a timely manner

Shipping and Receiving Associate Compensation and Benefits

•	They offer a comprehensive package of benefits, which include medical, dental, vision, and life insurance after a probationary period
•	They offer opportunities for advancement and career development for dedicated, hardworking employees
•	This position offers an hourly rate of up to $13.00 based on experience
Compensation: Full Time, $13 hr based on experience

Title: **PICK/PACK POSITIONS*** STARTING AT 9/HR**
Description:
Snider-Blake is currently looking to fill a pick/pack position for our client in the Euclid area. This a first shift position from 6AM-2:30PM Monday through Friday with occasional overtime. Must have previous pick/pack experience. Pay rate is between $9-$11 based on experience. 


Snider-Blake is currently looking to fill 1st shift and 2nd receiving/pick-pack positions for our client in the Cleveland area. 1st shift is 7AM-3:30PM pay is $10/hr, 2nd is 3PM-11:30PM and pay is $11/hr.
You will be responsible for using paper pickets and labels, stacking and wrapping product and staging and loading for shipping. You will be using a electric rider pallet jack. Must have previous order selecting experience, good work history and be able to lift 30-40 pounds. MUST HAVE AWESOME ATTENDANCE AND HIGH ATTENTION TO DETAIL AND YOUR OWN CAR.


Come in and mention our craigslist referral bonus to receive a $25 bonus after working for 80 consecutive hours!!Also receive a $10 bonus after working your first full day of work and also receive a $15 bonus after working a consecutive 40 hours. You can't have any attendance issues to be eligible for this bonus. 

**Must bring in 1 state and 1 federal ID such as a state ID and social security card or birth certificate. **
**Must pass drug test and background test**
***APPPLYYY NOWWWW***
Walk-ins welcome Monday-Friday 9A-2:30P
Snider-Blake Personnel
4200 Rockside Road
Suite 206
Independence, OH 44131
216-362-4949

Title: HVAC Technician Needed - Immediate Easy Job and Fast Payment
Description:
Hi,
I am in need of an HVAC technician who can pull a permit for a furnace that was installed by another company on a job I am in charge of. The furnace was already inspected and found to be installed correctly, but I need someone to pull the permit because the tech I originally hired did not and turns out, he can't. I can pay immediately, the job would just consist of meeting me at the property so you can see the furnace for yourself, then going to the city of maple heights to pull the permit (you would need to register with the city if you are not currently) I can pay for all permits and registration fees, as well as compensate you for your time immediately.

Let me know if you are interested by replying to this ad with you name and phone number. I am looking to have this job done by beginning of next week, so it would be a fast, easy job with good pay.

Thank you

Title: SKIPTHEDISHES ● FLEXIBLE HOURS ● FOOD DELIVERY ● PAID WEEKLY
Standard Mail Coordinator
Description:
The standard mail coordinator will be the single point of contact for standard mail customers.  The coordinator works with both internal and external customers and is responsible for the following duties: 
* Work alongside the account executive to set up new accounts and sub accounts after signed paperwork from a new customer
* Daily client communications-in person, email, and phone
* Working with the customers to get a mail schedule 1 week out
* Working with the customers to receive data 4 days previous to mailing
* Working with the customers and Midwest Shipping department to get mail picked up and delivered to Midwest based on cut off times
* Working with the customers when problems arise on the customer's side
* Provide the CMD (Customer Mail Detail report) to the customer within 48 hours of the mail drop
* Production Coordinating
* Creates and Updates production schedule based on drop
* Updates and verifies receipt of all postage before mail is entered into the system
* Verify and reconcile customer postage balances
* Invoice and customer billing
* All other duties as assigned

Basis Skills Required
Proficient with Word, Excel, Email, Google Docs
Communication Skills to work with clients and internal department heads
Accounting skills- Reconciliation
Ability to  multitask and prioritize
Work under deadlines

MEMBER SERVICES REPRESENTATIVE
Location: Richmond Heights, OH

Type: Part Time


Job Summary

The Member Services Representative will be responsible for creating a positive member experience by providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

Greet members, prospective members and guests, providing exceptional customer service.
Handle all front desk related activities including:
Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions.
Check members into the system.
New member sign-up.
Take prospective members on tours.
Facilitate needed updates to member's accounts.
Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner and elevate to Assistant Manager or Manager as needed.
Assist in maintaining the neatness and cleanliness of the club.

Customer service background preferred.
Basic computer proficiency.
A passion for fitness and health.
Upbeat and positive attitude!
Punctuality and reliability is a must.
Exceptional customer service skills; able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member's expectations.
Strong listener with the ability to empathize and problem solve.
Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language.
High School diploma/GED equivalent required.
Must be 18 years of age or older.
Physical Demands 

Continual standing and walking during shift.
Continual talking in person or on the phone during shift.
Must be able to occassionally lift up to 50 lbs.
Will occasionally encounter toxic chemicals during shift

Title: Drive Thru Beverage Store
Description:
We are a family owned and operated drive thru beverage store looking to hire a full time and/or part time team member. Shifts available are from 4 pm to 10.00 weekdays and Saturday/Sunday 1 to 10.00. It is fine if you are available only on Saturday and/or Sunday. 

Job Responsibilities:
* Someone that enjoys interaction with people and understands the importance of consistently providing accurate, efficient customer service for every customer every time.
* Taking product orders from customers, getting product from coolers, displays etc. and ringing up into register and collecting payment from customers in a efficient and accurate manner.
* Help other team members, with stocking coolers, displays and maintaining a clean environment for our customers.

Physical & Work Environment:
* walking, bending, standing, lifting. You will get exercise for free with this job. If you feel that this is hard work, then this job is not for you.

Summary:
* We have a great team of good people and are looking to bring on someone to enhance this. Our team members enjoy coming to work and it shows.  Someone who enjoys providing exceptional customer service will find this job to be very rewarding. We are a drug free work place and we will conduct a criminal background check. Please send resume and/or work history.

You may also stop in at our store, 1304 Pearl Rd Brunswick
Compensation: $8.75 per hour plus $1.00 or more per hour in tips

Title: Outside Veterinary Sales (Cleveland)
Description:
Trupanion is seeking experienced, pet passionate people to be Territory Partners throughout the United States!

A Trupanion Territory Partner serves as a consultant to Trupanion, and is the exclusive representative for our pet health insurance product within a specified area. Our territories are EXCLUSIVE; we have one Partner per territory.

As a Territory Partner, you will be an independent business owner who earns revenue from Trupanion while helping veterinarians and pet owners provide the highest quality medical care to their pets. This is truly an opportunity where you can make a difference. You will be a significant link between veterinary hospitals and our company. Territory Partners build relationships and educate veterinarians, vet techs, and office staff about how having clients who are insured by Trupanion will not only benefit their practice, but also the lives of the companion animals and families they serve.


A Territory Partner will:

Possess a strong entrepreneurial drive, including an attitude of persistence and patience, and be comfortable with sales.
Be a subject matter expert on the animal health industry and day-to-day operations of veterinary hospitals.
Have a thorough understanding of the entire companion animal medical insurance industry, including the Trupanion product.
Manage an aggressive sales cycle, while spending time on the road, visiting clinics and veterinary hospitals within the territory.
Build and maintain relationships with veterinary clinics, hospitals and veterinary staff.
Have experience building a book of business and breaking open a new market/territory.

Desired traits for a Territory Partner:

Pet passionate, with a strong belief in our mission to give responsible pet owners the ability to provide the best care for their pet when it becomes sick or injured.
An eagerness to learn effective sales techniques
Financially comfortable with commission and long-term recurring residual revenue model.
Strong presentation skills
Understanding of the inner workings of veterinary clinics is a big plus.
Preference given to those who are experienced in field sales, territory development, and building a business.


Compensation:
100% commission plus residual, with the option for a monthly guarantee

*If you're interested in learning more about this great opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter.
Compensation: 100% commission plus residual, with the option for a monthly guarantee

Title: Part-Time Administrative Assistant
Description:
Local CEO (business owner and entrepreneur) is seeking a part-time Administrative Assistant to support him in the day-to-day operations of his business interests.   While this is a work from home position, the candidate will meet with the CEO regularly or be asked to attend meetings in northeast Ohio, primarily the west side of Cleveland (Lakewood, West Park), so easy access to that area is preferred.  

The essential tasks of the Administrative Assistant will include:

1.  Setting up meetings, including providing agendas, attending meetings to take notes, sending recaps and following up on action items. 
2.  Special independent projects and studies to support or refute new concepts and ideas
3.  Taking the place of CEO at some meetings, ability to understand CEO mindset, and present it effectively as the "easier to deal with" proxy,  more laid back alternate 
4.  Responding to calls, emails and other inquiries on behalf of the CEO. 
5.  Consolidating information to provide reports and business performance metrics. 
6.  Coordinating the business owner's calendar, tasks and commitments, helping to keep him focused on rapidly changing priorities. 
7.  Partnering with other staff members and associates to resolve challenges as necessary. 
8.  Typing correspondence, formatting spreadsheets and presentations. 
9.  Performing other administrative tasks as necessary.  

Desired attributes for probable success include:

A.  Comfortable with a peer to peer working relationship.  We don't work on a basis of "bosses and employees", but rather with partners, contractors and professional best friends.
B.  A positive, "can-do" attitude; the ability to partner with others on projects and tasks; and the ability to proactively bring forth creative solutions to problems.
C.  Should enjoy a playful style of leadership and management while simultaneously being able to respond to the intensity to move forward on underlying production of various projects. We believe that not taking oneself too seriously is critical to a satisfying team experience.
D.  Ability to support flow of visionary and creative thinking while tactfully bringing into focus some of the challenges at the appropriate time which is usually in a post creative "role up the sleeves" session 
E.  Functional Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook. 
F.  Superior organizational and follow-through skills with a strong attention to detail and great time-management skills. 
G.  Top-knotch verbal and written communication skills. 
H.  Proven track record of good performance and attendance at prior jobs. 
I.  Experience managing a busy senior executive's calendar would be highly preferred, but not necessary. 
J.  Must be trustworthy, with a high degree of integrity; will be exposed to sensitive information, so must approach work with a high degree of tact and confidentiality. 

This part-time position is a minimum of 10 hours per week, with a high maximum of 20-25 hours per week during very busy times (rare).   The position affords a significant degree of flexibility for the right candidate with most of the work able to take place remotely and during regular business hours.  Meetings will be set in advance that will require the Assistant to be present either in person or via teleconference; CEO will work with the right candidate to determine work hours outside of those meetings on a case-by-case basis. 

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to get involved in meaningful work while still having flexibility in their days. 

Interested candidates should send resume, along with per hour salary range requirements, via email.

Title: Structural Steel Welder
Description:
Pay rate $18-$22/hr                          Work schedule M-F  6:00am to 2:30pm  some overtime required

JOB SUMMARY:
Safely and accurately assemble and weld structural steel and detail components together per customer supplied drawing specifications.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPOSNIBILITIES:
•	Move parts into position, manually or with hoists or cranes. 
•	Must be able to read construction blueprints. Interpret and apply shop drawing information, including weld symbol designations, with minimal supervision.
•	Must have the ability to layout and mark steel for fabrication purposes.
•	Weld moderately complex items with minimal supervision.
•	Lift or move materials and finished products, using large cranes.  
•	Remove high spots and cut bevels, using hand files, portable grinders, and cutting torches.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

•	Perform all duties in a safe manner; support all safety and environmental rules 
•	Participate in Lean initiatives to provide ongoing continuous improvement ideas for products, process, and procedures
•	Assist and train other employees when necessary
 
 
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
•	HS diploma or equivalent
•	Excellent attendance record
•	Must have a good attendance record and be an effective team player
•	Must provide documentation as a certified welder (Stick, MIG, and TIG)
•	Must have a valid driver's license and own transportation
•	Must be able to pass a drug test
•	This position is performed in a Manufacturing environment. The employee will work around moving mechanical equipment; may be exposed to fumes and airborne particles. Indoor Warehouse temperatures may be affected by outdoor conditions. Noise level is moderate to loud

Title: Professional Portrait Photographer for Online Dating Portraits
Description:
We're looking for experienced, professional portrait photographers in and around the Cleveland area, with great people skills, to join our team. Only contact us if you have been in the business for at least five years and have experience working with clients in their mid 20's - early 60's range, both men and women. You must have a solid track record of taking informal portraits of adults, lifestyle photography or online dating style photos. 

Your photo examples must consist of individuals only - with head shots, 3/4 body and full length of clients in the mid 20's - 60's age range. If your online portfolio doesn't reflect this type of work, please create an album that does instead and provide a link to that on our site when you register. Don't tell us you can do the work, if you can't back it up with images. If all you have is photos of children, families and seniors, this won't work for us. We will not contact you if we can't see your work first hand. We are not looking for beginners looking to get into the business.

We are interested ONLY in a photographer who can shoot a natural style and with a "shallow depth of field"; No posed or glamor shots! Photos should be shot OUTSIDE (weather permitting of course), in natural light and have great knowledge of fill flash if necessary. If the weather doesn't permit it, we are looking for more "environmental type" indoor studio shoots or other interior shots will work well as long again you are experienced in fill flash photography.

If you don't shoot this way already, please do not apply. Make sure your web address is correct. If all you do is studio photography, we are not what you are looking for.

*We accept only one out of 30 photographers who apply!
*You must have a website and a stellar portfolio to be accepted.
*You must have experience shooting portraits in natural light and composition.

We bring the customer to your door, all you have to do is call the customer within 24 hours, do the shoot and then upload the photos the customer has selected to our site within 24 hours.

If you take amazing natural photos, can follow instructions, love helping people, if you can perform your job in a timely and professional manner, we would love to hear from you.

No hidden costs or fees and payment is guaranteed-we pay on time each week!

If you're interested please do the following:

1)visit our website and see what we do at 
2)To join our team click on
Compensation: $85-$130 per job (plus up-selling images if you wish)

Title: **Educated, Egg Donor Needed! $10,000 a Cycle**

Compensation for the cycle is $8,000 to $10,000, plus all expenses covered. Please see the requirements below, and contact this ad for more details!


**EGG DONOR REQUIREMENTS**

Between the ages of 20 and 30
Physically healthy (No major surgeries, conditions, etc)
Have a BMI (Range from 19-27)
Non-Smoker
Have regular, monthly menstrual periods
Not using contraceptive implants or Depo-Provera injections as a form of birth control
Have both ovaries
Psychologically healthy
No current use of psychoactive drugs
No history of substance abuse
No family history of inheritable genetic disorders
Willing to take injections
Dependable, mature, and able to keep appointments

-Being an Egg Donor does not cause infertility
-All Expenses are paid (Does not Cost you anything out of pocket!)

-You are HELPING individuals in need!!!
Compensation: $8,000 to $10,000 per cycle, Plus all expenses paid!

Title: Become a Surrogate!
Description:
Becoming a surrogate mother is an incredible gift a woman can give. It is an amazing journey helping a family achieve their dreams of growing a family. You must be stable and mature, and willing to commit time and energy to the surrogacy process. You must be willing to accept the risks of pregnancy as well as the emotional and psychological challenges associated with surrogacy. 

Requirements for being a Surrogate:
-Be a female of 21-43 years of age
-Have delivered one or more children that you are currently raising
-No more than three C-sections
-Willing to abstain from alcohol during pregnancy
-Be a non-smoker, living in a non-smoking home
-Be a non-drug user
-Have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or less
-Not currently be receiving federal/state assistance
-Have no history of arrests or substance abuse
-Undergo medical examination (STDs, drug test, Hepatitis test, pelvic exam, etc.)

Our offices are in Boise, Idaho. But you can live and receive your prenatal care and deliver right where you live! We coordinate your entire journey remotely to help families fulfill their dreams!

Please visit our website  for more information!
Compensation: $25,000 for a first time surrogate; $35,000 for a proven surrogate

Title: Experienced Line Cook
Description:
Kamm's Red Lantern, a restaurant that offers modern-American food in a "scratch kitchen", signature drinks, adult milkshakes and wines on tap is looking for experienced and talented line cooks. 

Candidates must possess a good temperament, endurance, people skills, attention to detail, and willingness to take direction as well as teach it. Candidates must be able to multi task under pressure, have excellent communication skills and a proven track record in a high volume restaurant. Reliable transportation is a must. 


The responsibilities of a Cook include: 
•	Setting up the station according to restaurant guidelines.
•	Preparing all food items as directed in a sanitary and timely manner.
•	Following recipes, portion controls, and presentation specifications as set by the restaurant.
•	Restocking all items as needed throughout the shift.
•	Cleaning and maintaining the station by practicing good safety, sanitation, and organizational skills.
•	Understanding how to properly use and maintain all equipment in the station.
•	Assisting with the cleaning, sanitation, and organization of the kitchen, walk-in coolers, and all storage areas.
•	Performing additional responsibilities, although not detailed, as requested by Executive Chef. 
•	Receiving, storing, and rotating all food/paper stock.

Working Conditions:
•	This position will spend 100% of the time standing.
•	Occasional environmental exposures to cold, heat, and water.
•	The individual must be able to transport up to 50 pounds on occasion and up to 35 pounds regularly.
•	Must be able speak, read and understand basic cooking directions.

Please send your resume to info@redlantern.us or apply in person
17446 Lorain Ave, Cleveland, Ohio 44111

Title: DIRECT CARE PROFESSIONAL and DRIVER NEEDED
Description:
Direct Support Professional and Driver Positions available!


Growing Company looking for individuals to assist in transforming peoples' lives and their communities!

We play a vital role in helping clients with intellectual, cognitive, or developmental disabilities achieve their highest level of independence.

Driver Responsibilities

Picking up and dropping off clients to and from work. Ensures the safety of all clients being transported. Engage and interact Must be with the clients being transported.  
*Must be able to sit/drive for up to 6 hours at a time*


Direct Support Professional Responsibilities 

Fostering positive relationships between individuals served. Ensuring client safety and maintaining a safe environment. Encouraging self-help activities. Title: Immediate part time work: flexible schedules
Description:
We are running interviews for customer sales & service. If accepted, talk to a manager about working in a location closest to you (possibility to work remotely).


We are looking for people to work with customers to help answer their questions and place orders for them (no cold calling or canvassing involved). This is an entry level position in our cust-sales/svc dept. There is no cost to start or any deposits. This is an entry level position, so there are no benefits, but we offer a great starting pay.


The pay is $17.25 base-appt and it's not based on sales or results. Which means even if someone doesn't sell anything, they would still get paid. Incentives are available and would be discussed with those who are invited in for an interviews. 


No experience is required, but we do find that people who have experience as a server, golf caddy, cashier, hostess, salon receptionists, fast food worker, call center operator, or retail associate do well with our company. Since the position involves working with people, even if someone doesn't have any prior experience they gain great resume experience and build up their communication skills. 


We are seeking individuals who are positive, reliable, and responsible. We are looking for someone who is eager to create their own success story, someone who is willing to learn and adopt all the skills for success we have to offer. This is a great opportunity for students who want to get some real world experience. 


We are looking to fill positions . All ages 18 & older can apply.



Due to the number of applicants we're receiving, we're scheduling all of our interviews via text.We find that this is a lot easier and faster for our applicants (since everybody always has their phones on them).

Title: FedEx Driver for Ground/Home Delivery
Description:
THIS IS A NON BENEFIT POSITION - READ ENTIRE DESCRIPTION BEFORE APPLYING

    Pay ranges from $550.00 and up
    per week depending on experience, seniority, and terminal location. Pay will increase after initial training period.
    You will be driving for a delivery contractor for FedEx Ground and Home Delivery operating in Northeast Ohio seeking permanent, full time employees
    Looking for applicants that enjoy physically demanding, time challenging environments with minimal supervision. Must enjoy interaction with people and have excellent communication skills

QUALIFICATIONS

    Valid drivers license (No CDL required)
    Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check (no felonies)
    Must be able to pass a DOT physical
    Minimum 21 years of age
    Driving experience must be verifiable
    Must have at least one year in the last three years of verifiable delivery or route experience in a similar vehicle -or- five years within the last ten years (accumulative) This can be for any verifiable job where you were driving for a job (pizza delivery, flower delivery, any job where you drove and received a check)
    Driving history does not have to be consecutive (you can have six months at one employer and six months at another) You just need one year all together in last three of five within last ten
    All applicants will be subject to random drug and alcohol tests periodically throughout their employment
    Applicants will be required to pay for their own initial drug screening and DOT physical, and will be reimbursed after between 30 and 60 days of employment (depending on employer)
    Clean driving record
    No DUI convictions and no felonies
    No more than two moving violations within the last three years
    Can not have two speeding tickets over 15mph over the speed limit, or any tickets for driving over 80 mph

Physical Requirements

    Must be willing to drive and work in all weather conditions
    Must be able to lift 150 pounds without assistance (other than hand truck)

*Pay will increase as soon as you are able to deliver on your own, and we feel you have learned all the safety procedures. The quicker you learn, the quicker you will be out on your own. The Home Delivery process requires you to load your own truck with minimal to no assistance. Home Delivery drivers work Tuesday - Saturday. Ground Delivery drivers work Monday - Friday. Delivery hours will vary by route, but are generally in the 7:30 to 5:00pm time frame, hours will be longer during the Christmas peak delivery season.

IF YOU MEET ALL THE ABOVE QUALIFICATIONS, REPLY TO THIS AD WITH YOUR RESUME (REQUIRED)*

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $550.00 /week

Title: *** EARN UP TO $70,000 A YEAR - CLASS A DRIVER WANTED!
Delivery Drivers
Description:
DELIVERY DRIVER Job in about 50 words: Buckle up, hit the open road and start making hungry people happy as a delivery driver for Pizza Hut®. That's right, we'll pay you to cruise around in your mobile office - your car - listening to your own tunes and delivering great pizza - and pasta. What more could you want? Independence, good music and great food - with tips! Sound good? Besides your smile, energy and reliable set of wheels, here's what you'll need for this job:

 Job skills/requirements: The good news is that your training will teach you everything you need to know to succeed on the job. But here are a few skills you should have from the get-go, as well as some requirements:
 
*A clean driving record: If you're on a first name basis with the people at traffic court, this probably isn't the right job for you. Safety is our priority. You'll also need a valid driver's license, insurance and reliable vehicle. 
*Friendly demeanor: Smile, tell a joke - treat our customers like you would your family and friends. Think of it this way - a smile and a kind word can mean the difference between a wallet full of tips and just some extra change for your cup holder. 
*A keen sense of direction: You should know how to read a map and find your way around your delivery area. Think of all of the short cuts you'll learn! 
*Age restrictions: Our delivery drivers need to be at least 18 years old. 
*Dress the part: We'll provide you with a uniform. We just ask that you keep it clean and come to work wearing it. 
*Just a few more things: You'll need some basic math skills, the desire to work as part of a team and enthusiasm for learning.
If you want to a flexible job with an innovative company - and great tips - then Pizza Hut is the place for you. Apply today!

Title: SKIPTHEDISHES ● FLEXIBLE HOURS ● FOOD DELIVERY ● PAID WEEKLY
Slow Work Season? Now Hiring Full Time Painters, Roofers, Handymen etc
Description:
Finding yourself in a very slow work season or working for a company that doesn't offer full time work?

You've come to the right place. 

We are hiring skilled and experienced painters, roofers, and handymen who want to work full time. We need professionals who are versatile in fixing up different areas and aspects of residential homes.

We are an established contracting and property management company that provides work ALL YEAR ROUND, MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY (plus some Saturdays) with the opportunity to earn perks and bonuses as you grow within our company. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced company with a start-up mentality. 

Key responsibilities include:

- Renovating houses and specializing in all components of home repair
- Painting
- Electrical
- Plumbing
- Carpentry

Qualifications:

- Be willing to listen and learn from your foreman until you prove you can work on your own
- Know how to set up a 20 foot ladder and have knowledge about ladder safety
- Have a valid driver's license
- Be willing to work some Saturdays
- Want a full time career

What we offer full-time employees:

- Pay is $12-$16 per hour, PAID EVERY TWO WEEKS like clockwork
- Steady hours, 8:30am to 5:00pm. No crazy work hours or emergency phone calls during the middle of the night
- Bonuses and perks
- Entrepreneurial, fun, fast-paced work environment
- Ongoing career development
- Working for an established business with over 40 years of exposure

Visit our website to learn more about our company: 

If interested, please reply back with your contact information and a copy of your resume.

Thank you

Title: MAKE $104,000 working 25 hours/week (Multiple Locations)
Description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE AD BEFORE APPLYING. Thank you.

We are looking for hardcore CLOSERS. We have a serious amount of people that have requested our services (100% NO COLD CALLING), and just need local help, to go and closeout the deal.

Our agents that work about 25 hours a week, conservatively net around $104,000.



Simply said:

We teach people to make six figures by working part time, selling mortgage protection. This product is a form of life insurance that will pay off a new homeowners loan, in the case of death, illness, or disability (you must hold a license or be willing to get one. Normally takes 1 week to complete).



How we do it:

Call and set appointments on the leads 6-8 hours a week. Set up 12-15 appointments. Do 10 presentations (you'll get 2-5 reschedules per week). Close 5 deals (average person has 50% closing ratio).



How the Money works:

You make an average of $500 per sale. 5 sales will equal $2,500 per week. You would be a 1099 worker, so we will teach you to manage your money, as well. After expenses like gas for your car and leads, etc, you should net at least 80-90% of whatever you make (conservatively $2,000 per week which equals $104,000 per year net).

Yes, being self employed you'll have to smart with budgeting, and we don't apologize for that. Our leads are extremely effective and valuable, but we teach you to run a REAL BUSINESS. We aren't looking for the 9-5'ers that want to make 30-40k per year, and have everything spoon-fed to them. We want the aggressive closers, that have been dreaming of a very SIMPLE way to generate 100k+, closing deals a few days per week.



How the Leads works:

You are calling real people that have filled out a form, requesting insurance. THEY KNOW that they are filling out a request to BUY INSURANCE. Attached to this ad, is EXACTLY what we mail out every single week to new homeowners. Also, the attached picture of the state, shows you just how many LEFTOVER clients we have for the week, that filled out a form asking for coverage, and they have never received a call from us, simply because WE NEED MORE AGENTS.



Six Figure Sales Schedule:

We teach people to take 2, four-hour sessions of setting appointments (from home). And 2 full days of running appointments (in the client's home). You choose which county or counties you desire to work. That's it.



Don't have 25 hours a week to work?:

We'll look at what time you have available, and give you a realistic amount that you could make, if you hustle.



Am I capped out at 100k?

Definitely not. We teach people that you could make much more than that, but the smartest way to do it, is to hire and train others in the other 2 days you have availability in the week. Insurance companies pay MAJOR BONUSES to managers. And you don't have to stop selling while you do it. The average managers in our business makes $200,000+.

Follow the link to schedule an initial 15 minute telephone interview:

Title: Store Associate , with Technical and Device Repair
Description:
Batteries Plus Bulbs, the nation's largest, fastest-growing battery and light bulb franchise, is searching for full and part time Store Associates for our Strongville, Ohio location.  Store Associates are vital members of our team, providing the best possible service to our customers, resulting in repeat customers and increased sales.  Technical Duties Include:  Repair cell phones, tablets, light fixtures and other devices, replacing screens and other components on smart phones and tablets.

Reports to: Store Manager

General Function: 
•Provide customers total solutions to their battery, light bulb, and electronic device repair needs, while doing so in a courteous, professional, and helpful manner.

 Responsibilities and Qualifications (others assigned) 

 Customer Service / Sales
•Greet customers, determine needs and answer questions.
•Operate computer / cash register to complete sales transactions with accuracy.
•Function as team player doing whatever is necessary to help attain company goals.
•Suggest and sell add-on items, participate in retail store and commercial sales activities in order to achieve sales and profit goals.

Merchandising / Inventory:
•Rotate and stock inventory.
•Load, unload, and deliver or arrange delivery of product to customers or via a third party.
•Maintain retail shelf label pricing.
•Prepare store for daily opening and closing including counting and reconciling register drawers.
•Follow all safety rules and regulations
    

Technical: 
•Install batteries, perform tests and tech work.
•Able to rebuild cordless drill batteries and other battery packs as needed.
•Repair cell phone, tablets, and other devices.

Qualifications: 
•H.S diploma / equivalent and 6 month's prior work experience preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience. Prior retail experience desired, but not required.
•Ability to gain quick and solid understanding of company's electronic retail and cross reference system.
•Must possess and use organizational and analytical problem solving skills.
•Ability to handle multiple projects / tasks to effectively prioritize, follow up, and meet deadlines with multiple tasks and projects.
•Complete all required training and demonstrate understanding of all training in practice.
•Valid driver's license and clean driving record.  Pass background check.

Working Environment: 
•This position requires employee to regularly stand, walk and use hands to handle or touch, frequently talk, listen and lift up to 50 pounds, and occasionally sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, reach above shoulders and lift more than 50 pounds.
•The position also requires employee to occasionally use electrical cables, hand tools, magnifying glass, spot welders, automotive and electronic testing equipment, and a company automobile.  Protective clothing such as, safety glasses, steel toed shoes.

(Charge - IN LLC is an independently owned franchisee of Batteries Plus Bulbs)

Title: Inside Sales
Description:
The Inside Sales Representative - New Business is responsible sourcing and responding to new business sales leads to help achieving established sales targets. Responsible for developing, maintaining and growing a database of prospective customers within assigned territory/market. Team with channel partners to build business pipeline. Deliver solid business growth through sales closing while exceeding customer expectations and achieving new business sales goals.
SKILLS & ABILITIES

•             Proven results in achieving sales goals / targets.

•             Results-oriented with proven results through self and others.

•             Excellent organization skills.

•             Ability to see contribution of department from an organizational perspective.

•             Communicates effectively (verbally and in writing) to a wide range of internal and external customers/clients/management.

•             Knowledge of current and potential market trends and understand the scope and impact those trends have on underwriting business.

•             Ability to recognize opportunities to enhance the process flow to increase efficiency.

•             Strong customer service ability and superior organizational skills.

•             Problem-solving and decision-making ability. Ability to execute.

•             Attention to detail. Thorough with a strong ability to see projects through to completion.

•             Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as payables on percentage and flat dollar amounts for accuracy and explanations; ability to apply concepts of algebra.

•             Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

•             Proficiency with a computer, standard office equipment, smart phone, and computer programs including but not limited to Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Internet/search engine savvy.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

•             BA/BS degree preferred.

•             2+ years inside sales experience with proven sales results; consumer credit lending experience a plus.

WORKING CONDITIONS

This position operates in a professional office environment at company offices in Westlake, Ohio.

This is a full-time position; approximately 40 hours per week. 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.

This position does not require travel.

Career Level Experienced (Non-Manager)
Location Westlake, OH 44145 US (Primary)
Education High School Diploma
Job Title Inside Sales Representative
# of Hires Needed 1
Job Description
THIS IS A TEMP TO HIRE POSITION

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

•             Routing qualified opportunities, as needed, to the appropriate sales executives for further development and closure

•             Researching accounts, identify key players and generating interest

•             Phone communication and sales, reporting activities and results.

•             Execute detailed activities calendar and sales plan.

•             Maximize profit and increase product or service visibility through personal sales efforts.

•             Gathering information and data related to customer and prospect interactions.

•             Identifying and pursuing new business targets.

•             Closing sales through persistent use of methods such as follow-up calls and emails.

•             Effectively communicating with business owners to establish strong business relationships.

•             Working closely with the marketing function to support channel and partner programs.

•             Acting as the internal and external "champion" to the company businesses.

•             Ensuring effective communications are used in driving sales plan objectives.

•             Creating a culture of success and ongoing business and goal achievement.

•             Performing other related duties as assigned.

Job Type Temporary to Hire
Wage Amount $15-$18/hour

APPLY BY CLICKING REPLY TO THIS POST. MUST SEND RESUME!

Title: Steady Part Time Sales Promoter - Brand Ambassador inside Costco!
Description:
Weekend sales people needed in Cleveland, OH





The Zipfizz Healthy Energy Drink Team is looking for Brand Promoters in Cleveland, OH to promote brand awareness and sales of Zipfizz, the healthy alternative to sports and energy drinks! We are a Vendor in Costco.




We are looking for High Energy People who are Self-Confident - Energetic - Dynamic Communicators - Resourceful - Adaptable - Ambitious - Responsible - Organized!




If this describes you and you're ready to work in a team environment, engage and interact with people; we look forward to hearing from you. This position is soft sales in our best accounts.




We are building relationships and only want responsible and punctual people. If you have a positive attitude, like meeting new people and are excited by the idea of earning a great hourly wage plus commission...then please read on!




This is a part time position that is incredible for anyone looking to promote a healthy alternative to sports and energy drinks! The key words here are healthy and energy!




The hours are 9am-5:30pm on Saturday & 9:30am-6pm on Sunday. We're looking for people who want to make extra money on the weekend and the occasional Friday if you're available.




This is also a fantastic job for those who are career driven & looking for advancement opportunities.




You must have:

* Reliable vehicle
* Cell phone with texting and photo capability
* E-mail access
* Fun Personality




We provide promotional materials and a weekly paycheck via direct deposit!




Compensation: Hourly + Commission = Average pay $18 - $20 per hour ($20 + depending on performance)




Check out our website at www.zipfizz.com; then reply to this posting with your resume and anything else you think might separate you from the "average" person.




Is now the time for you to have a great part time job promoting a beverage that does amazing things for people's bodies? The goal is to build our brand and help our retailers by supporting their retail sales! Therefore, speaking with and engaging people, are important for your success!




We will be in various locations this Saturday & Sunday. We will be training this week and next!




We are looking to hire 2-3 great people!
Compensation: Compensation:  Hourly + Commission - Average pay $18 - $20 per hour ($20 + depending on performance)

Title: Jobs for International Medical Graduates (IMG/FMG) and US Medical Grad
Description:
We have exciting career opportunities at our hospitals in fields of clinical documentation improvement, Performance Improvement, Case Management, Infection Control, Medical Necessity Review. Positions are at acute care hospitals located in Alabama, California, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Kansas, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Texas.  This is a suitable opportunity for those seeking a career in hospital/healthcare management.

Job Description:
The position will introduce you to operations of acute care facility where your medical background could be applied (but, does not involve direct patient care). Projects may include concurrent and retrospective chart reviews. Selected candidates will be offered full-time positions, assigned to projects that will build foundations for long-term careers at the hospital level. We are looking for candidates with high aptitude, great communication skills, and satisfactory performance.

Qualifications: 
•         Must be a medical school graduate that successfully completed the program - do not need to be licensed in US.
•         Experience in acute care settings is preferred. 
•         The position requires assertive personality with strong written and verbal communication skills.
•         Candidates with post-graduate education in related field, including public health, are preferred.

Title: Commercial HVAC Technician (EENA) - Service Experts - 133372
Description:
Description

Engineering Excellence combines professional engineering talent with hands-on technical expertise to provide cost-effective solutions for the design, maintenance and long range operation of mechanical systems. Engineering Excellence offers National Account services in all 50 states and self performs as a regional contractor in Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, West Virginia and Wisconsin.

Commercial HVAC Technician

As a Service Technician you will provide maintenance, install, startups and troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair various commercial/industrial heating and cooling systems. You will also meet with customers, evaluate needs and make recommendations.

The qualified candidate must have at least 5 years' experience in the service & repair of roof-top units and on all types of commercial HVAC equipment; a high school diploma/GED, CFC certification or HVAC related journeymen license or equivalent industrial/commercial experience; EPA Universal license, a thorough understanding of basic refrigeration & heating systems part/components and their applications; and a valid Driver's license.

Team work is a priority and Technicians must be willing to work with and assist co-workers as needed, in addition to working an "On-Call" rotation and taking emergency after hour service requests. Willingness and flexibility to travel is also required.

All employees must be able to pass our background check, drug-screen, and MVR driving record check.

Equal Opportunity Employer.
