Title: Hair Stylist/Barber for Booth Rental in Independence
Description:
We are currently seeking a Hair Stylist and/or Barber for an established, trendy salon in downtown Independence.  Since opening our doors in 2016, our prime location has resulted in a significant number of new relationships (walk-in customers)!

Commission vs. Booth Renting

Your success as a Beauty Professional or Barber depends a lot on your environment.  You want to practice your craft in a supportive environment that you enjoy, where you feel good about yourself, and where you can maximize your income.  This generally means either working for commission or renting a booth/chair.  

An increasingly popular method of working in a salon is renting a booth or chair, also called "booth-renting".  While salons that booth rent can be difficult to find (a result of the fact that the salon owner makes significantly less income than a traditional salon owner), they are extremely lucrative to the Stylist.  Renting a chair in a salon involves paying "rent" to the owner of the salon. It's no different than renting an apartment in an apartment building.  In this case, the salon owner leases out workstations to independent stylists in exchange for a monthly rent.  The rent is usually not more than the income you will earn from one or two services you perform that week.  That's right....for the cost of just one or two services per week, you can essentially run your own business and reap the rewards.  You get flexibility when scheduling your clients (you generally get a key to the salon and can schedule your clients whenever is convenient to you), and you also get to keep not only 100% of your income, but also 100% of any products you sell!!!!

The Pros of Booth Renting over working at a Commission-based Salon:

•  ***You are your own boss***. Your schedule accommodates you - not the salon manager.
•  ***You can charge whatever you like for the services you are providing***.
•  After paying your salon rental fee, all the money you earn is yours...including all income from product sales.

Generally, the only regret a booth-renting Stylist has is that they didn't make the move sooner!  The experienced cosmetologist with any type of client base will substantially increase his/her net income, while doing it on their own schedule.  It's a lot easier to change salons and run your own book of business if you have a list of clients who will follow you and keep you afloat.  Just make sure you aren't relocating too far from your existing salon....Anything less than 10 miles is usually the rule of thumb. 

Check us out online.  If you aren't convinced a booth rental scenario is right for you, reach out to one of our Stylists or Barbers that have recently made the change.  They are likely more than happy to give their wisdom on how the decision was the best decision they ever made!  

tracy & co barber salon
440 773-2223
www.tracyandcohair.com

TV CASTING CALL: Are you dating your EX's relative?
Description:
Are you in a serious relationship with an ex's family member?
Are you engaged to your ex's sibling, cousin, or other relative?
Has this made the relationship easier? Or harder?  

A major cable network is looking for men and women who are dating or engaged to someone related to their ex. Maybe you met while you were with your ex and realized it was true love ... or maybe you fell in love years after the relationship ended. Maybe this has made things harder for your family ... or easier! In this documentary-reality series, we want to meet all different kinds of people to tell their stories.

It's all about getting over the hurdles we all face to find true love! 
 
If you or someone you know is in a serious relationship with an ex's family member, we want to hear from you! There is compensation if you are chosen for filming. 

Please reply to this ad with: 

Name
Age
Email
Phone (and best time to call)
Recent Photos of you and your significant other
Who you are dating / in a relationship with
How you met
Most importantly, tell us why you would be perfect for this project!

We look forward to hearing from you! 

Please forward this to anyone who would be interested!

Title: Customer Service Representative - Medical Device Company
Description:
We are a small rapidly growing medical device company specializing in operating room devices.  
We are seeking an experienced customer service representative as the result of an internal promotion.  
This key position currently reports directly to the general manager and will collaborate with sales, marketing and administration.  

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
•	Managing customer inquiries for information, pricing requests, and purchase orders
•	Preparing accurate quotes and work orders
•	Acting as a liaison between customer and sales as necessary 
•	Working with other departments as necessary
•	Maintaining and updating customer information (CRM)
•	Working to promote teamwork at all levels of the company
•	Maintaining a thorough understanding of each device category
•	Providing other assistance to the senior management team as requested 

TO BE SUCCESSFUL:
•	Professional customer satisfaction skills needed to maintain positive external and internal relationships
•	Excellent oral and written communication skills to include effective listening
•	Attention to detail is critical to maintain accuracy and fulfill customer expectations
•	Must be able to function effectively in a fast-paced environment, multi-tasking and ability to access and manage priorities
•	Excellent organizational skills including follow-up and accountability
•	Proficiency in computer applications including Microsoft Word and Excel.  
•	Working knowledge of QuickBooks preferred.
•	Ability to work independently and within a team environment
•	Exhibits sound judgment in decision-making, remaining calm under pressure
•	Displays a positive attitude along with a good sense of humor (required)

We are a small company made up of a wonderful group of individuals who appreciate that what we do is important. We are serious about creating and maintaining a well oiled machine and along the way we also find the time to laugh. 

All qualified applicants meeting requirements will receive a response.

COMPENSATION:
Highly competitive compensation package - including benefits participation. 
Equal Opportunity Employer

Use CL REPLY email to send cover letter and up-to-date resume.

Title: Industrial Maintenance Tech 2nd Shift up to $25 an Hour
Description:
The 2nd Shift Industrial Maintenance Position performs a variety of general maintenance tasks on electrical, hydraulic and pneumatic equipment, including repairs, as well as preventative maintenance according to program outlines.  

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
1.	Responsible for trouble shooting and repairing industrial electrical, hydraulic and pneumatic equipment. 
2.	Reads/understands diagrams, instructions and technical manuals (blueprints, electrical schematics, etc.). 
3.	Conducts preventative maintenance according to program outlines.
4.	Reports and/or documents supplies needed.
5.	Responds to production needs in a timely manner.
6.	Verifies accuracy and completion of repairs.
7.	May perform other duties or work in a production area as needed based upon business demands.
8.	Maintains a clean and safe work environment.
9.	Demonstrates and promotes Pentair's "Win Right" culture at all times when interacting with employees, co-workers, customers and suppliers.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS 

•	Strong mechanical/electrical aptitude 
•	Critical thinking skills and the ability to develop new ways to solve tough problems 
•	Self-motivated and eager to assume additional responsibilities as needed
•	3+ years of previous experience in industrial maintenance required
•	High School diploma or equivalent preferred
•	Pre-employment technical and electrical testing required
•	Strong problem solving and decision making skills
•	Mathematical and mechanical reasoning abilities

WORK ENVIROMENT:
Manufacturing facility with exposure to some dust, noise/vibrations from machinery and fumes/odors.  Outdoor exposure to weather conditions (heat, cold and rain).

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
This position requires regular walking, stooping, kneeling, crouching and climbing while conducting repairs and maintenance.  Some standing, sitting and reaching is also required.  Daily lifting of parts and equipment up to 100 pounds is required.  

EQUIPMENT/TOOLS UTLIZED:
Daily use of hand tools, electro-mechanical machinery and lifting equipment.  Various diagnostic tools as well.

Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Compensation: Up to $25 an hour based on experience to start

Title: NO INVESTMENT - STRONG RESIDUALS + COMMISSION
Description:
- Want to work your own schedule?
- Want to get paid weekly?
- Want to earn monthly residuals?
- Want to make $300-900 per sale?

GREAT! We are looking for 2 or 3 motivated sales professionals to sell our products in your area, and we do the rest!

If you have a successful history working as an independent contractor and have business to business sales experience ...

Call Jennifer today at (877) 887-0707.

Who We Are:

- EZlocal was founded in 2007.
- Google Partner since 2010.
- Services include: Local Listings Management, Social & Reputation, Online Ad Management, Web Design, and more.
- Proprietary technology (Chicago Innovation Awards Finalists).

The Position

Our independent sales representatives are expected to explain the benefits of EZlocal in a face-to-face consultative sales approach to small and medium-sized business owners.

This is an exciting opportunity to be your own boss and also sell a service that will help businesses grow and thrive in your area.

For a money-motivated sales professional interested in a company where earnings are commensurate with success, EZlocal is the right opportunity. There is absolutely ZERO investment to be an independent contractor with EZlocal.

Compensation

Our best salespeople make at least one sale every day.

They earn:

$300-$900 upfront commission per sale.
$40-60 per month ongoing residual per sale.

Our Requirements

- 1+ years outside sales experience as an independent contractor.
- We strongly prefer experience selling products and services to small business owners.

Top Performer Traits

- Previous experience selling to small business owners.
- Strong presentation, closing, and prospecting skills.
- Strong work ethic, integrity, and ability to work independently.
- Prior online marketing or advertising sales experience a plus.
- A natural ability to sell and build relationships.
- Highly motivated to make money!

Support

One-on-one support is provided by our team at the corporate office. EZlocal Trusted Advisors are also available to answer any questions you have at any time -- especially when you are meeting with a business owner. We will help you close the sale! In addition, we host live webinars weekly to keep you up-to-date with EZlocal solutions and evolving trends in digital marketing. All product training and sales collateral are provided once your application is accepted. You will have the opportunity to join us for company events & an invite to our corporate office outside of Chicago.

There is no investment to work as an independent contractor for EZlocal.

Call Jennifer Today at (877) 887-0707, or apply online at sellforthebest.com.

At the very least, we recommend keeping this high commission offer in your back pocket for when and if you ever know of a business that is looking for online marketing services or a new website.

Title: Office Administrator
Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced Office Administrator that can handle administrative tasks and bookkeeping duties in a construction office environment.  This position requires a person who is willing to take the lead and keep the office organized.  The position entails working directly with the owner, customers, vendors, and employees. The Office Administrator needs to be able to stay focused on the daily tasks while working through the pop ups of the day.    You will need to be prepared and organized to keep all parties informed and up to date.  The Office Administrator should be a driving force in the office, our expectations of this position are big.  The Office Administrator will be tasked with keeping the office moving forward while helping to institute new policies to further help the company streamline and grow.    

Qualifications:
•	Minimum of 2 years' administrative construction office experience
•	Ability to perform several tasks simultaneously with ease and professionalism
•	Willingness to follow direction and adhere to company policies and procedures
•	Experience in the construction industry, and knowledge of construction language
•	Understanding of customer/client job schedule with the ability to guide the job through the process from start to finish.

Software:
•	QuickBooks
•	MS OFFICE

•	Provide administrative assistance to the owner, project managers and office personnel
•	Manage daily appointments and job schedules
•	Manage vendors, customers, and jobs in QuickBooks
•	Communicate with vendors and customers

Am I ready for this position?

Thanks to all who apply, we are excited to find our new Office Administrator.

Title: Gas Station Manager
Description:
Gas Station Manager

We have a full-time opening for a Gas Station Manager.

The Gas Station Manager will be responsible for the planning, organization, direction, control and evaluation of the gas station, and will provide merchandise and services on a retail basis. The Gas Station Manager is expected to market ideas to promote business; reduce employee turnover; maintain revenue and payroll budgets; and meet budgeted productivity while keeping quality consistently high.

Job Duties

-Plan, direct and evaluate the operations of the gas station
-Manage staff and assign duties
-Study market research and trends to determine consumer demand, potential sales volumes and effect of competitors' operations on sales
-Determine merchandise and services to be sold, and implement price and credit policies
-Locate, select, and procure merchandise for resale
-Develop and implement marketing strategies
-Utilize and cooperate with required customer appreciation and incentive programs
-Plan budgets and authorize expenditures
-Resolve customer complaints
-Determine staffing requirements and hire or oversee hiring of staff
-Orientate each new hire on the basics of the facility and explain the training schedule
-Enforce all corporate, local, and state policies and procedures
-Create and maintain employee schedules
-Review timecards and employee schedules, ensure all shifts are covered
-Submit bi-weekly payroll info (time cards, payroll changes, new hires, and terminations)
-Enforce progressive discipline policy with counseling sessions and written warnings when necessary.

Must be able to work various shifts per week. Must be familiar with the Ruby operating system. 

Must have a high school diploma or equivalent.
Be authorized to work in the United States.

Additional Info

Language(s)
-English (United States)
Minimum Age
-21+ years old

Must be responsible, honest, reliable, and may be subject to background check. 

Please send resume and/or letter of interest. References may be requested.

Title: Choose Your Own Schedule With Lyft: Up to $1,500/week
ROUTE SERVICE TECHS NEEDED ASAP!!!
Description:
Furniture Repair Technicians Needed Now!!!!

Now Hiring Career Minded Individuals!!!!!

Ready to raise the bar on customer satisfaction?

An In-Home Furniture Repair Technician works closely with the customer care team to repair and satisfy any furniture damages or manufacturer defects our customers experienced. The ideal candidate must have exceptional customer service skills, in addition to having the craft necessary to successfully repair wood, upholstery, and leather products. Responsible for setting the standard for the quality of the merchandise our customers will receive. Must have proven repair skills to meet our goal of total customer satisfaction!

Expectations:

•Home Furniture Repair Technicians travel to customers' homes to assess and complete furniture repairs. 
•Demonstrate professionalism, confidence, and positive energy while working in our customers' homes.
•Able to communicate well with customers in order to service and repair warranted items.
•Ability to work independently or within a team environment.
•Accountable for commitment to US Quality Furniture Services safety procedures and guidelines.
•Maintain, and supply their own service repair vehicle.
•Inspect, repair and evaluate customer service repairs.
•Provide and execute Warranty protection plans.
•Adhere to state traffic and transportation laws.
•Organize and manage time independently.
•Perform additional functions that may be assigned at the discretion of management.

Qualifications:

•1 Year experience working with wood furniture, leather, fabric & upholstery
•Color matching & blending.
•Wood repairs including burn-ins & wood graining.
•Leather repairs including scuffs, holes and tears.
•Upholstery repairs including structural/mechanism replacements.
•Excellent time management skills and attention to detail.
•Ability to work a flexible schedule based on our customer delivery schedule.
•High School Diploma or equivalent.
•A clean motor vehicle record. 
Physical Requirements:
•Making repairs to furniture requires lifting, bending, kneeling, stooping and moving furniture items to accommodate the repairs necessary to satisfy the customer.
•Ability to lift 50lbs.

At US Quality Furniture Services, we recognize and appreciate all of our team members' hard work and dedication. We pride ourselves on being a long term, privately held company that takes care of its associates by recognizing each individual's potential and investing in their future success! 

US Quality Furniture Services provides a full range of comprehensive benefit programs to help you achieve your wellness and financial goals which include:

•Health Insurance and Prescription Drug Coverage
•Dental and Vision Coverage  
•Voluntary Life and Long-term Disability Insurance 
Other Great Benefits:
•Bi-Weekly Pay through Direct Deposit
•Paid Vacation and Holidays
•Training and Development

US Quality Furniture Services proudly supports a drug free and smoke free work environment.

US Quality Furniture Services is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any associate or applicant on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, genetic information or other basis protected by law.

Area Temps Mentor Job Fair

7547 Mentor Avenue
Mentor, Ohio 44060
440-975-4400

If you have a manufacturing background and are looking for a career opportunity, then we are looking for YOU!!

Area Temps has multiple openings for various positions in Willoughby.  Minimum starting salary is listed; however, company is willing to pay higher wages depending on experience and skill level.

Mechanical & Electrical - $14/hr starting pay
Welders - $16/hr starting pay
Painter & Insulator - $14/hr starting pay

Training will be performed on first shift; however, openings are on night shift which is Sunday through Thursday from 9 p.m. to 6 a.m. and Friday from 9 p.m. to 2 a.m.  Actual hours may vary per department, but generally the company is working 50 hours per week. 

We are immediately hiring for the following positions:

Custom Machine Builder - 4 needed
Experience in Pipe Fitting, Mig/Tig and/or orbital welding, tube bending, brazing and soldering, and reading blueprints is needed.  Must have 3 years Machine Building experience and have own tools.

Industrial Electrician - 4 needed
Background in panel building and point-to-point wiring is required.  Must have knowledge in wiring instrument controls, pumps, heaters, control valves & PLC logic, and must follow NEC and NFPA 70 Guidelines. Must have 3 years Industrial Electrician experience and own tools.

Industrial Painter - Perform prep work (taping, shaping, and straitening) on equipment to be painted, sandblast, paint equipment, and maintain inventory.  Must be detail-oriented and a self-starter. Overtime is required for this position.

Industrial Insulation - Fit insulation around obstructions and shape insulating materials and protective covering as required.  Determine the type and amount of insulation required based on locations, surface shape, weather conditions, and equipment use. Must have 3 years Industrial Insulator experience and own tools.

Mechanical Technician - Experience threading pipe, reading a tape measure, and 
proficient math knowledge.  Must have 3 years mechanical experience, must have a mechanical ability around a custom shop environment, and must be familiar with different types of equipment. 

There are various other positions available on all shifts:

Electrical Foreman
Test Technicians
Tig Welders
Receiving/Material Handler Clerks
Multiple Engineers

All positions require candidates to pass a background check and drug screen to be considered.

Make sure you bring with you:

TWO forms of Government issued ID (Driver's License/State ID along with your Social Security Card or Original Birth Certificate OR Passport). 

Multiple copies of current resume

Title: Utility Locate Technician *INTERVIEWING NOW*
Description:
is one of the nation's fastest growing underground utility locating companies.  By locating underground utilities, we are protecting the communities where we live and work.
 
 are responsible for the correct, safe and efficient locating of underground utilities including telecommunications, electric, power, cable TV, gas, water and sewer systems. This includes taking time to thoroughly search for underground utilities in an area, properly marking the location, completing the necessary paperwork and photographing each locate.
 
Our "mobile office" approach to work means that you will never have the same day twice. Our Locators work from a company vehicle utilizing our state of the art ticket and claims management systems to ensure clear and complete mark out services for the excavator or property owner.
 
This position requires you to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions and use a company provided laptop to document and close all tickets. Our 48 hour turnaround time on all locates means we generally work the day after holidays and some weekends, as needed.
 
We are currently hiring throughout  The starting pay for this position is $13.00 per hour.


 
These are daytime, full-time positions and some overtime may be required. Instructor led training will be provided. No locating experience is necessary.
 


•	100% paid training

•	Company laptop, phone and equipment
•	Advancement opportunities - we promote from within the company
•	Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
•	Paid holidays

•	Must be able to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions; outdoor experience preferred

•	Must be computer proficient

Title: Clinical Manager - Home Health - $5000 SIGN ON BONUS
Description:
Clinical Manager - Home Health - $5000 SIGN ON BONUS


Clinical Management Position for a Registered Nurse in Home Care ~ 
                    Join a Leader in Geriatric Home Care!
 
$5000 SIGN ON BONUS
     
Almost Family is a leading provider of home health nursing, rehabilitation and personal care services.  Our Senior Advocacy Mission raises the bar with programs designed to achieve better outcomes for our patients.  For over 30 years, we have developed a culture that fosters innovation, clinical excellence, and integrity.

Why consider choosing a career with us?  Because we are committed to helping you achieve your goals.  As a member of our Senior Advocacy Care Team, we are confident you will achieve more for your career with industry-leading specialty programs that enhance care and promote better outcomes for patients.  You will enjoy the support of a progressive group along with great benefits, competitive pay, and flexible schedule options to fit your lifestyle.  If a long tradition of world-class caring is important to you, consider joining our team.  You'll feel right at home.

As a Clinical Manager, you will:

    Coordinate the delivery of quality patient care by assuring the care plans of direct care staff are complete, accurate, and followed.
    Be responsible for the performance of and/or oversight of critical patient care activities, including scheduling, staffing, intake, physician communications, billing and reimbursement processes and overall compliance.
    May provide direct care on an as needed basis.
    Serve as the direct supervisor for the nurses and home health aides on their assigned team.    

Qualifications:

    Must be a licensed Registered Nurse in the state of Ohio.
    Previous experience in the home care setting desired.
    A minimum of three years nursing experience is required.
    Prior management experience preferred.

Benefits:

Almost Family offers a competitive salary and benefits package that helps safe guard your health and well- being, and provides savings options for you and your family. We offer the following benefits to full time employees:

    Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
    Life and Accidental Death Insurance

Title: Electricians Needed
Description:
Are you an experienced electrician looking for long term work? We have a project going on that needs your help!

We need experienced commercial electricians asap. This is a great opportunity to jump on board with us and stay busy throughout the winter. We are currently knee deep in a large school project and could use some more quality guys asap.

Requirements for us are pretty simple...

Must have at least 5-10 years commercial electrical experience.
Must be able to run all types of conduit and be able to install pipe with precision.
Need to have a good knowledge of current electrical codes.
Experience installing ballasts, boxes, lighting and fixtures. Pulling and termination of conductors and circuitry. Candidates will also need a good knowledge of blue prints and how to follow them on a site.

We are only looking for efficient, experienced, knowledgeable, hard-working, reliable and safe electricians. We require a drug screen and background check to be passed as well.

Our $500 bonus is not a joke, anyone who meets the above qualifications is eligible. The hourly pay will be based on experience but if you feel you are worth more than what we have listed, do not hesitate to contact us to discuss. Our pay is always going to be based on experience, the range of hourly pay will be between $21-27.

We offer full benefits including the following;  paid holidays and vacation, healthcare and 401K.
Please respond to this AD asap and you will be contacted to set up an interview within the next few days.
We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: SERVER/ BARISTA
Description:
BARISTA/ SERVER

Server / Barista (FOH)
Lucky's Café in Tremont is a nationally recognized, fast paced restaurant known for a unique approach to sustainability and the farm to table concept; we are looking for an experienced, passionate, hard-working Barista/Server.
Applicant should be:
• Very driven
• Personable
• Able to work well with others
• Energetic
• Dedicated to, and passionate about, the food service industry

Candidate will be expected to:
• Deliver consistent, made from scratch product in a timely manner
• Exercise fair judgment, honesty, and ethical problem solving
• Communicate clearly with coworkers in order to promote a healthy work environment


Who we are: At Lucky's Café, our mission is to provide the people of our community with crafted
food made by hand using only the freshest of ingredients.

Who you are: A dynamic, optimistic individual with a passion for excellence in your
work. You bring fresh energy and enthusiasm to work every day, have sound judgement, and open communication skills to both hear others and express yourself in a clear, coherent manner. You are self-motivated and thrive on critical feedback. You must enjoy working as a team and be a team player to succeed in our environment.

The job: On the server side you will be expected to greet customers, take orders, run food, bus tables, keep the dining room spotless, package retail, unpacking and stocking of deliveries, and represent Lucky's mission. For Baristas it's essentially the same except you will be expected to open and close the cafe everyday as well as prepare exceptional coffee and espresso drinks.

Requirements: Some previous industry experience in a high volume restaurant is a plus. Open, flexible schedule preferred but you must be able to work weekends. A keen eye for detail as well as a cool, calm and collected attitude is essential. Extra attention will be paid to resumes with Barista experience.

How to apply: Applicants interested in setting up an interview to learn more about the role must
email a resume, brief cover letter expressing why you are excited to work at Lucky's Café, and two professional references. Hours of operation are 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Title: Computer Technician
Description:
: Full-time 

: Very Competitive 

: As a ClickIT Certified Computer Technician, you will work as part of our Systems Administration team. You will be engaged with customers, solving their technical problems using our resources and tools. Work will entail occasionally traveling to customer sites to fix their networks, perform backups and maintain computer systems. You will also be working with customers who drop their computers by our Repair Center, while addressing internal I.T. needs, maintaining our data center, email, hosting, backup and other services offered. Customers range from local to national accounts, consumers to businesses.

:
Active Directory, Windows Server, MS Exchange, Windows & Apple Operating Systems, SQL Database, TCP/IP, DNS, NAT, RDP, Terminal Services, VPN, Routers, Firewalls, Switches, LAN, Cisco, VoIP, HyperV, Linux knowledge is a plus.

:
- Managing and maintaining network infrastructures
- Conducting network assessments
- Conducting basic network security assessments
- Managing disaster recovery & backup solutions
- Creating network documentation, including system procedures and schematics
- Conducting hardware/software installations
- Managing email accounts and MS Exchange for both Company and clients
- Assisting both in-house personnel and clients on day-to-day problems, questions, etc.

: Experience is helpful but not necessary. However, the ideal candidate will have an A+ certificate. We will be able to earn additional certifications, qualifying you to excel in this exciting field of computer technology. Other relevant certifications include: Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) and Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA).

:
- A degree from a technical institution or working towards one.
- Adequate, independent transportation and a valid driver's license.
- U.S. Citizenship or Green Card.

: Our exciting, growing IT company is headquartered in the quaint Village of Chagrin Falls, Ohio, just 30 miles east of downtown Cleveland. (To learn more about Chagrin Falls, go to .)

: We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks and substance abuse testing.

To learn more about our company, go to .

: Please send us your resume stating your education, hobbies, interests, and experience. Some level of experience is required, but what's more important to us is your ability and interest in learning. We will train the right individual.

To APPLY, email a cover letter and your resume to jobs@clickitco.com.

Description:
Interactive Research Communications is searching for Inside Sales - Survey Taking - candidates who would respond back to those who had downloaded a topic related whitepaper. This is a great opportunity for a self-starter with Technology Industry (IT) sales experience. Candidates are paid an hourly rate as an independent contractor and can work either full or part time from their home-office. The pay for this project is $15.00/hour.

Please note that this is a business-to-business telemarketing position using our cloud based telesales system designed for virtual agents. The position will require cold-calling our targeted lists using your own phone line, a WINDOWS-based computer, and high-speed internet access. You must be able to commit at least two hours per day for the first two week training period. After that, the days and number of hours that you work are flexible although you must commit to at least a minimum of four hours per day during the 5 day working week.

Our clients are A-list firms who are leaders in the IT industry. The candidate for this project will be cold-calling IT Managers and other mid-level executives in order to generate surveys regarding their technology plans for the next 12 months. You should have some basic knowledge of IT concepts, but will be trained on the specific technologies you will be presenting. All calling lists, scripts, and marketing materials will be provide to help ensure your success in taking these surveys. Training is provided and you will be paid during the initial training period.

If you are a self-starter who is motivated enough to make calls from your home that is located within the United States, without direct supervision and you have experience selling into or working in the IT industry, please apply by emailing your resume, no phone calls will be answered. If you would like more information about our company, please visit our website at: www. interactiveresearch. biz

Title: Assistant Brewer
Description:
Assistant Brewer
 
Executing and/or assisting in day to day brewery operations with strong potential to grow into a full-time brewer position. The best candidate is a person with one year of background experience in brewery operations, however, a strong desire to learn and willingness to work hard could warrant consideration with no prior experience. The assistant brewer will report directly to our Head Brewer and will be actively involved in all facets of the day-to-day operation.
 
Duties & Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
·       Assisting brewing team with brewing related issues, projects
·       Receiving raw ingredients
·       Milling
·       Basic brewhouse operation
·       Quality assurance
·       Cellar work including beer transfer, filtration, and carbonation
·       Operating keg washer
·       Cleaning, sanitation, and maintenance of brewhouse equipment and cellars
·       Sanitizing of tanks, filter equipment, hoses, etc
·       Proper handling of chemicals required for sanitization and cleaning of equipment
·       Understanding and practicing all internal safety standards
 
Requirements:
·       Passion for all things Craft Beer with a focus on the local community
·       Strong work ethic
·       Ability to work both independently and within a team, with minimal supervision
·       Ability to be on feet all day and able to lift 55+ lbs regularly
·       Comfortable working with chemicals and willingness to adhere to safety, environmental and brewhouse standards at all times
·       Good troubleshooting skills, and strong mechanical/electrical aptitude
·       Good written and verbal communication skills
·       1+ Year previous experience at a brewery as an assistant brewer, brewer, or cellarman  is preferred but not required
·       Degree or background in biology, chemistry or engineering is a bonus but not required
 
Compensation:
Compensation is commensurate with experience
  
If you feel you possess the skills necessary and the passion for working in a fun, craft beer loving environment, please contact at the email below. We are currently scheduling interviews.

Title: PAID CDL Training - Apply Right Away!
Description:
Looking for a job change? We will pay you to get your CDL!
You are hired and paid as an employee on day 1.  You'll be paid $500 a week as you get your CDL. The paid CDL training is four weeks which takes place at our local terminal. After that, you'll have your CDL and you'll get paid on the job training with a Certified Driver Trainer (between 2-3 weeks). From there, Roehl drivers with only nine months on the job are making $50,000 or more a year.  After you have your CDL, you'll start your on-the-job training as a long haul truck driver.
Join our team and grow with us!
If you were to go to a CDL school, you would not get paid while you are training AND you'd have to come up with the tuition for the school.   We're a stable company that provides full benefits - we invest in you.
Because the demand for this popular program is so strong, the first step is to complete our Get Started form on Roehl.Jobs  

If you contact Roehl by email, please include your first name, last name, email address, phone number, zip code and if you already have Class A CDL in your message so we can connect with you. You can also provide this information on our website.
You will then move through a learning and application process, where we ensure that you have a good understanding of the program, the basic qualifications and the characteristics of a truck driving job with Roehl so you can complete a thoughtful and informed application.
Premium Benefits
Roehl offers a complete benefits package to truck drivers, including one of the top profit-sharing contributions among US trucking companies, to support drivers and their families. In a truck driving job with Roehl, you'll find our benefits both comprehensive and affordable. Learn more about our pay, benefits and why so many experienced truck drivers choose Roehl. 
Career Path Opportunities
Want to advance your career? Whether you're an experienced driver, an owner operator or just starting out in the industry, with Roehl you'll find a wide variety of options both inside and out of the truck. Dedicated fleets offer many unique schedule, pay and freight options. In certain areas, local truck driving positions are regularly available for drivers with six months experience. You can also become a Certified Driver Trainer. From owning your own business to becoming an instructor - including non-driving positions  - your career path with Roehl is filled with options. 
 
About Roehl Transport and our Truck Driving Jobs
Roehl Transport provides professional truck driving jobs for those who are looking for a long-lasting career with a forward-thinking, driver-oriented company that is built on values. Our truck driver jobs include all levels of experience, as well as flatbed/specialized, van, refrigerated, and curtainside cargo.
•         Experienced Company Truck Drivers
•         Owner Operators
•         New Drivers CDL School Graduates
•         Learn to Drive a Truck (We will pay you while you get your CDL)
Roehl also provides career opportunities for non-drivers. Roehl is one of the 100 largest trucking companies in the nation. Our customers include some of the most prestigious brand names in America.

When you join Roehl you'll be part of a hands-on family business with people that are passionate about delivering the goods that drive America - we're giving trucking a new name.
Roehl Transport
Our drivers are leaders. 
Our leader is a driver.

Title: OTR Company Truck Drivers: Drive Nussbaum! Openings in Your Area!
Description:
Nussbaum Transportation Services was founded in 1945, with a single truck by Alden Nussbaum. Over the last 70 years, we've been building solid relationships with people and we owe our success to the quality of our drivers. Our hiring philosophy, and the reason so many drivers stay with us, is that we give you the most accurate picture of what driving for Nussbaum looks like from day one, ensuring there are no surprises and that we never fall short of your expectations.   If hired in our Primary Hiring Area, you can expect to get home weekly. However, you can also expect to spend two consecutive weeks away from the house about 4-6 times in a year. Our Extended Hiring Area offers routes that get you home about every other week. After running two weeks out, you can expect solid home time with 48 hours minimum. Also, you choose the arrival day - Friday or Saturday - and we'll make it happen.   We believe that the best drivers on the road deserve a smarter pay scale that gets them the most money for their mileage. We pay by practical miles rather than short miles and we bring it when it comes to accessorial pay and bonuses. We've been recognized as a Top Pay Carrier for offering a compensation package that ranks in the top 20% of the industry. Beyond great pay, we make sure our drivers get top-of-the-line equipment, high-tech maintenance, and new-model trucks. You can also expect:  * Home most weekends - it's one of our top priorities * Guaranteed weekly minimum paychecks * Average tenured driver pay: $0.48-$0.50/mile, $61k-$66k/year, $1180-$1300/week * Top 20% average pay, running 2,800 + miles a week: $1325-$1475/ week, $68-$80K/year * Late-model trucks with the comforts of home built-in * Major medical, dental and vision health benefits * Short-term disability & life insurance benefits * Rider program * Escalating paid time off & holidays * Company-matched 401K retirement plan  * Minimum age - 21 * 1-year verifiable experience and fewer than 3 jobs in past 12 months (exception - closures and/or job elimination) * No more than 3 moving violations or preventable accidents in past 3 years * Zero serious moving violations in the last 5 years (DUI, reckless driving, fatal accidents, or driving CMV without appropriate CDL)  * Excessive speeding - ZERO violations 15MPH over the speed limit in the last 3 years * License suspension for moving violation - zero for last 3 years * Pre-hire DAC background check performed  

 
Apply here:

Title: PERSONAL ASSISTANT needed for a Real Estate Investing Firm
Description:
PERSONAL ASSISTANT needed for a Real Estate Investing firm (Lakewood, OH)
compensation: per posting description, see below
READ CAREFULLY;

Amazing Job with VERY specific requirements.

PERSONAL ASSISTANT needed for a Real Estate Investing firm based in Lakewood, OH.

We are a progressive real estate investment company seeking a key representative. We are in the business of purchasing real estate in the Cleveland area. 

What's SPECIFICALLY needed from you..

(1) You MUST be a self-starter. This is a small organization that does a GREAT deal of business. There are AWESOME systems in place but you'll be figuring a bit out on your own. 

(2) You need to be TOTALLY comfortable with simple internet-based programs. Familiarity with Google (even google apps), online databases, etc. Also have an above-average grasp of Social Media (facebook, twitter, the like - PLEASE know what these are if applying )

(3) Our inbound calls from potential sellers has increased and need a great person to enhance our business. You will NOT be cold calling. Calls are generated to us from our various marketing campaigns and we need assistance taking their calls and turning them into qualified leads.

Candidates must possess the following skills:
• Great Team Player
• Ability to make 70 calls a day
• Must be organized
• Able to negotiate
• Must be upbeat and great nature
• Must have eloquent phone abilities
• Must be self-driven
• Must possess basic knowledge of Microsoft programs
• Ability to work well with others

(4) Be COMFORTABLE doing a small amount of PERSONAL ASSISTING. Since you'll be working DIRECTLY with me, at times I will need a few errands run. Pick up dry-cleaning, drop off FedEx, arrange for when the housekeeper comes by, etc.

(5) You'll be working out of a collaborative, open office environment with people who hustle and get things done. Think tech startup style energy and productivity.

OK - the COOL thing is that this is a pretty laid-back job where you get to interact with a lot of cool people. The WORK part of it is that sometimes there are DEADLINES and CRUNCHES and the schedule is intense then more laid back.

HERE'S WHAT YOU CAN DO NEXT.

Just to set your expectation, the last time I posted a job here I received over 300 applications and called TWO people back. I hired one of them immediately. So I will NOT be responding to all applications. Here's what I am looking for (see, this really CAN be easy!)

(1) Tell me how you will fit in THIS job! I've laid out as clearly as I can the job requirements. I know what I'm looking for and have made them a fit. I will NOT be calling you to clarify whether or not you're a fit. So there's no second chance - your response IS your impression!

(2) Tell me your income expectations (or a range). We'll be working together and I will be communicating VERY specific communications to you in the future. Being vague in this area just sets up a concern that you're not going to be able to ask for what you really want later if you come on board.

(3) Describe for me your ideal working environment. Hours, flexibility or structure, casual or formal. I'm kinda open to a number of options and inflexible on a few areas, but I want to know what works for you. I'm looking for the IDEAL fit, not to go through TRIAL runs...

(4) I'm glad to see your resume, but without an accompanying document (letter, rant, attachment, etc.) addressing the above, I can assure you that it will be a waste of your time.

IF YOU'VE READ THIS FAR!!!!
...brave soul!

Congratulations - you're possibly a fit for this pretty cool job. I love what I do and I'm looking for ONE person to help manage some things going forward. I'm much tamer than I sound but I do have very specific requirements which I communicate clearly then empower you to have the authority to enforce! You'll get to work with some quite renowned people (my clients) but the coolest part is our focus here on really improving our overall lives so a lot of focus and support will be given to that!

Get those responses over as soon as you can so the RIGHT one of you can start working right away. Reply to the email address at the top of this listing!

Title: Leasing Consultant Needed
Description:
Leasing Consultant 

Dominium is one of the leading affordable housing development and property management companies nationwide. We have operations in more than 20 states and over 850 employees.  For over 40 years, we have offered excellence to the development and management of affordable housing communities across the United States. 

With the distinct view that long-term returns matter, from development to management, the growth-oriented, high-performance culture strives to ensure each of the stakeholders of Dominium are well-served. Dominium employees experience both an engaging place to work and the motivations to contribute to growth, whether in project development, enterprise excellence or in the long-term value of properties well-managed. We offer a competitive salary, incentive bonus program, training and development programs, community volunteer and outreach program, and comprehensive benefits package including: Medical, Dental, Life & Disability, Paid Time Off, 401(K), Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Recognition & Wellness Programs.

Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! Title: Operations Manager | Punch Bowl Social Cleveland
Description:
OPERATIONS MANAGER
Punch Bowl Social is looking for a qualified individual to join their team in the capacity of Operations Manager.  This person will be hardworking, dedicated, and experienced in high volume restaurant/bar operations.


About Us:
Punch Bowl Social brings a southern-inspired scratch kitchen, led by culinary partner and celebrity chef, Hugh Acheson, a craft beverage program and a generous selection of old school games that provide a not-found-elsewhere day or night out experience. We are committed to our love of the trade, supreme hospitality, and believe in equality for each guest, team member and human being alike. Title: ✭10 DAY OUT REGIONAL OTR DRIVER✭ MAGNUM COMPANIES
Description:
Magnum LTD is looking for drivers in your area to be out 10 days at a time with 2-3 days of home time in between trips. A 10-day driver can expect to obtain 9,000-10,500 miles per month.  Pay is between 40-45cpm depending on experience.  Some hourly rates may apply. 

Magnum LTD is a family owned transportation company that maintains a fleet of new equipment with the average age of the tractor and trailers is less than 3 years old. All tractors are equipped with a.p.u.'s, inverters, refrigerators, navigation systems, and equipped to have Sirius radio.

Title: Fabrication Operator
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Pentair plc (NYSE: PNR) is a global company dedicated to building a safer, more sustainable world. Pentair delivers industry leading products, services and solutions that help people make the best use of the resources they rely on most. Its technology moves the world forward by ensuring that water is plentiful, useful and pure, and that critical equipment and those near it are protected. With 2016 revenues of $4.9 billion, Pentair employs approximately 19,000 people worldwide.
 
ELECTRICAL BUSINESS UNIT OVERVIEW:
A high-performance electrical business focused on improving utilization, lowering costs and maximizing customer uptime. Its industrial enclosures, fastening systems and thermal management technologies help protect sensitive equipment, buildings and critical processes and help keep people safe. Strategic business units include Enclosures, Thermal Management, and Electrical & Fastening Solutions.  Electrical generated approximately $2.1 billion in sales in 2016.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Set-up and perform printing, cutting, stripping, punching, coping and various forming operations on Flexibar
•Must be able to use tape measure and calipers
•Locate proper material, set-up and operate various equipment; video jet, kick press, piranha iron worker, punch press, terry table and stripper. 
•Work from routing sheets, blue prints, sketches and verbal instructions. 
•Perform continuous visual inspections to ensure quality parts and a safe work environment. 
•Perform pick and pack operations for customer orders of Flexibar.
•Report faulty equipment,  defective material and unusual conditions to supervisor. 
•Observe all prescribed safety rules and regulations and maintain work area in a neat and orderly condition.
•Perform other job duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS:
•High School diploma or equivalent.  Additional experience, training or formal education is beneficial.
•1-3 years Manufacturing Experience. Familiarity with processes and products in Flexibar department is preferred.
•Strong troubleshooting skills necessary, with the ability to make informed decisions.
•Good organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
•Ability to work in a fast-paced; multi-tasking environment and meet operational deadlines. 
•Must be self-motivated, safety and quality conscious, and work efficiently with minimal supervision.
•Heavy lifting required (50 plus lbs).   Lift truck operator experience required.
•Good communication skills with the ability to work in a team environment. 

EEO STATEMENT:
Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Manufacturing Operator - ACME
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Pentair plc (NYSE: PNR) is a global company dedicated to building a safer, more sustainable world. Pentair delivers industry leading products, services and solutions that help people make the best use of the resources they rely on most. Its technology moves the world forward by ensuring that water is plentiful, useful and pure, and that critical equipment and those near it are protected. With 2016 revenues of $4.9 billion, Pentair employs approximately 19,000 people worldwide.

ELECTRICAL BUSINESS UNIT OVERVIEW:
A high-performance electrical business focused on improving utilization, lowering costs and maximizing customer uptime. Its industrial enclosures, fastening systems and thermal management technologies help protect sensitive equipment, buildings and critical processes and help keep people safe. Strategic business units include Enclosures, Thermal Management, and Electrical & Fastening Solutions.  Electrical generated approximately $2.1 billion in sales in 2016.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Perform duties required to learn the set-up and operation of  multi-spindle screw machines for boring, grooving, chamfering, taping and facing operations on various-sized steel couplers.
• Requires the ability to troubleshoot machining operations to ensure quality and optimum machine performance.
• Work from drawings, route sheets, charts, tables and instructions. 
• Change collets and pushers, adjust stops, set and adjust tool holders and tools; load parts, actuate machine, check dimensions, and make necessary adjustments.
• Set tooling, sequences, speeds, and feeds which are generally prescribed or selected within a limited range. 
• Complete necessary reports and records. Maintain material lot integrity. Visually check parts for obvious damage or defects, burrs, and omitted operations. 
• Obtain first piece inspection and check work frequently using micrometers and various gauges to ensure adherence to specifications. 
• Adjust coolant flow and replenish reservoirs. 
• Report faulty equipment, defective material and unusual conditions to supervisor.
• Observe all prescribed safety rules and regulations and maintain work area in a neat and orderly condition.
• Perform other job duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:
• High School diploma or equivalent.  Additional experience, training or formal education is beneficial.
• Manufacturing experience preferred
• Strong troubleshooting skills necessary, with the ability to make informed decisions.
• Good organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced; multi-tasking environment and meet operational deadlines. 
• Must be self-motivated, safety and quality conscious, and work efficiently with minimal supervision.
• Heavy lifting required (50 plus lbs).   Lift truck operator experience preferred. 
• Good communication skills with the ability to work in a team environment.

Title: Press Operators - 2nd & 3rd Shift
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Pentair delivers industry leading products, services and solutions that help people make the best use of the resources they rely on most. Our technology moves the world forward by ensuring that water is plentiful, useful and pure, and that critical equipment and those near it are protected. Collaborating with industry partners, governments, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), and other companies, we serve a wide variety of customers in the residential and commercial, industrial, food and beverage, infrastructure, and energy verticals. With 2016 revenues of $4.9 billion and approximately 26,000 employees worldwide, the company operates as One Pentair, driven by purpose, led by vision, guided by process, and united by its Win Right Values.
 
ELECTRICAL BUSINESS UNIT OVERVIEW:
Electrical designs, manufactures, and services products that protect some of the world's most sensitive equipment, as well as heat management solutions designed to provide thermal protection to temperature sensitive fluid applications, and engineered electrical and fastening products for electrical, mechanical and civil applications.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Perform  duties required to setup and operate 3 or more automatic and/or multi-slide presses simultaneously for a variety of stamping products.
• Work from drawings, route sheets, schedules, written, and verbal instructions.
• Check material for correct size and type, load coils, adjust uncoiler and material rollers.
• Set-up complicated progressive dies, movable and stationary forming blocks, adjust stroke and feed as needed.
• Use micrometers, calipers, scales, and fixed gauges to check work in process and ensure adherence to specifications.
• Move materials in the performance of duties using lift truck or crane as necessary.
• Install and check safety devices as needed for specific jobs.
• Report faulty equipment, defective material and unusual conditions to supervisor.
• Observe all prescribed safety rules and regulations and maintain work area in a neat and orderly condition.
• Perform other related duties as assigned or directed, which may require more than the normal shift hours or work week to meet company needs.

REQUIREMENTS:
• High School diploma or equivalent.  Additional experience, training or formal education is beneficial.
• 1+ years Manufacturing Experience with previous experience operating and/or setting up a press
• Strong troubleshooting skills necessary, with the ability to make informed decisions.
• Good organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced; multi-tasking environment and meet operational deadlines.
• Must be self-motivated, safety and quality conscious, and work efficiently with minimal supervision.
• Heavy lifting required (50 plus lbs).   Lift truck operator experience required.
• Good communication skills with the ability to work in a team environment.
 
EEO STATEMENT
Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: ✈ Join One World Center - Volunteer in Africa and Brazil ✈
Maintenance Technician
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Pentair plc (NYSE: PNR) is a global company dedicated to building a safer, more sustainable world. Pentair delivers industry leading products, services and solutions that help people make the best use of the resources they rely on most. Its technology moves the world forward by ensuring that water is plentiful, useful and pure, and that critical equipment and those near it are protected. With 2016 revenues of $4.9 billion, Pentair employs approximately 19,000 people worldwide.
  
ELECTRICAL BUSINESS UNIT OVERVIEW:
A high-performance electrical business focused on improving utilization, lowering costs and maximizing customer uptime. Its industrial enclosures, fastening systems and thermal management technologies help protect sensitive equipment, buildings and critical processes and help keep people safe. Strategic business units include Enclosures, Thermal Management, and Electrical & Fastening Solutions.  Electrical generated approximately $2.1 billion in sales in 2016.

JOB OPPORTUNITY:
Paint Line  Maintenance Technician, 2nd Shift 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Perform duties required maintain the proper operations of the CADDY ARMOUR Paint Line.  
• Perform daily titrations and paint viscosity checks on the CADDY ARMOUR Paint Line.  
• Act on any actions that need to be taken if the titrations drift from their ideal range or if the paint varies from proper viscosity.  
• Monitor the line's operation to make sure everything is running properly. This includes automatic fills, counter flowing tanks, waste treatment, Centra-sep, tank temperatures, chemical drums and tote levels.  
• Help with moving parts to and from the line to enable the loader/unloader to continue running non-stop. 
• Troubleshoot problem areas and work with maintenance to perform recommend solutions.
• Monitoring inventories of paint and chemicals.  
• Ordering any supplies needed.  
• Perform testing on any new parts or trouble parts and adjust or write a recipe accordingly.  
• Perform extra maintenance on the waste treatment system if necessary. This will include the changing of the used ion exchange tanks out and putting a new one in line. 
• Taking water samples and shipping them outside lab for analysis.  
• Draining and cleaning the rinse tanks according to the suggested interval by PPG.  Drain, clean, and make new chemical tanks as needed according to schedule.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: 
• High school diploma or equivalent 
• Manufacturing experience is required. 
• Experience with coatings or plating is preferred.
• Basic math (add, subtract, multiply, divide), measuring tools basics (calipers, scale, fixed gauges), minimal blue print reading
• Heavy lifting required (50 plus lbs).
• Stand up lift truck operator experience preferred.

Title: Sweet Moses - Assistant Manager
Description:
Soda Fountain & Treat Shop - Assistant Manager

Work/Life balance in a food and beverage job? Yes, it can happen! We're committed to rewarding talented people who are tired of working until 2:00 am, every Friday and Saturday night. At Sweet Moses, you can work  a full-time position, and still have time and energy for a family, friends and outside interests!

Position Details:
Sweet Moses Soda Fountain & Treat Shop is offering an exciting opportunity for an assistant manager who can take on a range of front-of-house responsibilities in an independently-owned restaurant and retail treat shop. The ideal candidate will be outgoing, organized, creative, energetic and have a desire to take on expanded responsibilities which could lead to promotion opportunities. 

The assistant manager will work closely with the manager to help train and oversee front of house workers, including shift managers, scoopers, bussers and dishwashers, to ensure operational standards are met and exceeded. Additional responsibilities include assisting with inventory, ordering, merchandising and packaging.

THIS IS NOT AN ENTRY LEVEL POSITION. 

We will be reviewing resumes and applications for candidates who meet the following criteria:
  -Proven, solid work history with full-service restaurant or quick-serve dining experience.
  -Flexible schedule, with availability to work daytime, evenings and weekends. 
  -Outgoing personality.
  -Organized and self-motivated
  -Must have reliable transportation.


About the Shop:
Sweet Moses is a unique, independently-owned ice cream and sweet shop located in Cleveland's Gordon Square Arts District--two miles west of Public Square. We offer our guests a range of premium homemade ice cream and confections, and serve them up as part of a full-service, nostalgic, 1940s soda experience. Learn more at SweetMosesTreats dot com, and on the shop's Facebook page


Applications are available on the "About Us" tab of our website: www.SweetMosesTreats.com as well as within shop. 


Hiring Now! Please forward your resume for immediate consideration!

If submitting a resume online please respond through craigslist posting.

Title: TV CASTING CALL: Are you dating your EX's relative?
Description:
Are you in a serious relationship with an ex's family member?
Are you engaged to your ex's sibling, cousin, or other relative?
Has this made the relationship easier? Or harder?  

A major cable network is looking for men and women who are dating or engaged to someone related to their ex. Maybe you met while you were with your ex and realized it was true love ... or maybe you fell in love years after the relationship ended. Maybe this has made things harder for your family ... or easier! In this documentary-reality series, we want to meet all different kinds of people to tell their stories.

It's all about getting over the hurdles we all face to find true love! 
 
If you or someone you know is in a serious relationship with an ex's family member, we want to hear from you! There is compensation if you are chosen for filming. 

Please reply to this ad with: 

Name
Age
Email
Phone (and best time to call)
Recent Photos of you and your significant other
Who you are dating / in a relationship with
How you met
Most importantly, tell us why you would be perfect for this project!

We look forward to hearing from you! 

Please forward this to anyone who would be interested!

Title: Review Appraiser
Description:
Review Appraiser


Company Summary

First American Title's Mortgage Solutions division is a member of the First American Financial Corporation (NYSE: FAF) family of companies. First American traces its history to 1889 and was named one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For® in 2016 and 2017. The Mortgage Solutions division provides title insurance settlement services, signing services, portfolio analytics, retention and acquisition services; property valuations; and default solutions for the mortgage banking industry. In fact, Mortgage Solutions works with a multitude of people across the entire origination, servicing and default continuum, and has helped close millions of real estate transactions nationwide. For more information, visit www.firstam.com/mortgagesolutions/

Job Summary

Essential Functions

    Review appraisal report and supplemental documentation to determine accuracy of report
    Identify appraisals where value conclusions differ and coordinate the process of reconciliation
    Coordinate the communication process between various vendors to facilitate final resolution
    Maintain detailed records of the resolution process
    Communicate with Internal and external customers to explain appraisal product findings
    Coach vendors regarding appraisal practices and technical issues including policy, procedure change and regulatory compliance

Job Complexities

    Assignments are routine in nature and instructions are more detailed.
    Has minimal latitude for un- reviewed action or decision.

Supervision Received or Extended

    Work under close supervision applying well established techniques, procedures or specific standards. Work is reviewed for soundness of judgment and overall accuracy
    No responsibility for the supervision of others

Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used

    Ability to analyze data, draw sound conclusions and summarize results
    Detail oriented and self-motivated
    Must be able to work in a fast paced, accurate environment
    Must have good communication skills, both written and verbal, and must be able to deliver a clear and understandable message to a variety of audiences including appraisers, vendors and operational staff
    Good organizational skills with the ability to multi task , prioritize and follow up

Typical Education

    High School diploma or equivalent required

Typical Range of Experience

    Typically requires 0-1 years of related experience with a mortgage and/or appraisal company

License or Certification

    License or Certification a plus

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

First American invests in its employee's development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

Description:

The Home Instead Senior Care® network strives to provide compassionate and reliable care services to enable seniors to remain at home. Established in 1994, we've grown from a handful of local franchise offices to over 1,000 franchises nationally and internationally. Title: Security Guard - Part time - at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown
Description:
2 part time positions available, working evenings and overnight shifts.  

Click here to apply now!
 
 
 Education/Training Requirements
Must have one year of Security experience; Some conflict resolution and/or customer service experience.  Ability to work well under very stressful situations;  able to control one's emotions.
Must be available to work all shifts including nights, weekends and holidays.

Responsible for the security of hotel facility and guests.  The security team oversees all areas of the hotel property, inside and out, from the  to the private guest rooms. Respond to individual needs as well as providing assistance during larger scale situations such as power outages.

Primarily role to observe and report all security violations and when necessary, contact the properties.
Ensure that all hotel facilities are secure, and in compliance with fire and safety standards of the hotel.
Friendly interaction with Guests in order to provide exceptional Guest service.
Assist emergency personnel with hotel access.
Use of conflict resolution techniques, within hotel guidelines, to assist providing a safe and quiet environment for all guests.
Respond to individual guest needs and concerns.
Patrol property, both inside and outside.
Check security locks and alarms on doors and stairwells.
Escort guests as needed.
Monitor surveillance cameras.
Submit written reports.
Work cooperatively with local law enforcement
Delivering items to hotel guests as directed by the front desk staff or MOD.
Execute any reasonable task or assignment designated by hotel management.
Insure safe and harassment free work environment by insuring all aspects of safety procedures and employee handbooks are followed.
Education/Training Requirements
Must have one year of Security / Conflict resolution or customer service experience.  Ability to work well under very stressful situations.
Must be available to work all shifts including nights, weekends and holidays.

As a VR Team Member your job will be to assist customers with questions, demonstrate equipment, and ensure that customers are having the best experience possible. You will be responsible for checking in customers, setting up and sanitizing equipment, and selling craft beer and appetizers. We offer an opportunity to work in a fun environment with a flexible schedule!

Your Job Details and Qualifications:
Deliver a fun experience to guests by using your top notch customer service skills and serving them with the best combination of food, drinks, and games
Check in customers by determining how much time they want to buy, gather their payment and signature on our wavier
Demonstrate game equipment and basic controls to customers. Let them know all the possibilities our Virtual Reality equipment has to offer!
Check back on guests after they have started their gaming and received their food and drinks. Make sure they are having a great time and that they have everything they need.
Clean equipment and rooms after guests paid time is up.
Inform management promptly of any problems or unusual matters of significance.
Must be reliable, trustworthy, and have attention to detail
Must be able to work quickly and efficiently while maintaining a fun atmosphere for customers and other team members

The Legal Stuff:
Must be 19 or older
Must be authorized to work in the United States and pass a criminal background check
Must be able to complete all job duties with reasonable accommodation

VR RAGE LLC is an equal opportunity employer

Title: Certified Nursing Assistant - CNA
Description:
Do you enjoy getting to know people and building meaningful relationships? Do you have a heart for helping those in need? If so, this entry level CAREGiver role could be just the fit for you! 


CAREGivers provide a variety of in-home care services for seniors, helping them to stay safe and independent. The Home Instead Senior Care® network strives to provide compassionate and reliable care services to enable seniors to remain at home. Established in 1994, we've grown from a handful of local franchise offices to over 1,000 franchises nationally and internationally. We support those that are a part of our team, offering competitive pay and benefits as well as a variety of shifts. 










Entry level CAREGivers provide companionship and conversation for clients, enhancing the lives of aging adults throughout our community. 















Job requirements and pay/benefits for the CAREGiver role may vary by each independently owned and operated franchise office. As a CAREGiver, you will receive training from the local Home Instead Senior Care franchise office.

Title: Teacher
Description:
Description
KinderCare Education is the nation's leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, we're united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.
 
Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.
When you join our team as a Teacher you will:
 
Implement KCE's curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.   
Support your center's success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement. 
Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.

To apply for this position, please click the following link: 

Qualifications
Required Skills and Experience:
 
A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day.  
Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential and meet NAEYC candidacy requirements (or willing to obtain)
CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
1+ year Early Childhood Education Experience (preferred)
Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors.   Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
Ability to speak, read, and write English.

The benefits our career professionals enjoy:
 
In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include:
 
Medical, dental and vision 
Discounted child care 
Generous paid time off 
Education assistance and reimbursement 
Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs 
401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match 
 
KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare® Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work®, Champions® Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools ™ , Knowledge Beginnings® and The Grove School®.
 
KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

Title: Earn $650/mo teaching part-time - online from home - 60-90 mins/day
Description:
The VIPKID Teach English Online opportunity:

Looking for a flexible, professional online teaching opportunity? VIPKID is the world leader in online English education for kids 12 and under.

Rediscover the joy of teaching with VIPKID's platform and curriculum. No commute, no grading, no lesson planning required! Instruct kids in your spare time during early mornings or evenings.

Teaching just 60 minutes part-time per day earns you between $420-650 a month. It's as easy as making a Skype call, with interactive and fun curriculum and lesson plans made for your use.

- Ranked #5 by Forbes on its 2017 "Top 100 Remote Work" companies
- The most active online English teaching community in the world
- Top-ranked online teaching company on Indeed and Glassdoor with 4-star rating and 86% CEO approval
- Backed by Sequoia Capital and Tencent Holdings (currently valued at $1.5 billion)

Please search for VIPKID on YouTube, Facebook, and Glassdoor to see the rave reviews from the 20,000+ North Americans that teach for us.

Requirements and Qualifications to become an Online English Teacher/Online ESL Teacher:

- BA degree or higher
- Experience with any kind of teaching (1+ years)*
- Eligible to legally work in the U.S. or Canada
- Desire to engage and inspire young learners

*Note on Teaching Experience: This can include educators, professors, tutors, teaching assistants, elementary teachers, traditional teaching experience or the equivalent in mentoring, tutoring, or alternative education.

While helpful, there's no requirement for teaching certificate, state certification, TESOL, TEFL, or ESL experience. All classes and business are conducted in English.

Other experience you may have that are not requirements, but are preferred:

- Online English Education / Educator / Online English Teaching / Online Instructor
- Home-Based Online English Teacher / Online English Tutor / Online English Tutoring
- Online English Teacher Assistant / Online English Elementary Teacher
- Summer Teacher / Casual Teacher / Assistant Teacher / Teaching Assistant
- Elementary School Teacher / High School Teacher
- Substitute Teacher / Teacher Assistant / Lead Teacher

The Basics of the Online English Teacher Role:

- The classes: 25-minute full immersion English language, 1-on-1 classes
- The pay: Depends on your experience, but as reported on Indeed, averages around $9.5 per 25-minutes class, i.e.$19/hour
- The curriculum: U.S. Common Core aligned lesson material, designed by our in-house curriculum team
- Time of day: You choose your schedule from available class slots; peak student demand hours are listed below
- Location: Conveniently teach remote from your own home - no commute!
- What you need: You only need is computer, a strong internet connection, and a headset 
- Benefits: Learn best online teaching experiences from our professional team at no cost
- The culture: You will learn about Chinese culture, families, and lifestyle through classroom exchanges with our students

Contract type: Independent contractor
Start date: Immediately

Peak times: The following hours tend to be the most requested time periods to teach from our families:

- Monday-Sunday 6-10am EST
- Saturday-Sunday 9pm-10am EST

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply through our Teacher Recruitment Portal:

Linkedin: 

FAQs for applicants:
