Title: Become a Class A CDL Truck Driver & Earn Big with our NEW Pay Increase
Description:
Become a Class A CDL Truck Driver & Earn Big with our NEW Pay Increase! Earn More with our NEW Pay Increase! Call for details! 866-448-0192  No Experience? No Problem! Start your Career Today!  In as little as three weeks of sponsored training at an approved CRST facility, you'll be on the road, traveling the country, as a professional truck driver. There is always a job out there for a truck driver and it pays a lot more than you may think. In this high demand industry, with your CDL A license, you can find work all over the country. At CRST, you'll learn first-hand from industry veterans who know what it takes to make it in the transportation industry. With a Class A CDL, you can quickly work your way up from a student to a trainer, with the opportunity to run your own business as an Owner Operator through our Lease Purchase program, in less than a year!  Veterans paid for time served. CRST Expedited's Military Apprenticeship Program pays you for your service while you earn your Class A CDL. If you use your GI Bill™ you can earn additional tax free income. Active Military Reservists and Honorably Discharged Veterans also receive a sign on bonus and pay credit for your time served.  If you have at least 2 years of experience driving a commercial vehicle in the military, you may be able to get started even sooner through the Military Skills Test Waiver. This means you would only have to pass the written exam to get your CDL, and there is an immediate pay increase.  Call a Military Specialist Recruiter for Details! 866-622-4805 Pay & Benefits: Our student program helps you launch a rewarding truck driving career. •	NEW Pay Increase after 3 Months! Now 30 cents per mile! •	Guaranteed home time: one day off for every week out •	In as few as six months earn even more as a lead driver • Longest average miles in the industry - earn more! •	Hazmat Mileage Bonus •	Affordable top-carrier medical, dental, and life insurance •	Matched 401(k) plan • 99% no-touch, 80% drop-and-hook freight •	Average fleet age of just 1 ¼ years •	Hundreds of new trucks with late-model equipment •	Industry-leading safety program Call and learn how fast you can get started. 866-448-0192 Must be 21 years old to apply.

Title: Manager
Description:
We are looking for an energetic manager to oversee our thriving, busy breakfast restaurant at our east side location.   There is a possibility that you might work at our west side restaurant as well.

This is the PERFECT job for someone who is tired of late nights and long hours. You will work less than 50 hours per week and will be compensated like you work 60!  We close early in the afternoon seven days a week, so you can be home with your family for dinner. Different than most restaurants, chains/franchises, YOUR QUALITY OF LIFE is important to us. We have tried to create a warm, friendly and high energy environment for our managers, employees and customers. We compensate well and we will give you thorough training so that you can contribute quickly. Our restaurants are busy, and weekends are not for the timid! We are looking for a manager who can work five days per week.  Your schedule never changes, so you can plan your days off and evenings.  Future opportunities and growth are possible.  Some specifics below:
1.  You must have INITIATIVE, DRIVE and ENERGY.  We are looking for someone who will work as hard as we do!  If you are slow paced, need constant direction and guidance, please do not apply.
2. You should be able to work with and nurture a diverse employee and customer base. This is of paramount importance to us and we will ask you to demonstrate this ability and experience in an interview.
3. You should fully understand a restaurant P&L, not only how to read it, but more importantly what strategies can be realized from the information and how can you put these into processes to improve our business.
4. Our restaurant uses Micros, so any experience with that system is beneficial.
5. We do not hold your hand, rather, we are looking for managers who can work on their own, make good, solid decisions and take care of problems as they arise.  You need to show initiative!
6. You should be able to "troubleshoot" problems with the operations of the building, including HVAC, computers, coffee equipment, etc.
7. You must be able to open the restaurant at 6am for the employees. Everyone works on working week-ends.
8. You should be able to conduct a food inventory, be able to put in food/chemical/paper orders on a consistent basis understanding "pars" as well as keeping inventory levels to a minimum.
9. We will ask you how you develop processes for improvement and, moreover, how you manage to keep these processes in place.
10. You should have good, reliable transportation.
11.  You should be a good listener and compassionate to our customers and employees.  If you can't manage in "gray" areas, this job is NOT for you.
12.  You may work at both of our locations:  Westgate Mall and Beachwood.
13.  If your idea of "managing" is taking long smoke breaks or talking on your cell phone, this job is NOT for you.

We offer a great salary, set shifts, two weeks paid vacation, full medical/dental/vision/life insurance for you AND your family, and bonus.  We will begin interviewing immediately if we feel you have the qualifications for the job. Total compensation package will be negotiated during the interview process.
Compensation: Total comp:  $55-57K (salary, bonus, benefits) 401K, owner pays medical/dental/life

Title: Dirt Specialist
Description:
Two Men & A Vacuum is Central Ohio's #1 Cleaning Company in Columbus and we are quickly growing in the Cleveland area. We are currently growing fast and looking for great, qualified staff cleaners to join our force of Dirt Specialists in the Columbus area. We are looking for candidates that are seeking long term employment opportunities that want to learn and grow with the company as we continue to expand our markets. 

We are especially looking for candidates with daytime availability and residential home cleaning experience. 
As a team member, you can expect an incredible team culture, personal and professional growth opportunities, and all the training, supplies and resources you need to effectively do the best job! Please visit our site at www.twomenandavacuum.com and learn more about Two Men & A Vacuum.

AGGRESSIVE PAY SCALE BASED ON EXPERIENCE - Short-term wage increases available 
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS

*Candidates should have a positive attitude and be seeking stable, long-term employment
*Friendly demeanor and driven to deliver exceptional customer service. 
*Must work well individually or as a team of 2 or more, with limited supervision needed
*Must have own vehicle in order to transport yourself and supplies between sites
*Must have a smartphone to be able to use an application for scheduling and your time sheet.
*Must be able to pass a multiple state criminal background check and be able to be bonded and insured by the company

RESPONSIBILITIES
*Clean designated residential or commercial areas (typical duties include dusting, sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, restroom & kitchen cleaning, baseboards, appliance and window cleaning)
*Arrive to work location on time, perform services as requested and ensure the residence or property is locked/secured when you leave.
*Attention to detail, ability to identify areas that need to be cleaned
*Ability to interact positively with clients and their family while onsite
Compensation: Starting Pay $11.00/hr. However, negotiable depending on the level of previous experience.

Title: Restaurant Manager
Description:
The Music Box Supper Club (musicboxcle.com) has an immediate opening for a responsible and experienced restaurant manager.

The restaurant manager will work alongside the GM and AGM to lead our team by example--especially by maintaining a positive attitude and demonstrating strong customer service skills.


Our ideal candidate must possess the following qualifications:

*At least 2 years of restaurant management experience

*The ability to hire, coach and develop employees in order to build a strong, cohesive working team and team atmosphere

*An outgoing, customer-focused personality. The person in this position will be interacting with our guests, in order to ensure we're providing world-class service and food--and also taking steps to address any complaints in a timely, appropriate manner.

*Strong computer and POS skills

Other qualifications for this hands-on position include:

*Maintaining a high ratio of return customers by ensuring excellent service

*Practicing and maintaining safety for both our guests and employees

*Helping team members develop and acquire greater work skills

*Supporting our GM & AGM in executing marketing programs to meet/exceed sales targets

*Maintaining open communication with the General Manager & AGM

*Managing ordering, inventory, scheduling and staffing

*Coaching employees in all aspects of sales

*Ability to work well with others

*Some experience working in a fine dining establishment also preferred

Interested parties should send their resume to hirememusicbox@gmail.com

Title: Help Seniors Stay Home
Description:
Would you get satisfaction from making a real difference in the lives of senior citizens? Do you have a "calling" to help others?
If so, you will find that being a CAREGiver will enhance the quality of life of our clients who wish to remain in their own homes as long as possible. 
Provide companionship, stabilization, and a safe environment for our clients.

Title: Entry level sales - Weekly guaranteed salary - Stop being stressed out
Description:
Hello and thanks for your interest in working with Elite Mobility Inc. Directv's Preferred dealer for Northeast Ohio. 

We are a direct sales organization that works hand in hand with at&t and DIRECTV. We specialize in outside sales (b2b, door to door) and also Event sales (trade shows, big home and garden shows, car shows, county and state fairs).

We have two types of compensation: 

Base Salary of $300 per week. This salary has nothing to do with how many sales you do, and is a guaranteed salary paid weekly. In addition to your base pay salary we pay individually on products sold. 

DIRECTV VIDEO SALE: $40
UVERSE VIDEO SALE: $75
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $88.00
FOR ADVANCED SALESPEOPLE WE OFFER A 100% COMMISSION OPTION:

DIRECTV SALE: $160
UVERSE SALE: $75
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $350 plus $50 for any camera sold, up to two cameras. 
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Schedule and hours: 

We work Monday Through Friday from 12 noon to 7:30pm. 

We have 3 scheduled team meetings: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. The other two days, we meet to turn in paperwork and receive territory from upper management.

Do we offer advancement opportunities?: 

Yes we do, infact we are a preffered dealer for DIRECTV and At&t. This means at&t and Elite Mobility have teamed up to grow at&t's footprint, in turn they finance our expansion as an organization. Qualified salespeople that have higher than average sales numbers will be given an opportunity to manage a sales team. Our organization has a set standard and procedure for once a sales team hits their quota two months in a row, a location and franchise office will be opened up for that sales manager. That sales manager will then be promoted out of a sales role into a general manager role. The pay for the GM position begins at $75,000 per year plus commission and bonus's.
Compensation: Base pay plus commission. $300 WEEKLY PAY , PLUS COMMISSION - AVG WEEK $800

AutoCAD / Architectural Designer
Description:
AutoCAD / Architectural Designer

Successful and established company, is seeking a qualified CAD Designer with 2D and 3D experience to add to its team. This position is a long term, full time employment opportunity for the right qualified candidate.
Applicant must be proficient in reading Architectural drawings. The applicant must have good oral and written communication skills.

The CAD Designer will prepare clear, complete, detailed CAD drawings for commercial construction along with 3D visuals.
• Coordinate with sales staff, structural engineer and other trade disciplines.
• Ensure document control by storing and archiving files for easy retrieval.

Qualification Requirements: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability to perform this job successfully.
• Bachelor or Associates degree in related field or trade school certification in drafting design or equivalent.
• Ability to read, analyze, understand, and interpret design and construction documents.
• 2+years' experience in drafting and construction related design.

•Skills and Experience 
· Expert knowledge of the Autodesk (AutoCAD) and Solid works 3D software.
. Experience with blueprint take-offs & material requirements. 
· Knowledgeable of principles of architecture, engineering, and construction. 
· Strong attention to detail, organization skills and the ability to multi-task. 
· Ability to work with Microsoft Office Suite, as needed (Word, Excel, Outlook). 
· Must have experience interfacing with clients, sales staff, owners and contractors.     Some light office duties.

Competitive employee benefit program 
Salary Commensurate with experience

Title: Call Center Representative - Inbound
Description:
DialAmerica is growing and looking to fill Part Time positions with permanent hires for our Inbound shifts. We are currently accepting applications for an exciting opportunity to service new and existing customer accounts by phone for industry-leading clients.
 
We are looking for high-energy individuals who are conversational, articulate, engaging and have a positive attitude. If you fit that description and like talking to people, then we invite you to join our team.  Our dedicated staff will teach you everything you need in a small team environment to be successful.  

Earn top dollar for your performance and feel good representing nationally known companies.

Experienced professionals are always welcome, and entry-level candidates are encouraged to apply.

Small training classes, one-on-one coaching, and our proven strategy guarantee your success.

We offer schedules as low as 20 and up to 35 hours a week between the hours of 11am - 10pm Monday through Friday and 9am - 3pm Saturday.  We will work with you to find the right schedule!

We offer:
•	Guaranteed hourly or performance based incentives -- whichever is greater ($8.50-11/hr.)
•	Paid Training and weekly pay with Direct Deposit available
•	Consistent weekly schedules of 20 -- 35 hours 
•	Small training classes with one on one coaching
•	Supportive and motivating staff to help you succeed
•	Opportunities for advancement -- we promote from within
•	Healthcare coverage available after 3 months

Our call center is conveniently located 15 minutes west of downtown Cleveland on Center Ridge Rd between Clague and Columbia. We are easily accessible from I90 & I480 & on the #49 bus route.

DialAmerica is committed to the success of our people. We provide personal growth and recognition, integrity in the workplace and a positive work environment!!


Our ideal Call Center Representatives will possess:  

•	A healthy competitive spirit and be goal oriented
•	A friendly, conversational and engaging phone presence
•	The ability to work well in a dynamic fast paced environment
•	Dependable and reliable work habits 
•	Proficient computer and data entry skills
•	A High School diploma or equivalent and must be 18 years of age

If you are interested in this position, please click on the following link:  



The sooner you apply, the sooner you can start!

Title: Flatbed Conestoga - $1600/WK or $90K/YR!!
Description:
Seeking Class A flatbed/conestoga drivers for OTR/Regional work. Our avg. drivers make $1600/wk.
Top drivers make $110K/year. 
Pay is based on 27% of Linehaul rate.
Company pays 60% of Employee's Health Ins.
Sign On Bonus is $500.00 per verifiable year of experience, caps @ $2500.00, pd. @ 90 days
We have 2013 & newer equipment, we run classic Petes & KW's, big bunk Int'ls, 386 Petes
T660's & T680's, all have APU's & plenty of room in the cabin. We have a clean set up that is organized.
We have brand new 2017 53' spread axle aluminum Aero Conestoga XP's with headache racks/ boxes.
We keep our equipment maintained!
We currently have a few openings due to new equipment being purchased.
We offer a personable relationship to our drivers, don't just be a number! We are a financially stable company with zero debt! 
Must have 2 years Class A with 6 months flatbed experience. 
We're looking for drivers wanting long-term employment & a home to retire from
This is a great opportunity for great drivers!
We will now be giving option to new recruits of 26%-28% of linehaul OR .48 to .52 for all cents per all miles based on clean driving record and experience. The mileage will be based off PC Miler in our office per dispatch. 

•	Should average 2500 to 2900 miles weekly
•	Makes up to $104,000 a year 
•	Will have stop pay per stop including extra mileage pay between stops
•	Detention pay offered per customer contract
•	We pay you for Load Cancellation for your time wasted
•	Your time matters, so we preplan you ahead to ensure you are not sitting
•	Short Runs will pay additional money on top of normal cents per mile
•	$500 bonus for All Clean Inspections
•	Direct Deposit Offered
•	Home Time when Requested 
•	All Trucks have Rand McNally with Navigation and Talk to Text Email
•	APU on All Trucks
•	Medical Insurance
•	Life and 401K plans coming next 60 days
•	Vacation Pay (6 months earns 3 days - 1 year earns 6 days - 2 years earns 8 days - 3 years earns 12 days - 5 years earns 15days)
•	Employee Assistance Program - we can offer financial advisor, attorney advisor, or counsel when needed
•	Employee Assistance Escrow - we can take $25 weekly (or more) up to $1,000 and set aside for special need circumstances. After $1,000 we pay out $1,100 in % earned on that account.
•	We will have a Quarterly Bonus Tier as per below
-	Average 10,000 miles a month and earn a $150 bonus
-	Average 10,500 miles a month and earn a $250 bonus
-	Average 11,250 miles a month and earn a $350 bonus
-	Average 12,000 miles a month and earn a $600 bonus
Call Leslie today for more info! PH# 317-743-8700, 317-743-8700 or Vickie @ 317-497-8112 or go to www.securetransitllc.com to apply!

Title: fuel facility operator
Description:
Arc Terminals Holdings LLC.
Cleveland Terminal

TERMINAL OPERATOR


POSITION SUMMARY

Arc Terminals operates a multi-product, bulk liquid rail, truck and marine Terminal located in Cleveland, Ohio. The terminal operator is responsible for safely performing all tasks associated with the receiving, storing, blending, sampling, testing and loading of combustible and flammable liquids. Operators are critical in maintaining quality assurance, community relations, regulatory compliance, customer communications, and asset protection. All operations are done with safety and environmental compliance a top priority.

        The facility operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.  Terminal operators may be required to work all shifts, including days, nights, weekends and Holidays.


        RESPONSIBILITIES

            This position requires the operator to learn and perform all tasks in accordance with Arc's  
            HSSE policies and procedures along with adhering to all local, state and federal regulations.

•	Daily responsibilities include but are not limited to maintaining facility security, facility maintenance and general housekeeping.

•	The Terminal operator is responsible for accepting product deliveries, either via pipeline, truck, rail or barge and perform required sampling and testing of all products to maintain quality control.

•	Maintain inventory control by physically gauging and sampling all receiving tanks before and after receipts.

•	Assist in the maintenance and repair of the terminal loading rack and equipment associated with terminal operations, and keeping the facility in good working order by utilizing preventative maintenance procedures.

•	Conduct daily terminal inspections of the entire facility including truck loading rack, rail siding, pipeline manifolds and dock area.

•	Perform routine facility maintenance as needed included but not limited to painting, general housekeeping, snow removal and grounds upkeep.

•	Operate, maintain and repair, or assist in repairing, equipment associated with the bulk handling of petroleum liquids.

•	Responsible for communicating to contractors and drivers all safety requirements.

•	Be able to effectively communicate with outside agencies such as the USCG and the EPA on situations regarding the facility.

•	Perform duties of a first responder in a spill or other emergency situations.

•	Correctly complete all required paperwork prior to and after all product receipts.

•	Be able to work diligently and follow all safety requirements to prevent product contamination and avoid spills. Perform environmental and regulatory checks (eliminating, containing and reporting all leaks and spills)

•	Assist drivers in the loading and unloading of trucks.

•	Maintain a good relationship with all terminal customers, responding to their needs or requests as needed.



PHYSICAL DEMANDS

•	Be able to work in a variety of environmental conditions (extreme cold / heat) while wearing appropriate PPE, FR clothing, safety glasses and hard hat.

•	Be able to comfortably climb 50' storage tanks while wearing PPE.

•	Manually open and close large valves several times per shift.

•	Regularly required to stand, walk, and climb etc. for extended periods of time.

•	Ability to lift normally up to 50 lbs. and occasionally more. Ability to stoop, kneel, crouch, reach, stand, walk, push, lift, grasp and pull.

•	Ability to respond to emergency situations (leaks, spills and fires) by implementing facility response plans.



ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

•	Must have a valid driver's license.
•	Must have the ability to obtain a TWIC
•	Must either possess or be able to pass HAZWOPER training, HM126F training and annual updates as required by the Arc Cleveland location.
•	The ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing with co-workers, supervisors, customers and truck drivers.
•	The ability to work in stressful conditions, along with the ability to adapt to changing circumstances and environmental conditions.
•	The ability to work on both a scheduled and a call out basis.
•	This position is subjected to random drug screening.
•	Ability to accept supervision and direction and work effectively either in a team setting or alone.
•	To be a successful member of the Arc team, you must be able to demonstrate a commitment to environmental responsibility and regulatory compliance.
•	Individual must be available during non-work hours as required and will be required to carry a cell phone at all times.  Normal and extraordinary work circumstances may require, without notice, extended hours, weekend and/or holiday work. 
•	Regular attendance is mandatory


THE ABOVE STATEMENTS ARE INTENDED AS A GENERAL GUIDELINE TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION, BUT DO NO ENCOMPASS ALL THE RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES, SKILLS OR CONDITIONS THAT MAY ARISE.

Title: Life Insurance Agents Wanted!
Description:
Lincoln Heritage Life Insurance Company is the Nation's Leader in Final Expense.  The Lincoln Heritage Funeral Advantage® program is an affordable and convenient way for individuals to get Final Expense life insurance.  If you are interested in making a career for yourself, call us today!  1-888-713-6020.

Requirements:  

•	Life Insurance License
•	Valid driver's license & vehicle
•	Access to a computer
•	Motivated & ready to work
•	Sales experience a plus

Benefits/Incentives:

-Advanced Commissions
-Residual Income Opportunity
-Company Sponsored, In-House Lead Program---TV /Direct Mail ---no cold calling!
-1 Page Application
-Simplified underwriting with 24/7 assistance
-Marketing materials---inserts, door hangers & more
-Benefits: Health/Dental for Qualifying Agents (and their families). Based on Production.
-Marketing Tools You'll Need to Succeed
-Home Office Support & Reporting

Job Duties:

-Work your leads!
-Manage and train your sub-agents
-Meet with your client to find the product that fits your clients' needs
-Close the sale
-Submit application to our home office & GET PAID SAME DAY!

How does our program work?

-Lincoln Heritage generates thousands & thousands of high quality, compliant leads through our nationwide direct mail & television commercial programs.
-Interested responders will return the direct mail lead piece, or phone in to our call center to have an agent call/meet with them.
-A letter is then mailed from our home office to all responders that same day, thanking them for their interest, and letting them know we will have an agent contact them.
-Leads are distributed through our online lead portal that you can access 24/7.
-You will receive an email confirmation every time new leads have been assigned to your account.
-Now it's your turn to go out and meet with the client(s), and show them how our program can benefit them and their families.

Why should you work with Lincoln Heritage?

As a family owned business, we pride ourselves in the service we provide to our agents and policyholders.  Our goal is to make our agents' work easier by doing continuous lead testing so that our leads are always fresh, creating new marketing pieces that will walk you through your presentation with your clients, and offering our knowledge and assistance at any time.  

Lincoln Heritage maintains an A-(Excellent) financial rating with A.M. Best and an A+ with the BBB.

•	Lincoln Heritage Life Insurance Company and Lincoln Heritage Funeral Advantage are registered trademarks of Londen Insurance Group, Inc. Funeral Advantage is a trademark of Londen Insurance Group, Inc.

Title: Janitor Position-Part Time 8:00am to 12:00pm
Description:
Janitor
Job Description

								                     Classification:  Non-Exempt 

This is an entry-level position involving a variety of light to heavy cleaning tasks performed independently in specific areas or as a member of a cleaning crew. Under general supervision, the employee performs tasks during the assigned shift to ensure cleanliness of assigned areas. The Janitor is expected to work unusual hours. The position reports to the Site Supervisor and or the Project Manager.

Responsibilities
•	Sweep, scrub and mop floors in rooms, halls, stairways and public areas
•	Empty and clean pencil sharpeners, waste receptacles and cigarette urns; cleans and fills   
         dispensers in restrooms; clean windows, walls, doors and floors
•	Empty and change trash liners in containers
•	Clean chalkboards and trays, furniture, desks, woodwork, fixtures, etc.
•	Set up rooms, moves and arrange furniture(s)
•	Clean and wash sinks, shower stalls, and other restrooms and shower rooms, plumbing fixtures
•	Works in both an indoor and outdoor environment, and is subject to frequent lifting, carrying, 
         pushing and pulling
•	Strip, vacuum, buff, wax floors and shampoo carpets
•	Lock and unlock doors to buildings; report malfunctions and unusual occurrences observed
•	Maintain, inspect equipment's and tools used and report any malfunction
•	Drives truck in delivering or picking up supplies or equipment if applicable
•	Orders custodial supplies
•	Must have the ability to work well with others and have a good/pleasant attitude.
•	Performs other essential duties as required 
•	Ability to effectively communicate and work with citizens who may have complaints on services   provided.
•	Attendance is an essential job function.  It is an essential function of the job that you report to work on time and work your scheduled hours.
•	Observes proper safety, and OSHA regulations 
•	Mix chemicals according to manufactures instructions
•	Monitor own quality of work to ensure contract specifications are met.
•	Participate in company provided training programs to maintain and improve job skills
•	Maintain confidentiality of all confidential information and documents that you may have access to.
Mental and Physical Requirements
As part of the essential function of this position, employees are required to:
•	Understand, follow and implement written, verbal or demonstrated instructions
•	Request supplies verbally
•	Perform heavy work; exert in excess of 50 pounds of force occasionally, exert up to 20 pounds of force frequently
•	Be able to climb, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, reach, stand, walk, push, pull, lift, finger, grasp, talk, hear, and perform repetitive motions on a regular basis
•	Keeps simple records of work performed and equipment utilized such as vehicle problems, daily reports, etc.
•	Makes minor adjustments to and assists in cleaning or servicing of equipment used.
•	Must be able to follow directions.

Requirements:
•	Completion of formal or informal education which assures ability to read, write and speak at the level sufficient for successful job performance and experience in building or related commercial cleaning work or equivalent combination of education and experience which indicates possession of knowledge and skills required.
•	Knowledge of modern, effective and efficient methods used in general janitorial work; cleaning materials, disinfectants, standard equipment and tools used in work; window cleaning techniques and methods; safety methods, floor cleaning and machine usage methods and procedures in janitorial operations.
•	Good interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive in a multi-cultural environment.
•	Ability to use cleaning materials, equipment and tools; performing tasks requiring relatively high degree to physical strength and endurance; applying methods and practices used in janitorial work and the care of tools, equipment and facilities; following oral and written instructions; establishing and maintaining cooperative, working independently with minimum supervision, and ability to safeguard keys and maintain security of facilities.
•	2 years minimum on a position focused on dealing specifically with customer service or customer-related activities 
•	Specialized Requirements: Minimum State driver's license with insurable record and Physical and drug screening if required.
•	Ability to obtain security background clearance
•	Must be able to pass a Federal Background check.

Title: Two-Way Radio Technician/Installer
Description:
Communications Service, located in Painesville, is Northeast Ohio's Authorized Motorola Sales and Service Facility, and has been providing two-way radio service since 1946.  For over 60 years we have prided ourselves in our leadership role, providing top quality products and services, which meet our customer's needs.

Communications Service is looking for an outstanding individual with a creative spirit, a pleasant positive attuite, strong work ethic, and flexibility to work at customer sites. We provide our employees with a comprehensive benefit package that includes employer paid health care coverage for the employee, IRA plan with employer match, paid vacation, paid holidays, paid sick time, and paid continuing education so you can grow as a professorial.
General overview of the position of Service Technician- Repair, install or maintain mobile or stationary radio transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment, and two-way radio communications systems used in public safety radio systems, commercial radio applications and radio equipment in service and emergency vehicles.

Essential Responsibilities-
1.	Installation, maintenance, and repair of two-way radios, base installations, repeaters, mobiles, portables, licensed and unlicensed microwave links, dispatch consoles, battery back-up systems, and mobile installations.
2.	Computer skills required with the ability to program, troubleshoot and/or perform diagnostics on communication systems.
3.	Trunked radio systems, P25, DMR (Moto TRBO), LTR, and IP Based communication systems and network components
4.	Sales engineering Support
5.	Program many types of radio systems to customer licensed requirements.
6.	On-call on a rotating basis
7.	Reports to Service Manager or President of Service
8.	Other duties as assigned

Training, Experience and Education- High School Diploma, two-year degree in electronics preferred and/or military RF/ electronics schooling and or experience in the two-way radio industry, FCC, ETA, R56, amateur radio license, and other industry standard certifications are a plus.

MUST HAVE ETA CETa within 90 days of employment

Other requirements- Valid Driver's license with a good record, Clean background check, Travel may be required for field service work

Probation Period- 90-day orientation period of as a "part time" employee then full time.

National Sales Representative

Description

The Sales Representative will prospect, identify and qualify accounts to sell IntelliCorp products and solutions. This will require excellent time management, organizational skills and a goal oriented focus. Successful candidates will be highly motivated, energetic, and relentless in pursuing the sale.

Description:
Snider-Blake is looking for 1st shift (9:30A-5P) tow motor drivers in Euclid starting at $11.50/hr!! Must have at least 1 year and be VERY comfortable using electric sit down forklifts and RF scanners.

Some heavy lifting is required. 1st shift start time ranges from 4AM-7AM working 8 hour shifts. 2nd shift is 4P-12:30AM. This positions is Monday through Friday with occasional overtime. This position is $12/hr.

Responsibilities will include moving different pallets of wine to different areas of the warehouse. This position requires a year of RF scanner experience. This position also requires a high attention to detail and the ability to lift up to 50lbs. They will train you on Tow Motor but must have a year of RF Scanner experience. The pay is 10.50/hr.

We are also looking for a experienced dock worker. Snider-Blake is looking for a dock worker for our client in the Euclid area on 1st shift (8A-4:30P Mon-Fri with sporadic Saturday OT) starting at $11/hr!! Apply today!! This position requires experience with a sit-down, propane tow motor. Associate must be extremely confident on the forklift with at least 2 years of previous experience. Must be able to pass a skills test on the first day. The job position involves loading and unloading trucks using the forklift, doing inventory control, working with manifestos and pick tickets from/for truck drivers to ensure that the items loaded/unloaded are correct. It is a temp-to-hire position with raises available after a 30-day review and additional raises available after hire. 
We are looking for an associate who has excellent attendance and punctuality and who is looking for a long-term position where they can grow with the company.

Title: Uber Driver Partner Needed (Flexible Hours & Weekly Pay)
Front Office Manager- Hyatt Regency Cleveland
Description:
At Hyatt, we believe our guests select Hyatt because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing efficient service and meaningful experiences.  This position reports to the hotel Operations Director.
 
The Front Office Manager is responsible for all duties of the front desk operation which includes: staff training, inter-department communications, and staff scheduling.  The Front Office Manager should possess strong communication skills and demonstrate leadership abilities.  In addition to assisting in the operation of the Front Office operation and guest services personnel, this position will respond quickly to guest requests and/or complaints in a friendly manner and ensure that appropriate action is taken to guarantee guest satisfaction. 
 
Duties include:
Responsible for short and long term planning and the management of the hotel's Front Office operations
Develop and recommend the budget, labor cost plans and objectives and manages within those approved plans
Maintain guest room inventory
Coach and counsel employees to reflect Hyatt Service Standards and Procedures
Perform all tasks of a Front Office Staff as needed to facilitate service
Ensure all operations and cash handling are done per policies and procedures
Maintain excellent communication with the housekeeping department
Maintain information on prices, rates, specials, packages, programs, etc, while ensuring all staff are trained in all areas
Analyze, investigate, and resolve guest complaints
Create expectations, lead people, manage processes, and hold people accountable for the agreed upon activities and time tables
Insures proper staffing levels for customer service goals
Coach and counsel employees to reflect Hyatt service standards and procedures
Hyatt associates work in an environment that demands exceptional performance yet reaps great rewards.  Whether it's career opportunities, job enrichment or a supportive work environment, if you are ready for this challenge, then we are ready for you.

Description:
Snider-Blake is looking for 1st shift (9:30A-5P) tow motor drivers in Euclid starting at $11.50/hr!! Must have at least 1 year and be VERY comfortable using electric sit down forklifts and RF scanners.

Some heavy lifting is required. 1st shift start time ranges from 4AM-7AM working 8 hour shifts. 2nd shift is 4P-12:30AM. This positions is Monday through Friday with occasional overtime. This position is $12/hr.

Responsibilities will include moving different pallets of wine to different areas of the warehouse. Must have experience on the high reach ruck and cherry picker. 1st shift is 7AM-5:30PM 4 days a week and 2nd shift is 5:30PM-2AM. Average hours will be between 32-40 hours must be able to work Saturdays and Sundays. Pay is $11/hr

This position requires a year of RF scanner experience. This position also requires a high attention to detail and the ability to lift up to 50lbs. They will train you on Tow Motor but must have a year of RF Scanner experience. The pay is 10.50/hr.

Title: Operations Manager | Punch Bowl Social Cleveland
Description:
OPERATIONS MANAGER
Punch Bowl Social is looking for a qualified individual to join their team in the capacity of Operations Manager.  This person will be hardworking, dedicated, and experienced in high volume restaurant/bar operations.


About Us:
Punch Bowl Social brings a southern-inspired scratch kitchen, led by culinary partner and celebrity chef, Hugh Acheson, a craft beverage program and a generous selection of old school games that provide a not-found-elsewhere day or night out experience. We are committed to our love of the trade, supreme hospitality, and believe in equality for each guest, team member and human being alike. We don't take ourselves too seriously, but we do take food and beverage very serious. Here's to going out right! #WinningAtAdulting

•	3+ years experience in high volume restaurant/bar management
•	Passion for integrity of food, beverage and service
•	Ability to perform all financial duties for daily operation
•	Computer skills - proficient in Aloha, Excel, Word, OpenTable, and the ability to learn in house software accounting system

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Title: Delivery Partners (Cars) NEEDED in Cleveland - Fun & Flexible!
Restaurant Event Sales Manager | Punch Bowl Social Cleveland
Description:
EVENT SALES MANAGER
Punch Bowl Social is looking for a qualified individual to join their team in the capacity of Event Sales Manager.  This person will be hardworking, dedicated, and experienced in high volume restaurant and event scenarios.


About Us:
Punch Bowl Social brings a southern-inspired scratch kitchen, led by culinary partner and celebrity chef, Hugh Acheson, a craft beverage program and a generous selection of old school games that provide a not-found-elsewhere day or night out experience. We are committed to our love of the trade, supreme hospitality, and believe in equality for each guest, team member and human being alike. We don't take ourselves too seriously, but we do take food and beverage very serious. Here's to going out right! #WinningAtAdulting


QUALIFICATIONS
•	3+ years experience in restaurant event specific sales
•	Extensive knowledge of the market
•	Experience in event operations
•	Ability to completed listed job responsibilities
•	Positive attitude, ability to work well in a team environment
•	Ability to accommodate a schedule based on volume


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Develop, plan and sell private parties at Punch Bowl Social
•	Responsible for generating private party sales first proactively, second organically
•	Establish sales objectives by creating sales plan and quotas
•	Achieves sales financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, initiating corrective actions
•	Continually grows relationships with current and new clients
•	Actively seeks out convention/tourism business
•	Works with GM on PR, sales & marketing initiatives
•	Responsible for effective contract management
•	Assumes responsibility for execution of events, communicates all request of the client in an effective and sensitive manner
•	Ensures all required elements are scheduled, ordered, and communicated with team









If you are interested in becoming part of a nationally expanding concept, with significant growth opportunities, please apply at the link above and we look forward to reviewing your resume.

Title: Consultive Sales-Management Consulting
Description:
Global Resources LLC is the largest full-service business development firm serving small to mid-sized businesses in the US. Through the coordinated efforts of corporate headquarters and field service personnel; Global Resources installs proven methods, systems, controls and incentives to enable business owners and their managers to maintain positive cash flow, control costs, and accelerate the growth of their companies.

As a Global Resources' Business Analyst, you will analyze small to medium-sized businesses; determine the financial impact of ownership decision-making, corporate structure, business planning and industry benchmarking. At the conclusion of the analysis, the Business Analyst and the client will decide if it makes sense to move into the implementation phase, utilizing the resources of our Consulting Services Division. Analysts are given the tools and trained in the skills necessary to accomplish this task. However, successful analysts have attributes that cannot be taught. They are strong, dynamic, confident teachers, communicators and leaders with exceptional understanding and empathy.

This position requires 10 years of executive, sales or business ownership experience, analytical skills and the ability to communicate effectively with business owners, senior management and boards of directors. Ideal candidates for this position are individuals who have previously owned their own businesses and/or have held upper management positions for a minimum of five years. A four-year degree is strongly preferred but we will consider candidates with strong business experience. 75%-90% travel, leaving on Sunday returning on Friday-home weekends. We are looking for candidates who are available within the next 30 days.

Global Resources offers a comprehensive training program; full benefits pkg. with 401k; this is not a salaried position-this is a fully commissioned employee position with the average first year in the low six figures and higher thereafter.

Please forward resume to Kerri Parks via our website: 


Equal Opportunity Employer

Description:
National DCP (NDCP) is a $2 billion supply chain management cooperative serving the franchisees of Dunkin' Donuts. Our unique 'Farm to Fork' concept allows us to source, purchase and deliver products to more than 8,000 restaurants across the U.S. at the best cost to our members. Our 1,700 employees are empowered to make an impact every day.
We're hiring warehouse selectors in our Twinsburg, OH location to support one of the country's fastest growing quick service restaurant chains. A warehouse selector pulls products (like baking mix, soft drinks, glazes, cups, napkins, etc) from warehouse shelves and assembles and prepares pallets to be loaded onto trucks for delivery to our members.

We're looking for people who:

•	Are dependable and want to grow within a company
•	Have experience working in a warehouse 
•	Are familiar with warehouse equipment like pallet jacks and forklifts
•	Have used voice-directed technology for product selection
•	Want to be part of a winning team

Requirements:

•	High school education or equivalent
•	At least one year of prior warehouse experience
•	Ability to work second shift/flexible hours
•	Ability to be on your feet for up to five consecutive hours
•	Physically willing and able to lift, pull and tug products weighing up to 55 lbs
•	Ability to operate a pallet jack and forklift
•	Self-motivated with a great attitude
•	Dependable attendance
•	Available for full-time employment within the U.S.
•	Successfully pass a pre-employment background check and drug screen

NDCP offers:

•	Great pay
•	Competitive company benefits (health, vision, dental, prescription drug, life, short- and long-term disability) 30 days after hire
•	Paid vacation, holidays  and personal time
•	A 401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching
•	Employee discount programs
•	Opportunities to grow your career

Hourly Rate = $17.15

Lawn and Garden Sales Associate
Description:
Landmark Lawn & Garden Supply - Strongsville, OH
About Us: Started as a Co-Op in 1934, in 1992 became a family owned company. In 2007 Landmark Lawn and Garden Supply was split from the Petroleum Division and became their own corporation. We have retail Lawn and Garden stores in Strongsville, Westlake and new in 2015 Avon, Ohio. We have provided area residents with quality products and service for over 83 years and truly are your "One Stop Shop" for all your lawn, garden and pet supply needs.
We offer a full line of bulk landscaping materials such as mulch, soil, leaf humus, stone, gravel and sand. All bulk landscape materials are available for pickup or delivery seven days a week and can be delivered in loads from 2-70 yards. We also carry a full line of bagged mulch, topsoil, soil conditioners, fertilizers, weed controls, bird seed, animal feed and feeders. During the winter months we sell firewood and Ice Control products. Our locations have formed a successful pet food and supply business based on the same values of quality used in the growth of our company for over the past 83 years.

Title: Payroll Officer
Description:
Posted October 12, 2017: Full-time Payroll Officer, Downtown Cleveland, flexible working hours, Monday - Friday 8:00 am- 4:30 pm or 7:00 am -3:30 pm, hourly pay $14.00 - $15.25, weekly pay is $560.00 -$610.00.

Job purpose: Assist with payroll and maintain payroll functions using Kronos and SAP System

Duties:
	Establish master payroll files for department's payroll and human resources 
	Enter payroll information and  wage changes... name and address changes, credit union information, and benefits program, 
        Union deductions, child support and garnishments
	Compile payroll figures from payroll forms, maintain time sheets, leave of absence forms, vacation leave and overtime forms
	Determine the accuracy of payroll reports,  prepare payroll figures for data processing using time reports, transaction sheets 
        and deductions and other earnings transaction sheets
	Validate payroll register, distributes pay warrants to department employees on a bi-weekly basis prepares personnel actions for 
        various employment activities including hiring, discipline, status changes, leaves of absence

Previous Experience:
	 Minimum of two years business administration and human resource experience; or any equivalent combination of education 
         and experience
	 Documentation of personnel records, withholding forms, payroll records, PERS forms, benefit forms, collective bargaining 
        agreements, personnel action forms, job descriptions, master time sheets, employee leave forms, and  personnel files, 
	Ability to communicate with supervisors, employees, general public, and Human Resource Director

Prerequisites:
	Must be able to pass a 10 panel drug screening, 
	No violent felonies or violent  misdemeanors, 
	Must have the experience, and education  to perform the job duties for the payroll officer             

        Email your current resume to hrquickemp.com or fax to ( 216) 361-3970 for employment opportunities

Title: Purchasing Agent
Description:
PURCHASING AGENT
                    Property of:  LRC & ASSOCIATES   Larry Cassidy   LRCAssoc@centurytel.net   (440)  309-6234
Position Summary:
Coordinates the negotiating of vendor terms, prices, and purchasing of raw materials and production supplies to ensure compliance to company standards using knowledge of financial management, decision making, discretion, budget and schedule requirements while adhering to company purchasing policies, processes and procedures.

Essential Functions/Primary Responsibilities:
•	Orders raw materials using knowledge of material planning and methods to coordinate product deliveries to cover scheduled production and schedule changes to meet customer emergencies.
•	Monitors and carries out inventory control of raw materials to assist auditors in providing requested information.
•	Issues purchase orders for the purpose of completing all purchasing processes in accordance with established procedures.
•	Maintains purchasing information, files and records for the purpose of ensuring the availability of documentation and compliance with established company policies and regulatory guidelines.
•	Participates in company meetings, in-service training, workshops, etc. for the purpose of conveying and/or gathering information required to perform the job functions.
•	Responds to inquiries from a variety of internal and external sources for the purpose of providing information, direction and/or appropriate referrals.
•	Is the key contact for suppliers and will inform vendors of our company vendor requirements and request periodic quotations evaluate current market conditions and ensure the best pricing for the company.
•	Ensures all raw materials and packaging are ordered within specifications and according to company quality programs and shall notify Technical Services of changes in ownership of ingredients.
•	Ensures suppliers who provide non-conforming materials are notified and provide corrective actions and credit on a prompt basis.
•	Utilizes contract suppliers where contracts apply and ensures prices and specifications conform to contract terms.
•	Ensures compliance to all federal, state and local laws and company policies.
•	Coordinates disposal of inactive inventory by the most economical and safe method.
•	Performs special projects as needed within the procurement department.
•	Compiles and submits information for all required plant/corporate daily reports, such as, Purchase Order (P.O.) edit reports, expected P.O. receipt reports, as well as, monthly, quarterly and annual reports as required.

Working Conditions/Environment:
Works primarily in an office environment, with 25% or less time in a manufacturing environment, where the employee is regularly required to speak, read, sit, stand, walk, climb, crouch, lift, reach, grasp and bend while moving about the facility.   Requires some lifting of moderately heavy items, such as file boxes.  May be required to work overtime and/or weekends, as needed.  While performing duties of this job, the employee may periodically be exposed to non-ambient temperatures, odors, dust, oil, slippery floors, moving parts/equipment.  The noise level in the office is moderate and loud in the plant.  Ear protection, hair/beard nets are required as necessary in accordance with company GMP and safety standards.
Qualification Requirements:
•	3+ years of purchasing or related experience, preferably in a food-related industry, or demonstrated knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the above-mentioned tasks.
•	BS/BA degree in business management or related field preferred.

Supervisory Responsibility:
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Title: Egg Donors with Jewish Heritage Urgently Needed!
Description:
A Jewish Blessing, LLC was founded as a compassionate response to infertile Jewish families who desperately need help finding qualified and extraordinary young Jewish women who have the desire to give them the gift of life through Egg Donation. 

We are currently working with many wonderful families all over the United States who are struggling with infertility, with more families reaching out to us each day. If you are a Jewish woman, responsible, with a generous spirit, and would like to consider donating your eggs in order to help one of our families achieve their dream of becoming parents, then please email our Donor Intake Coordinator at Sivonne@ajewishblessing.com

Initial Egg Donor Qualifications are:
•	Be a female between the age of 20 and 32
•	Within normal weight range for your height (BMI)
•	Be in good health and follow a healthy lifestyle
•	Be a non-smoker 
•	Have Jewish ethnic heritage on Mothers and/or Fathers side of their family
	
All expenses are covered by the recipient parents and donor candidates will be compensated for inconvenience, time and effort at $9,000 once egg donation process is completed. Travel may be involved, if willing, and all travel related expenses will be covered. If you are a repeat successful donor then you may be able to request a higher compensation from the intended family.


TO APPLY TODAY VISIT: 


A Jewish Blessing, LLC is a Reproductive Endocrinology Nurse owned agency and is a member of  SART/ASRM (Society for Assisted Reproductive Technology/American Society for Reproductive Medicine) and follow their ethical guidelines for egg donation. To learn more please visit our website at: 




key words:  egg donor, egg donation, donor, ivf, fertility, infertility, third party reproduction, flexible

- Best-In-Class Benefits

PAM offers its experienced drivers a positive atmosphere with plenty of OTR and Dedicated lanes, as well as team driving runs and enhanced HazMat pay. This makes it a great place for drivers to grow professionally while advancing their career.

Description: Part-time bookkeeper to maintain records of financial transactions for a small business by establishing accounts; posting transactions; managing invoices. 

 Bookkeeper Job Duties:
•  Accounts for financial transactions by establishing a chart of accounts; defining bookkeeping policies and procedures.
• Manages invoicing.
• Collects on accounts receivable and manages the accounts payable function.
• Maintains subsidiary accounts by verifying, allocating, and posting transactions.
• Balances subsidiary accounts by reconciling entries.
• Maintains general ledger by transferring subsidiary account summaries.
• Balances general ledger by preparing a trial balance; reconciling entries.
• Maintains historical records by filing documents.
• Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends.
• Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements by studying requirements; enforcing adherence to requirements; filing reports; advising management on needed actions.
• Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

 Skills/Qualifications:Analyzing Information , Data Entry Skills, Accounting, Attention to Detail, Confidentiality, Thoroughness, High-level Communications Skills, Time Management, Project Management Skills, MUST BE HIGHLY SKILLED IN QUICKBOOKS. 

 Please send your resume, cover letter and contact information for consideration.

 Thank you!
Compensation: To be determined, based on experience

Title: GM- General Manager
Description:
General Manager
A nationally-recognized, fast-paced, brunch/lunch hot-spot, known for our "from scratch" approach to sustainability and the farm-to-table concept, is looking for a General Manager. The candidate we are looking for has a strong, positive and productive communication mindset. This candidate will be a self-motivated, "hands on" type who leads by example, keeps up high energy, communicates properly with staff while maintaining excellent customer service. Our managers are responsible for upholding the highest possible level of cleanliness and professionalism throughout the restaurant. We are looking for an individual who can inspire staff to work as a team, and displays this personal quality by promoting a professional, supportive relationship with co-managers. Punctuality is a must. This job also includes monitoring food and labor cost as well as being familiar with inventory/purchasing and product rotation. Candidates must have at least two years of experience working in a fast-paced front of the house environment with no more than three jobs in the past seven years.  
Essential competencies/responsibilities:
•	Solid front of the house experience, barista experience a plus
•	Precise and intense level of organization
•	Positive communication skills
•	Self-motivated, high energy, and leads by example
•	Maintains high levels of cleanliness, professionalism, and customer service
•	Inspires staff to work as a team
•	Maintains a professional, supportive relationship with co-managers
•	Solves problems as they arise
•	Punctuality and reliability
•	Micros, Excel, and Ordering experience 

If you would like to join our team as we ready ourselves for the next phase of success, send us your resume along with two relevant industry references. Phone interviews to begin this week.

Please include "GM" in the subject line of your response e-mail.

Title: Make up to $1,500/week Driving Your Car with Lyft
Parts Representative
Description:
Summary

The Parts Representative is responsible for assisting customers by properly identifying needed items, using parts catalogs and computer system, billing merchandise orders, and making necessary entries to the inventory control system, while distributing special order parts, receiving warranty parts, maintaining shelf stock and performing all other duties as assigned by the Parts and Branch Manager.

Essential Functions

Sales
•	Pull internal (sales and service) and external customer parts upon request.
•	Advise customers on substitution or modification parts as needed.
•	Track lost sales.
•	Examine returned parts to determine if defective and exchange part or provide refund. 
•	Maintain cleanliness in work area daily (i.e. all parts, tools, and equipment put away, trash removed, etc.).

Inventory Control
•	Check in and put away daily incoming freight and stock orders.
•	Place Service orders for non-stock parts.
•	Ensure technicians receive correct parts according to demand.
•	Maintain part return records.
•	Process monthly returns of low usage parts to dealer.
•	Mark and store parts in stockroom according to the prearranged system.
•	Promptly restock all unsold merchandise and properly tag defective items to place in warranty bins.
•	Return all unsold merchandise immediately to the correct stock location.
•	Ship all internal and external customer orders.
•	Load and unload all LTL (less than truck load) deliveries (excluding tractors) for Parts, Sales and Service departments.
•	Notifies Parts Manager of discrepancies between inventory records and shelf quantities.
•	Controls expenses to increase profitability.

Marketing
•	Promote dealerships specials and suggest parts and service sales.
•	Perform phone sales in accordance with the company's guidelines, direction or action plans.




Training
•	Achieve working knowledge of Parts Inventory Control system.
•	Stay current on new procedures for shipping, returning and ordering parts.
•	Stay current on new product bulletins and catalogs.
•	Attend store meetings and training classes.
•	Adhere to all company policies and procedures

Other Functions

•	Fill all batteries with necessary fluids for Parts, Service and Sales departments.
•	Pick up and deliver parts for customers and vendors as needed.
•	Assist with annual physical inventory.
•	Assist with other duties assigned and directed by corporate management within the frame work of Murphy Tractor and Equipment Company, Inc.'s objectives.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

•	Strong focus on customer service.
•	Ability to show promote and sell products.
•	Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair and maintenance.
•	Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office and Internet.
•	Basic knowledge of office machines, including copier, fax and printer.
•	Able to communicate effectively as appropriate for the needs of the customer or coworkers.
•	Strong attention to detail
•	Able to work effectively in a team environment.
•	Able to process work with accuracy.
•	Meet commitments and deadlines.
•	Able to complete required documentation and reports in a timely manner.
•	Able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
•	Able to work a flexible schedule as needed.
•	Able to organize and prioritize numerous tasks and complete them under time constraints.
•	Demonstrates openness to new procedures, technology and structure.

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions

Able to work overtime, including evenings and/or weekends.  Able to stand for an extensive amount of time.  Able to repeatedly lift up to 50 lbs.

Education/Work Experience

One year certificate from a college or technical school or at least three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Experience includes: Shipping/Receiving, Parts Distribution and ability to drive a Fork Lift.

Apply for Parts Representative using the link below:

Title: Warehouse Manager (Inbound Logistics)
Description:
Warehouse Manager (Inbound Logistics) Operation
The Warehouse Manager is responsible for overseeing the staff and inbound pallet traffic and preparation.
This person is responsible for meeting or exceeding company goals while controlling costs, Team building, and producing a high quality result each day. 
Essential duties and responsibilities
•	Overseas and engages in  
o	Preparation of work orders for processing operation
o	Verifying piece counts supplied by customer to ensure shipments are complete
o	Performing multi-point quality checks before product is released to production
o	Sorting and placing materials in racks according to organizational standards
o	Daily reports on inbound status, inbound trucking shipments and any other topics needed at that time
o	Meeting with the Operations Manager daily to discuss status of current and future work loads
o	Scheduling employees based on daily workload and maintains proper staffing levels
o	Controlling overtime spending based on current workflow and scheduling
o	Assisting in the receiving of material, unloading trucks and checking in product
Qualification requirements
•	College degree 
•	Relevant work experience, Degree in Quality Assurance or Logistics a plus
•	Documented 5 years minimum warehouse management experience required
•	Quality control certifications required
•	Good communication, organizational, time management and mathematical skills a must
•	Must be proficient in Excel, Google Docs, Word, etc., Inventory control and management
•	Must be Tow Motor certified 
•	Safety certifications a must
Must have flexible schedule to work additional hours as needed to meet production needs.
Benefits
Benefits include medical, dental, 401K and paid vacation/time off.

Title: Job Coach - Geauga County Educational Service Center
Description:
Renhill Group is currently looking for caring, compassionate individuals to work on a permanent, full-time basis as a Job Coach through the Geauga County Educational Service Center for the 2017-2018 school year.

A Job Coach will work with special education students in a 5:1 ratio while on the job. They will identify natural supports in the workplace that the student can use for job support, transportation, and social connections; and communicate with the student about specific work/social skills needed for the particular employment position.

**Job Coaches will drive their own vehicles (mileage is reimbursed at $0.535 per mile) to the job sites. 

Requirements:
---Must be able to obtain HQP (Highly Qualified Paraprofessional) Status through one of the following:
------Associate's degree (in any field)
------48 semester hours or 72 quarter hours of higher education
------Taken and passed the official Paraprofessional Assessment

---Must purchase an official polo shirt ($16.50)

---BCI & FBI background checks
------Completed within the past 12 months and on file with the Ohio Department of Education
------Renhill Group offers background checks at one of the area's lowest rates ($50), if you do not already have them

---Negative TB test
------Results dated within the past 3 months

---Aide permit issued by the Ohio Department of Education
------Renhill Group will assist you in obtaining your permit if needed. 
------Permit costs $25 and payment is made directly to the Ohio Department of Education

 

If you have the desire to make a positive impact on our youth or would like help in deciding if this is the right position for you, we would love to speak with you!

 

Renhill Group is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Screen Printing Press Operator-MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE
Description:
Screen Printing Press Operator

Job Description

Title: 1st or 2nd shift press operator
Department(s): Print
Reports to: Print Manager 
Job summary

Set up, adjust, operate, and maintain a inline press or single or multi-color offset press to print single-color, two-color, and/or multi-color work which includes large solids, screen tints, line and halftones with critical color values and registration requirements ranging from hairline to critical or operate similarly situated equipment that applies a variety of non-ink based coatings to a paper web or sheet stock. Review job specifications to determine the press setup according to the imposition of the run (sheet wise or work and turn). Clean, lubricate, and maintain the press, making minor repairs and replacing worn or broken parts as required. Performs periodic maintenance recommended by the manufacturer.

Summary of essential job functions

Requires thorough knowledge of offset printing procedures, materials and specifications, equipment, and safety requirements and skills to perform assignments. Skill to read and understand job specifications and knowledge of press capabilities to determine the most appropriate press usage, press settings and materials needed to run the job successfully. Skill to make a variety of difficult precise settings of controls, settings, and adjustments, and to perform routine operational maintenance of equipment. Skill in routine operational maintenance and minor repairs to equipment. Previous printing experience is highly preferred. 

Minimum requirements

GED or High School Diploma is required. 

Abilities required

Fast-paced environment; Attention to detail. Must be able to lift 50+ lbs, as well be able to stand and operate machinery for 8-10 hours a day. Reading text; Document use; Math skills; Writing; Communication; Working with others; Problem solving; Decision making; Critical thinking; Job task planning and organizing; Significant use of memory; Finding information; Continuous learning

We are a thriving large format screen print company on the west side of Cleveland. Please respond with resume and salary requirements. Thank you.

Do you love Jeopardy? Is Bob Barker your idol? Have you dreamed of becoming a game show host? Then this is the gig for you!

Last Call Trivia is a fun and professional live Trivia company that put on hundreds of Trivia shows across the country in local bars in restaurants. We are currently looking to fill openings for Trivia Hosts in greater Cleveland with immediate opportunities in the Wickliffe area.

Title: Real Estate Assistant Wanted!!
Description:
Real Estate Assistant Wanted!!

Local real estate investor looking for an assistant to help with growing real estate company. Great atmosphere relaxed environment great way to learn the real estate business on the way.

Duties
* Taking calls
* Data entry
* Running comps 
* Taking pictures 
* Managing Appointment
* Marketing

Personal Marketing
Schedule and organize personal marketing advertising on a monthly basis to ensure constant personal marketing.
 
Enter new contact names, address, and emails from information request, open house calls guest books and other sources in our database. Make address corrections as they are received.
 
Track and execute a mailing schedule create merged letters and other correspondence.
   
Follow up on marketing materials with phone calls to make sure that customers received the letters and see if they are a current prospect for us to contact.
 
Carry out task or arrange for other to do such tasks as stuffing envelopes and getting new postage stamps.
 
General office duties
Always consider prioritizing income generating task first before beginning routine paper work to insure income for both agent and assistant.
  
Communicate with clients at least once a week to check on their needs and assure clients understand we care about their concerns and needs.
 
Keep Agent updated with all communication with clients to maintain continuity of communication between client, assistant and agent.
  
Be on time and ready to work every day to maintain a good solid working relationship with agent and client.
 
*****Plan a daily to do list and discuss/present to agent to assure each activity is a priority to both the agent and the assistant.***** This needs to be reviewed the beginning of each day.
 
 
Manage Incoming Calls
Answer the phone with a friendly and upbeat attitude and show a caring attitude to everyone who comes in contact with our company.
  
Prospecting
Develop prospects list - Locate addresses and phone numbers for targeted seller categories to use for direct mail.  Scan the MLS for expired listings, research tax records for out of state owners, check local newspapers for unrepresented sellers and search all possible media to find prospects for buying of selling.
 
Create a warm call list from responses to mailings or other promotions. Return calls to all prospects even if they do not need agent's services right away but still send them information about agent.
 
**Record which marketing category or contact method netted a particular sale. This will allow agent to evaluate how much time and money was spent prospecting to each category vs. how much commission income was generated from transaction in that category within specific period.
 
 Listing Support
Maintain photos on social medias and websites. Ensure all photos are inputted and represent the property well. If photos do not represent the property well, notify agent right away.
 
Obtain feedback from all showings and forward to seller and agent. Keep a feedback log up to date. This will ensure good communication with client and help both client and agent suggest changes that may help client sell home faster.
 
Keep all price changes up to date all websites to help maintain correct information for anyone who may see it.
 
Schedule weekly, monthly and quarterly ads in all advertising media for active listings to ensure clients receive all the advertising they were promised.
 
Assemble pre-listing and listing packets using our standard format. Listing packets and pre-listing packets to be ready at moments notice so that agent can list a home as quickly as client may need.
 
The listing packet should include the following:

Distribute the pre-listing packet a few days before the listing presentation. Deliver the packet via express mail or in person then follow up with a phone call to make sure that the seller received it.
 
The pre-listing packet should include the following:

Conduct Primary CMA research following a preprinted form provided.  This will include searching the MLS for relevant pricing data on recent sales and listings. Data will be given to the agent to interpret and then put in a nice presentation packet to be given to seller at listing appointment. At all times agent and assistant will strive for a professional presentation using quality data, quality media and quality interpretation of data.
 
Review all ads after publication to check for errors or needed changes in the future to ensure we produce only quality media for both the client and the agent. The agent and assistant will strive to immediately correct errors if they occur, understand why the error occurred and take action so it does not occur again.
 
Make copies of all ads and send to sellers on a weekly basis so that clients know what is being done for them.
  
Maintain signs and lock-boxes for all listings, including pending and solds, and final pick up.
   
Closing Coordination
Coordinate all closings using the checklist attached to ensure continuity and good communication between agent, client and assistant.
 
Keep a contact record on forms provided on all buyers and sellers getting ready for closings.
 
Keep strict tabs on deadlines in contract including:
•Appraisal ordered
•Inspections deadlines
•Closing dates
•Occupancy dates
 
Double check that client submits all relevant paper work to loan officer, such as tax return employment verification and bankruptcy dispensations.  Also to make sure both buyer and seller apply for loans and are approved for loans meeting the deadlines of their contracts.
 
Website Maintenance
Understand that 80% of home buyers started their search on the web last year. Therefore, the web is a very important tool in our real estate company. The web and agent website(s) must be monitored and maintained so that it is never outdated and always striving to be slightly ahead of what every prospect may need while searching for a property or agent.
 
Maintain all websites keeping property information and agent information current, ensuring that all prospects have the most up to date information available.
 
Capture all leads and disburse in a timely manner so all leads are contacted immediately.
 
Other website duties include.

•Respond to basic emails request for information in a timely manner. Create standardized email documents describing agent's services. 
 
Manage Incoming Calls

Be able to prioritize incoming calls and know how to handle different types of calls.
 
•Priority requests. These calls demand agent's immediate attention. This category might include repeat clients and buyers interested in high-priced properties. The assistant will forward these requests directly to agent and answer them as soon as possible, preferably within the hour.
•Personal response. This type of call also requires a direct response, but is not as time critical. This might include potential customers who want to make an appointment or who have in-depth questions about the home selling process. Everyone who requests a personal response should receive one. The agent should, however, respond to these messages as quickly as time permits, by the close of business the same day, if possible. If for some reason the agent can not call back, the assistant can call back and cover for agent until the agent can make the call.
•Informational response. The assistant can handle this type of call, which typically includes basic questions about agent's services 
                                                 
Administrative Duties
Coordinate mail flow by scheduling and tracking direct mailings to prospects and past clients.
Update mailing lists by adding new prospects and making address changes as needed.
Proofread materials, such as advertising copy, personal letters to top clients and direct mail promotions, for content and clarity.
Coordinate appointment schedules for open houses, listing presentations, showings, closing meetings and other appointments. An assistant can call to remind clients and prospects of scheduled meetings and keep the agent informed of changes.
Maintain a document log for each transaction as a way of ensuring that necessary materials are being received and filed properly.
Run errands, such as putting up and taking down "For Sale" signs, picking up and dropping off contracts, and adding and removing lock-boxes.
Fulfill miscellaneous administrative tasks, screening phone calls and making copies.
Follow up with buyers and sellers after the transaction to solicit feedback on the transaction experience.

We will pay $10 an hr for 20 hours a week 

This will be a part time job.

Must be reliable and have reliable transpiration.

Must have Smartphone & laptop

Reply with resume and contact info
