Title: Sales Agents (Licensed and Unlicensed)
Description:
Due to our continued growth, The General is now looking for motivated, driven, and competitive Call Center - Sales Agents to join our team in Cleveland, OH.

Our Sales Agents are primarily responsible for quoting and selling insurance policies for incoming telephone sales inquiries while providing excellent customer service to new and existing customers. 

Our Sales Agents are paid a base rate as well as a commission, so the more you sell, the more successful you will be! Additional responsibilities, including but not limited to: 
•	No cold calling!  The calls come to you!
•	Explaining coverage and payment options to the customer
•	Verifying accuracy of information provided by running reports regarding insurance and driving history
•	Base Hourly Rate + Commission (Higher hourly rate during training period)
•	No cap on commission earnings!
•	Completing sale and collecting premium payments
•	Attending sales meetings, seminars or educational activities to stay current with market trends, regulations and to maintain state licensing
•	When appropriate, directing customers to a local closing center to finalize application and make a payment on the policy
•	Phone sales with no face-to-face customer interaction required
Requirements/Qualifications for our Sales Agents:
•	Sales/Customer Service experience and/or Call Center background
•	Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance license - highly desirable, but NOT REQUIRED (We will help you get your licensing!)
•	Phone Sales experience is a plus
•	High School diploma
•	Great communication skills
•	Team player attitude
•	Proficient in computer navigation and typing
•	Bilingual a plus
•	Comfortable working within an Insurance Call Center environment
•	MUST be able to pass a background check
•	Flexible to work within the shift times

Application Link: 

We Offer our Sales Agents:
•	Base salary plus UNCAPPED commission opportunity (average income range between $50-55k a year)
•	Generous Benefits package - Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
•	Tuition reimbursement
•	Paid time off (vacation, sick, holidays)
•	Wellness initiatives
•	401(k) participation with a matching contribution
•	Casual dress environment
•	INCREDIBLE branding
•	Annual incentive plan
•	NO cold calling
•	Incentives/Contest - ex. Monetary prizes
•	40 hour work week
•	And MORE!!!

About Us:
The General Automobile Insurance Services, Inc.  (The General®) is a licensed insurance agency that is a subsidiary of PGC Holdings Corp. (PGC) which is wholly owned by American Family Mutual Insurance Company.  Through its insurance company subsidiaries and their predecessors, PGC has been writing automobile insurance in many states throughout the country for over 50 years. Title: Choose Your Own Schedule With Lyft: Up to $1,500/week
*** Commercial Sales and Marketing Rep ***
Description:
Commercial Sales and Marketing

In this role, you will call on and build relationships with a broad variety of customers and become their preferred provider if and when disaster strikes.  Whether it is a fire, a burst pipe, mold damage or natural catastrophe, assuring our company is their first call is what this job is all about.  You will be marketing to facilities managers, building engineers, property management and ownership groups who control large amounts of commercial square footage.  Some of our larger verticals include:  hospitality; retail space; high-rise buildings; government; education; medical facilities and multi-family real estate.   This is a high energy, fast-paced position - no two days are ever the same!

WHAT WE OFFER:  We offer the opportunity to work with some of the most knowledgeable people in the industry.  Our large loss team is second to none allowing you to never have to decline a job because it is "too big to handle."  Our national accounts and relationships with all the major insurance carriers removes many of the obstacles faced in securing business and provides leads that help get in the door faster.  From a compensation stand point, we off a base + one of the most lucrative commission programs in the business.  There is no cap on earnings so your hard work gets rewarded!  We also offer 100% paid medical for our team members, P.T.O. and a 401(K).  We provides all the tools you need to succeed as well, including: a car allowance, fuel card, expense account, lap-top smart phone and other benefits.

WHAT SKILLS SHOULD YOU HAVE:  The successful candidate will possess the following skills:

- Experience calling on and selling to commercial customers, offering a service rather than a product
- Understanding of time management and the ability to stay organized while multi-tasking
- The ability to make presentations one-on-one and to groups.  Must be comfortable presenting to property managers, maintenance managers, facilities engineers as well as owners and C-suite level stakeholders
- Must be outgoing and have experience making contacts at networking events, conventions and other local industry related events
- Must be self-motivated, hard-working and not afraid to answer the call whenever disaster strikes - We are a 24/7 365 company!

For immediate consideration, please forward your resume TODAY.
Compensation: Base + Commission + Car Allowance + Full Benefits and More!!!

Title: 6 WEEKS OF FREE TRUCK PAYMENTS + A $500 SIGN ON BONUS!
Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! Title: SHOP HELPERS ( 1st and 2nd shift)
Description:
OLYMPIC STEEL

Olympic Steel, a leading national steel service center, is seeking a talented addition to our staff.  We offer a competitive benefits package including medical / dental, 401(k) and profit sharing.

The Shop Helper position safely performs position specific responsibilities in line with Olympic Steel's Core Values to ensure the highest level of productivity and quality while adhering to all relevant company policies and procedures.  Is a safety leader at all times by personally observing all safety requirements and ensuring compliance from co-workers and visitors. Supports and contributes to continuous improvement initiatives and strives to improve safety, quality, and efficiency in all areas of responsibility. Responsible for all job tasks required to support production processes.  These activities may include cutting machine support, movement of work-in-progress material on the production floor, in-house secondary operations, finished goods staging, truck loading, raw material receiving and raw material and finished goods preparation and management.  
 
***Please attach resume OR go to our website: www.olysteel.com and fill out an online application***

•	Precisely follow detailed and extensive instructions.
•	Mechanically inclined, production oriented, and safety and quality conscious.

•	Self-motivated with ability to work under general supervision.

•	Fine motor and gross motor coordination.
•	Functional literacy.
•	Working knowledge of general computer programs.
•	Previous experience with precision instruments.

Title: Paint Sprayer
Description:
Summary
Sprays surfaces of foam sheet products with spray adhesive from a pressure pot utilizing a non-toxic, water based product that is used to bond various foam materials together.

To Apply:  copy and paste the following link into your web browser:     apply.matplusinc.com
or apply in person:  Matplus, 76 Burton ST, Painesville, OH 44077

Shifts
1st-6:00am - 2:30pm M-F (5 days)
2nd-11:30am-10:00pm M-T (4 days)

Matplus offers paid medical, vacation, and 401K matching program after the probationary period.

Duties and Responsibilities
Stage foam sheets for spray application
Pull stock for order fulfillment as needed
Pay close attention to order details and fabrication instructions
Transfers liquid into spray container and connects system to required hoses
Turns adjustment valves and nozzle to regulate width and pressure of spray
Pulls trigger and directs spray onto work surface to apply adhesive
Cleans spraying equipment with solvent and maintain an organized and clean work area
Operates belt heater/pinch roller to compress foam together
Trims excess materials off completed sheets as needed
Ensures conformance of spray pattern on materials to ensure adhesion
Notifies others of possible defects to ensure 100% defect free product to customers

Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Title: Recruiting Associate
Description:
Formed in 1995, the Millennia Companies consists of Millennia Housing Management, Ltd. (MHM), American Preservation Builders, LLC (APB), Millennia Housing Development, Ltd. (MHD), Millennia Housing Capital, Ltd. (MHC), and Millennia Hospitality Group (MHG), a dynamic, vertically integrated real estate company.
 
Over the years the Millennia Companies has grown into economically diverse organizations with operations in 21 states. In keeping with the vision created by its CEO and Owner, Frank T. Sinito, the Millennia Companies will aggressively continue its growth.
 
Because of Millennia's continued growth, we are recruiting to fill a position on our HR team, Recruiting Associate, at our corporate office in downtown Cleveland, OH. This position will fill a critical role within Millennia. We are looking for a candidate who has the skills and education required for the role as well as the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with the initiative and drive to make this position his/her own.
 
 
Summary/Objective 
Performs a variety of professional activities in support of Millennia's centralized Human Resources function, including recruitment, selection and retention strategy, company policies and procedures, training and development internal communications, recognition and reward, employee relations, worker's compensation, legal compliance and performance, management.
 
 

Essential Functions
Supports the employment function for operational departments; Screen and interview applicants, and oversee departmental interview process as needed.
Develops creative approaches to the recruitment process to increase high-caliber candidate sourcing including referral generation, Internet sourcing, ad placement, job fairs, community outreach, direct sourcing/cold calling, and networking.
Spearheads the academic recruitment effort, manage university relations and oversees internship programs.
Develops positive and effective employee communications utilizing various mediums; including newsletters, bulletin boards, notices and/or internal website.
Organizes, schedules and conducts employee orientation programs.
Assists in the planning, design and administration of the company's employee development and training programs for management and non-management employees. Assists in conduct training classes, coordinate ongoing Departmental training programs and develop new programs.
Contributes effectively to the motivation of employees by counseling with supervisors and managers regarding human resource practices and interpreting human resource policies.
Develops and maintains skills and talent inventory database. Advises Senior Management on mobility and deployment of employees to other departments or locations.

Preferred Education and Experience
1.    3-5 years previous HR experience.
2.    College Degree in Human Resource Management or Business Administration preferred
 
The Millennia Companies offer competitive wages and benefit packages. We are a growing company, with potential for advancement. Pre-employment credit/criminal and drug screen are required. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 
Apply here:

Title: Sales/Admissions Representatives Needed
Description:
WE WANT YOU! Roadmaster Drivers School, a Premier National Commercial Truck Driver Training School with over 20 years success, is currently seeking highly motivated, professional Admissions Representative to join our Richfield, OH team. 

If you're an ethical, motivated, goal-oriented & dedicated sales professional who enjoys helping people improve their lives while simultaneously improving your own, we're looking for YOU!

What We Offer: 
•	Immediate full time position
•	Competitive wages and commission structure
•	Health Insurance
•	Dental Insurance 
•	401(k) Retirement Plan 
•	Company provided life and AD&D insurance
•	Employee Perks Program through Abenity®
•	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
•	Paid sick time
•	Paid vacation time and other benefits
•	Opportunities for advancement

As an Admission Representative, you will be responsible for communicating with Roadmaster leads and inquiries in order to enroll interested prospective students into Roadmaster's Commercial Truck Driver Training Program.  You will be involved daily with helping individuals improve their lives and income through career training, while enjoying a stable and rewarding position with an organization that rewards best in class performers.   

Job Requirements:

•	Previous sales or admissions experience
•	Salesforce® or CRM experience strongly preferred, basic computer skills required
•	Ability to professionally and effectively communicate Roadmaster's mission, goals and course offerings  to applicants through both the written and spoken word
•	Ability to work in a professional office and school environment
•	College degree preferred, minimum high school diploma or equivalent required
•	High energy with a positive attitude and passion for over-coming challenges and helping individuals improve their lives through career training 
•	Ability to obtain and maintain licensure as required by applicable state regulations
•	Possess demonstrated physical, intellectual and leadership ability to perform the duties of admitting students into Roadmaster's programs

If you are a career-minded sales professional with a passion for helping others in a position with real earning potential, look no further. 

Qualified candidates, please send resumes and inquiries to:
jobs@roadmaster.com

Roadmaster Drivers School is a Drug-Free Workplace.   Successful completion of a company approved pre-employment drug screen is required of all candidates as part of the hiring process.   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.
Compensation: Hourly base rate (varies based on experience) plus monthly bonus

Title: Welding Opportunities
Description:
Trailer Component Manufacturing, a Division of Buyers Products Company, and a growing   OEM trailer component manufacturer is seeking hard-working, energetic and innovative candidates to join their top-notch manufacturing facilities and be a part of a growing & reputable organization. 

Duties & Responsibilities   

•  Demonstrated skills using MIG and TIG welding processes.
•  Welding components in flat, vertical, or overhead positions.
•  Adhere to safety procedures and process. 
•  Examining work pieces for defects and measure work pieces with straightedges or templates to ensure conformance with specifications.
•  Welding separately or in combination, using aluminum, stainless steel, cast iron, and other alloys.
•  Receives instructions, prints, and work orders for the job. Plans details of working procedure and tools and material requirements. 
•  Fabricates equipment by cutting, burning, and welding various metals. 
•  Repairs equipment by using welding techniques and appropriate welding equipment. 
•  Cleans and prepares surfaces to be welded. Sets up, assembles, and tacks weld parts. 
•   Builds up worn or defective surfaces. 
•  Uses burning equipment to dismantle assemblies and to cut material to size and shape. 
•   Perform related duties as assigned. 

Skills & Experience

•  GED or High School diploma required, certificate from a technical or vocational school is preferred.  
•  Understand and apply welding techniques and ability to operate welding equipment with skill
•  Steel/Aluminum experience is preferred 
•  Wire-feed welding
•  Mechanical w/hydraulics
•  Fabrications with welding and layout

SUCCESSFUL Candidates will demonstrate the following; 

•  A high sense of urgency & integrity
•  Be a productive member of the Team
•  Demonstrate passion toward job/company
•  Be self motivated 
•  Flexible/Adaptable to a fast-pace, changing environment    

All positions are long-term temporary - direct hire with the client. 

ONLY INQUIRIES WITH A RESUME WILL BE CONSIDERED

Title: Packer/Mail Assistant - Seasonal
Description:
Internet based retailer has an immediate opening for a packer/mail assistant through mid-January. Time period could be extended depending on business needs. Successful candidate must be available daily from 10:00 am through approximately 4 pm Monday - Friday.  Seasonal hours may extend to 5 pm daily. Actual hours will depend on business levels and should average about 20 hours per week up to 30 hours per week during peak seasonal demand.

The ideal candidate will be a quick learner who can work independently and is comfortable using a bar code scanner and personal computer. Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Windows required. 

Responsibilities include:

- Bar code scanning pre-packed packages and printing postage labels
- Reviewing package contents for correctness
- Applying postage labels and sealing packages
- Packing of product into mailing envelopes or boxes.
- Applying rules to assure postage costs are minimized
- Daily opening and closing responsibilities as assigned
- Maintaining a clean and orderly work environment
- Occasional miscellaneous tasks as requested

Requirements:
- Must be non-smoker. Due to nature of product being shipped, smokers will not be considered.
- Must be available Monday through Friday through mid-January.
- Must be able to work independently after adequate training
- Must be familiar with basic personal computer operation
- Must be able to work closely with others and follow directions
- Requires lifting of 25 to 30 pounds and moving short distances multiple times per day

Respond to this ad with work history and availability. Please do not call or contact us by any other means regarding this position.

Description:
Overview 

If you love social media and are an active user, now is the time to get paid for your time on social media platforms!  Social Media Evaluators with Appen evaluate the quality and relevance of information in their local area or country of residence in categories such as news feeds, advertisements and search results.  Tech companies around the world need the knowledge and experience of the very people who use their services.  Social Media Evaluators have a direct impact on the effectiveness and relevancy of the service these companies provide. 
 
The Social Media Evaluator is a work-from-home opportunity where all you need is a computer or smartphone and the desire to make a positive impact while working in the social media platforms you enjoy. 
 
These are entry-level positions and Social Media Evaluators can learn new technologies and receive income just by having the experience of participating in social media. 
 
Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a Appen's rapidly growing global Social Media Evaluation services providing critical data for the world's top internet search engine companies!

Title: Wildland Firefighter Training-U.S. Forest Service-Military Vets ONLY
Description:
The Umatilla National Forest, in partnership with the Mt. Adams Institute and AmeriCorps, is now offering a full-time, paid internship for U.S. Military Veterans---DD 214 Required. (10 positions available)

***For more open positions and detailed position descriptions with full application instructions, please visit:  or contact Katie Schmidt, Recruitment Coordinator, at (509) 395 3465 or recruitment{@}mtadamsinstitute.com.

Position Title: VetsWork-GreenCorps Member (Wildland Firefighter Training/Wildfire Landscape Management Intern) - 2018 Season

Position Summary: This is an exciting opportunity that combines hands-on work experience and skills training in partnership with the Umatilla National Forest, Mt Adams Institute, and AmeriCorps. Successful candidates will be enrolled in Mt. Adams Institute VetsWork-GreenCorps Program and will receive USFS training in safety, chainsaw, tool use, wildland firefighting, and crew organization. Veterans will work on fuel reduction, leadership training, and exposure to fire suppression. The experience and training in the VetsWork-GreenCorps program is designed to prepare participants for a variety of positions with the U. S. Forest Service.

General Responsibilities (to include, but not limited to):
1.	Willingness to work long hard hours in all weather conditions.
2.	Repeatedly lift upwards of 50 pounds 
3.	Ability to repetitively use hand tools (these are often heavy tools like Pulaskis, chainsaws, etc.) 
4.	Support the Integrated Vegetation Management by participation in fuels reduction, thinning and prescribed fire applications.
5.	Participants will attend basic "Fire School" where they will receive training and certification in the following courses:
a.	I-100 - Introduction to Incident Command System (ICS)
b.	L-180 - Human Factors in the Wildland Fire Service
c.	S-130 - Firefighter Training
d.	S-190 - Introduction to Wildland Fire Behavior
e.	S-211 - Portable Pumps and Water Use
f.	S-212 - Wildland Fire Chain Saws
6.	 Possible trail construction

Position Requirements:
1.	The duties of this position require that the member meet prescribed physical requirements as measured by the Work Capacity Fitness Test at the arduous level. To meet the arduous level the member must be able to walk 3 miles within 45 minutes while carrying 45 pounds. This "pack test" will be administered on the first day of the program.
2.	Additional physical requirements also include: (but will not be tested on the first day of the program) a 1.5 mile run completed within 12 minutes, 25 sit-up in one minute, 25 push-ups in one minute and 7 consecutive pull-ups . 
	       a.   This will be part of required daily physical training.
3.	Must have a valid driver's license, clean driving record and ability to provide documentation.  Must comply with MAI Personal and Organizational Vehicle Use Policy detailed at the end of this position description.
4.	The member must have the following gear or equipment:
a.	NFPA Rated Leather Work Boots (Ex: Whites Boots, Hawthorne, & Danner Brands)
5.	Must not engage in any prohibited activities as outlined in the Member Service Agreement.
6.	Must have served in US Armed Forces, including Guard and Reserves and have a DD214 with an honorable discharge.
7.	U.S. citizen, national or lawful permanent resident.
8.	Possession of a high school diploma or equivalent, or commit to earning one prior to receiving an education award.
9.	Ability to commit to the full term of service (12 weeks) for which they are applying. The program runs from Monday, April 23, 2018 through Friday, July 13, 2018.
10.	Selection, placement and retention are contingent upon passing the National Sex Offender Public Registry, state of service and state of residence criminal history check and a national FBI fingerprint check.
11.	This position does not have recurring access to vulnerable populations.  
12.	Regular and reliable attendance.

Title: Academic Consulting Firm Recruiting new Analysts and Editors
Description:
1.) Who we are:
We are a medium sized, cloud-based consultancy headquartered in Delaware, USA, but with consultants spread across the globe, from Asia to South America. We primarily handle Academic Consulting for Doctorate level clients, and are currently hiring for 3 positions: Qualitative Analyst, Quantitative Analyst, and Editor.
Each position is a strictly work-from-home position, and any applicant should view this as a strong incentive. Please note that hours for these positions are flexible, from part-time (10 hours per week) up to full-time (50-60 hours per week) depending on your schedule and preferences.
All applicants will be required to attempt a trial project which varies depending on the position they are applying for. All applicants to the SAME position will receive the SAME trial project - successful applicants will be paid for the trial project, but unsucessful applicants will NOT be paid. Please note for the trial project, and for all final deliverables, MS Word will be required.

2a.) Job responsibilities for the Qualitative Analyst position:
Your main responsibility will be to support our clients in their dissertation processes. This may include:

Content changes - Making changes to pre-existing work based on the comments of the client's dissertation committee.

Topic selection - Finding research gaps in academic literature, creating a valid problem statement, justifying the purpose for the study, and selecting an underlying Theoretical or Conceptual Framework
to guide the study. 

Expansions - Taking a preliminary piece of the client's work, and expanding it into complete chapters.

Methodological Development - Choosing the optimal qualitative methodology to use for a particular study, such as Grounded Theory, Content Analysis, or Phenomenology.

Qualitative Analysis - Coding qualitative data such as interviews or focus group transcripts, conducting the analysis using qualitative analysis software, and interpreting the results.

Literature Reviews - Finding and reviewing relevant recent literature, creating an outline and Annotated Bibliography for a literature review, and drafting the review based on the articles and outline.

Multi-part Projects - projects that involve elements of all of the above, and/or involve assisting our clients in correcting errors made in the above areas of their dissertation.

There will be substantial 'on the job learning' as you're slowly introduced to (and trained on) each of the above project types, one-by-one. It is very important for all applicants to the qualitative analyst position to be comfortable with researching academic literature via online databases such as Google Scholar or ERIC. This particular requirement is extremely important, perhaps even more so than the other requirements.

2b.) Job responsibilities for the Quantitative Analyst position:
Your main responsibility will be to support our clients in the statistical phases of their dissertation processes. 

Importantly, you will need to be comfortable designing and drafting a valid statistical methodology 
(specifying the sample, population, instruments, data collection and analysis procedures, etc.), 
running the analyses using standard stats packages, and drafting and interpreting the results. 

All deliverables need to be in a presentable, professional format, and should adhere to APA guidelines when applicable. Applicants must have a strong applied mathematics or statistics background; proficiency in applied statistics and hypothesis testing required.

Additionally, applicants must be familiar with common statistical software packages such as SPSS, R or Stata. As a bonus, applicants experienced in SEM and Path Analysis software like AMOS or MPLUS will receive higher pay for those project types.

Finally, all applicants must be extremely comfortable writing, as this is a big part of the position, not just statistical analysis and expertise, but academic writing.

2c.) Job responsibilities for the Editor position:
Your main responsibility will be to edit documents ranging from 25-200 pages, virtually all in APA 6 format, for both internal use and directly for clients. Almost all the documents will be academic papers (primarily dissertations), and familiarity with the dissertation formatting guidelines is required. 

Applicants must have a strong background in editing - we are not training editors: all editors should apply ready to immediately begin work. Applicants should be familiar with all functions of MS Word, and specifically be very comfortable with APA 6 formatting guidelines as applicable to documents in MS Word format. Additionally, applicants should be fully knowledgeable of all the major formatting guidelines of a standard doctorate level dissertation, including headings, front matter, references, etc.

3.) Requirements:
Applicants must possess a meticulous nature and an extremely high attention to detail.

Excellent command of the English Language.

Bachelor's Degree or higher, preferably from a good American university. However, most of our analysts have graduate degrees.

4.) Compensation:
a.) Qualitative Analyst fees vary by project type and complexity. Typically, it ranges from $200-$600 per project depending on length, difficulty, and timeline. Most of our analysts make between $1000-$2000 monthly on limited, flexible hours. However, several full-time analysts make substantially more, depending on how quickly and efficiently they can do the work, as well as their experience and seniority at the firm.

b.) Quantitative Analyst fees vary depending on whether the work is primarily done in SPSS, or if it requires other software like SAS, STATA, R, AMOS, MPLUS etc. In the former case, fees range from $100-$300, and in the latter case, fees range from $300-$900. More advanced software is typically required if the project is large and/or complex, requiring more sophisticated statistical methodologies. We do not provide any of the software, and all applicants must have access to their own software to be considered.

c.) Pay for editors is $1/page for 'internal' work done on company documents, and $1.5/page for 'external' work done on client documents. A typical edit will be between 25-200 pages, and will pay $1.5/page assuming it is being done for a client.

5.) To Apply:
Please reply with a recently updated resume, and a cover letter or email explaining your interest in the specified position: Qualitative Analyst, Quantitative Analyst, or Editor.
Compensation: Please refer to the compensation section of the job ad

Excellent paid training (initial training, ongoing coaching, and recurring training refreshes)
Competitive compensation & benefit plans (highly market-competitive when compared with typical dealership sales work)
An awesome culture where 1) your voice matters, 2) your boss will be someone you can trust and respect, and 3) you will be surrounded by people who are here to support you and help you succeed

State License-Certifications

Adhere to all CARite, state, and federal policies, laws, rules and regulations, including, but not limited to: O.S.H.A and EPA, Personal Protective Equipment, Proper Waste Disposal in Required areas, Asset Protection, Integrity and Standards of Professional Appearance, Code of Business Conduct, and Time and Attendance.

 Teacher Assistants: High School Diploma.  Experience working as a primary caregiver a plus.  Will train. Motivated and eager to learn in a fast growing company.

Part-time Field Marketing Representative
Description:
Job Title: Field Marketing Representative (Part-time)

This position is at the forefront of MTI Global Services' Sales and Marketing efforts to increase client sales at the retail store level. The candidate should have diverse skills that include a focus on detail, relationship building and the ability to communicate effectively with key personnel (retail store sales associates, general managers, sales managers) and consumers. Depending on the size of each market place, this position could necessitate either part-time or full-time services, each with bi-monthly store visits combined with periodic project based selling day and special events.

Responsibilities:
Primary duty is to create consumer awareness, product brand preference, and product mind share for hardware and software companies at the retail store level.
Influence others to share enthusiasm for both the company and the product line
Ability to merchandise client products and/or manage the client objectives in an assigned territory
Position requires gathering client product competitive intelligence at the store level
Effectively collect and communicate product information/data through appropriate channels
Efficiently and effectively train retail personnel on products and selling techniques
Ability to visually access on-site needs i.e., product and promotional/marketing material stocking
Meet timely required reporting deadlines
Periodic travel to attend other company sponsored training events or client sponsored special events, or to cover other market areas as needed.
Occasionally assist in selling days - selling products directly to customers in retail stores.
Skills and Requirements:
Good knowledge and experience with consumer electronics and various other consumer-based electronics products
Technically savvy and computer proficient
Computer with daily email access
Strong oral and written communication skills
Must have the willingness and ability to build relationships at the retail store level on behalf of both MTI Global Services and our clients
Professional image and approach to business
Friendly demeanor, easy to approach, energetic
Group training, demonstrating or presentation experience
Retail sales or retail management is a plus
Quick learner who is self-motivated
Ability to self-train on client product(s)
Ability to lift 20 pounds, as needed (for arranging store displays)
Reliable transportation with valid state driver's license and proof of auto insurance

Title: Become a Class A CDL Truck Driver & Earn Big with our NEW Pay Increase
Description:
Become a Class A CDL Truck Driver & Earn Big with our NEW Pay Increase! Earn More with our NEW Pay Increase! Call for details! 866-448-0192  No Experience? No Problem! Start your Career Today!  In as little as three weeks of sponsored training at an approved CRST facility, you'll be on the road, traveling the country, as a professional truck driver. There is always a job out there for a truck driver and it pays a lot more than you may think. In this high demand industry, with your CDL A license, you can find work all over the country. At CRST, you'll learn first-hand from industry veterans who know what it takes to make it in the transportation industry. With a Class A CDL, you can quickly work your way up from a student to a trainer, with the opportunity to run your own business as an Owner Operator through our Lease Purchase program, in less than a year!  Veterans paid for time served. CRST Expedited's Military Apprenticeship Program pays you for your service while you earn your Class A CDL. If you use your GI Bill™ you can earn additional tax free income. Active Military Reservists and Honorably Discharged Veterans also receive a sign on bonus and pay credit for your time served.  If you have at least 2 years of experience driving a commercial vehicle in the military, you may be able to get started even sooner through the Military Skills Test Waiver. Title: Luxury Auto Purchaser ($3000-$6000 per car)
Description:
We are an international trade business group, that wholesales luxury cars globally (www.hsdragon.us). Our U.S. headquarters is based in Charlotte, NC. We are now considering loyal and qualified individuals to join our team as auto purchasing agents. This is a part-time position, with a flexible schedule. Our purchasing agents generally earn more with us working part-time, than they earn from their full time careers. 10k-20k per month is common, and generally does not require more than 5 hours per week. We offer one of the most aggressive commissions in the industry, but we also expect sophisticated individuals, who know how to negotiate and close a deal. 

Candidate Requirements
1. Must possess a valid driver's license 
2. At least 10 years of workforce experience (Sales experience preferred)
3. Experience negotiating auto purchases from dealerships 
4. Must display a professional appearance and attitude, possess loyal and faithful qualities 
5. Excellent communication skills; ability to display confidence and articulate
6. Credit score of 650+ preferably (displaying the capability to buy a luxury vehicle)
7. Homeowners preferred, retired individuals and veterans are preferred but not required 
8. No drug users, No criminal history

Position Responsibilities
1)The selected candidate will be required to contact local dealerships and assist us with locating and purchasing the vehicles.
2)They will need to secure and/or order the vehicle with a deposit and keep the receipt. (Deposit provided by our company)
3)Prior to picking up the vehicle, we will provide the agent with the certified funds required to purchase the vehicle. 
4)Once the vehicle purchase is complete, the commission will be paid to the agent.


*Good credit (680+) is needed in order to be approved by lenders;
*Financing or Leasing the car is more likely to succeed than a cash deal. This is because the dealerships have certain requirements in order to sell these particular models. 
*We provide the down payment when the agent finances the vehicle, and payoff the loan balance immediately after purchase, so we can receive the title. 

This position will not be available for long in this particular market, due to high volume of interest. Applicants that feel they possess the above requirements, should send their resume immediately for consideration, and describe themselves briefly in the email. However, if you do not possess the aforementioned qualifications, please do not apply, as the dealerships have rigid requirements for these models.

If you apply for this position, please include your contact information so we can reach out to you. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Experienced Commercial Roofers
Description:
Position Summary 
This position assists a Commercial Roofing Foreman in completing customer work orders while continuing to learn the trade. The position is responsible for contributing to the team's achievement of productivity goals, safety requirements, quality workmanship and professionalism. This is a full-time, year-round position with benefits. Most jobs are local. Candidates must be able to meet at various local job sites and have excellent attendance.  We offer competitive wages and pay for experience.

Essential Duties and responsibilities 
•	Job site set up and preparation per job Foreman, ie set up of equipment, material staging etc. 
•	Assist Foreman in completing assignment per contract/work order, utilizing all acquired skills in roofing 
•	Seek out learning opportunities to increase job knowledge and apply skill set
•	May communicate with property owner or management and may lead team members if no foreman is present
•	End of day clean up at job site of materials, equipment, nails, other debris etc., daily
•	All other duties as assigned

Requirements:
•	3-5 years' experience. At least one year of solid commercial roofing experience is required.
•	Excellent attendance
•	Good communication skills to effectively interface with customers and team members and complete paperwork as requested
•	Aptitude to learn and develop necessary skills for advancement
•	Ability to lift up to 80 pounds as needed
•	Follow all safety procedures and reinforce procedures for others
•	Ability to bend, reach, climb, stand, sit, kneel or crouch for extended periods of time
•	Ability to work in extreme temperatures, hot and cold
•	Current Driver's license with an acceptable driving record

Benefits:
This is a year-round position. The company pays competitive wages and offers health, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) and paid vacation. Wages are based upon candidates acquired knowledge and skills.

Title: $$$2nd shift Production/3rd shift Press Operators$$$$Starting at $10!
Description:
Snider-Blake in partnership with Atlantic Tool and Die is looking to bring on associates for 2nd shift production and 3rd shift press op. 

Atlantic Tool and Die is looking for general production associates on 2nd shift( 3:30pm-12am). Must have some experience in a manufacturing environment. Must be able to work overtime including Saturdays! Pay is $10.25/hr


Atlantic Tool and Die is also looking for 3rd shift press op(11:30pm-8:00am).Must be able to work overtime including Saturdays. You must have experience with stamping dies, presses and related equipment.
This position will be responsible for the following:

-Maintain required quality control checks throughout shift.
-Maintain Lot Trace Tags throughout the shift.
-Maintain clean area and help others maintain clean area.
-Complete all necessary documentation correctly and timely, including: data cards and any other necessary documentation
-Operate stamping press according to pressroom procedures.
-Check die protection, ensure all safety protection in place at all times.
-Handle scrap that is generated.
-Assist with set up and tear down press per procedures as required.
-Perform rework or sorting as required
-Responsible for housekeeping of press, die, immediate area and plant.
-Perform reel changes and strip set-ups.

The pay for press operator is $11-$13/hr depending on experience. 

***Come in and mention our craigslist referral bonus to receive a $25 bonus after working for 80 consecutive hours!!
 Also receive a $10 bonus after working your first full day of work and also receive a $15 bonus after working a consecutive 40 hours. You can't have any attendance issues to be eligible for this bonus.***

**APPLY NOW**
Walk-ins welcome Monday-Friday 9A-2:30P*Apply Now*
Must have two forms of ID (state and federal): such as a state ID and social security or birth certificate. 

*Like our Facebook page for more openings**


Snider-Blake Personnel 
4200 Rockside Road Suite 206
Independence, OH 44131
Call us at 216-362-4949!

Assistant Property Manager
Description:
Millennia Housing Management, Ltd., a successful management company located in the Midwest, is looking for an experienced Assistant Property Manager for a wonderful affordable housing community, Seneca Grove, located in Painesville, OH.  We desire someone that has experience in Project Based Section 8, Tax Credit (LIHTC), or other subsidies of multi-family low income housing. The Assistant Manager will also lead the property when the Manager is out of the office. This is a full -time position with an excellent benefit package and attractive starting salary (negotiable upon industry experience).

The successful candidate should have a minimum of 2 yrs. experience in marketing and leasing of apartments, including creation of marketing materials, outreach marketing to community and the ability to close the sale and lease the apartments. This position has a heavy focus on income verification/certification, paperwork and resident relations.

•	Able to quickly and accurately diagnose equipment malfunctions to maximize production availability, performance and quality.
•	Maintain all equipment in plant (including, but not limited to gear boxes, motors, conveyors, bagging equipment, etc., and mobile equipment.
•	Do preventative maintenance on all equipment as required.
•	Ability to manage and run a shift.
 
Principal Accountabilities: 
•	Assist with maintenance shop organization
•	Assist with Critical Spare part identification
•	Assist with development of lubrication schedules
•	Maintain all equipment in plant (including, but not limited to gear boxes, motors, conveyors, bagging equipment, etc.)
•	Do preventative maintenance on all equipment as required
•	Grease equipment/bearings, etc.
•	Replace gear boxes/motors/chains
•	Install equipment as needed
•	Redesign equipment/processes as needed
•	Trouble shoot all equipment (pneumatic, electrical and mechanical)
•	Weld
•	Operate hand tools
•	Keep written and/or electronic records of maintenance tasks as required 
•	Service loaders/forklifts as needed
•	Replace lights
•	Miscellaneous projects (construction/demolition/etc.)
•	Maintain all housekeeping requirements
Required:
•	Ability to work overtime on short notice
•	Ability to safely and effectively operate equipment
•	Ability to interpret and understand reports, safety/operating procedures & other policies and procedures and utilize equipment checklist
•	MUST have basic skills in the repair and troubleshooting of the following areas: hydraulic systems, pneumatic systems, diesel systems, 
•	Must exhibit skills in cutting, welding and fabrication
•	Must work weekends and various shifts
•	Verifiable evidence of maintenance experience and knowledge (industrial, military, contractor, schooling, etc)
•	Be physically able to perform the job duties including bending, stooping, climbing stairs and ladders, working at heights up to 100 feet, lifting, working in confined spaces, and working at extreme temperatures.  
•	Available & willing to work any shift (including weekends and holidays), demonstrate willingness to work extended hours and be available for call outs.
•	Have a valid driver's license.
•	Demonstrated positive attitude toward/interest in safety and safe work rules.
•	Able to read/write English.
•	Ability to problem solve and make decision as needed
•	Good Attendance Record & Work Ethics
•	Ability to work outside in all types of weather, climb ladders, and work from heights
•	Potential to work long irregular hours (weekends and holidays included)
•	Ability to work in a potentially physically strenuous environment
•	Demonstrated ability to follow directions.
•	Right to work in the U.S. that is not based solely on possession of a student visa or a visa sponsored by a third-party employer.
Preferred:
•	Demonstrated self-initiative, ownership and drive.
•	Demonstrated ability to be a positive team player.
•	Demonstrated ability to communicate and listen well.
•	Ability to manage and run shift. 
As with all positions, offers of employment are conditional upon:
•	Passing a drug screen
•	Passing a criminal background screen
•	Verification of identity and employment eligibility
We believe that employees must have the opportunity to do what they do best every day.  We want to understand the things that you do better than others - the talents that you rely on to succeed.

Title: Sales Positions - Work From Home
Description:
We run a large marketing organization in the energy services industry. Our parent company paid out roughly $100 Million in commissions in 2016 and they intend to grow that to over $200 Million.

This is a realistic 6-figure plus income opportunity for highly motivated individuals who are willing to follow a PROVEN SYSTEM and put in the work.

We use the most successful business model in the industry with solid backing from one of the strongest and fastest growing companies in America. In fact, the company was awarded by INC Magazine as the Fastest Growing Company In America and has an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau.

You bring the skills, attitudes, and habits of success... We teach you the details.

OK to start Part Time.

We do nearly everything either online or over the phone: Live training multiple times weekly via online presentations and conference calls, recorded training 24/7 on video, and our client presentations can be done with simple online technology.

Our system enables individuals new to the industry to earn great income as they learn the business, and it enables seasoned industry professionals to expand their business from their local home town to other parts of the country.

We represent one of the strongest companies in America who has introduced powerful new energy products that provide more VALUE to help families save money on a bill they already are paying. We don't ask people to pay for something they don't want, we ask them to save money on a bill they already pay every month. When people learn about this, they want it.

We are looking for self-motivated achievers who are looking for the freedom and flexibility to work on their own schedule from a virtual office in a REAL business of their own, with one of the strongest companies in the industry.

Set your own hours... we pay for RESULTS, not attendance... so if you're looking for a job, this is not for you.... but if you're looking for a SYSTEM that can allow you to get to a level of income that just has not been possible before, then we might be a match...

We don't punish success, we throw money at it.

What we offer...
1. NO LIMITS on your income... Be paid what you're really worth
2. Overrides and bonuses paid weekly
3. Great quality of life.. work from anywhere
4. Flexible hours / Time Freedom... you're the boss
5. Fun, supportive, and positive team culture
6. A marketing position that doesn't require any selling
7. Proven SYSTEM that produced roughly $100 Million in commissions & bonuses in 2016
8. Thorough training both live and recorded. Personal mentoring
9. Company wide recognition and bonuses for significant achievement
10. Company paid celebrations at beautiful destinations for top producers
11. Leadership that cares about your success
12. Leveraged and residual income

Most importantly, an opportunity to make a real difference in people's lives while you escape the 9-5 rat race and take back control of your life.

What we DON'T do...
1. No cold calling or door-to-door
2. No evening or weekend appointments away from home
3. No wasting time fighting traffic
4. No dress code
5. No quotas or minimums
6. No micro-managing
7. No corporate favoritism. Promotions based on results, not politics

Who We Are Looking For...

Our ideal candidate is a self-motivated winner who is HUNGRY and just looking for the right opportunity, the right team, and the right SYSTEM.

Must have strong communication and "people skills", a great attitude, HIGH INTEGRITY, enjoy helping people, and be willing to put in the time and work that we all know is required in order to achieve extraordinary success.

If that's you, then let's talk.

Part time OK if you can put in at least 2 hours a day of minimum income producing activity, plus a couple hours a week in the beginning of online training to help you get started quickly.

This is a 1099 independent contractor position. Income is based on results.

YOUR NEXT STEP...
Your next step is to complete the short application at the link below. If it looks like we are a potential match, we will get back to you via email with more information.

Go here:



-
Compensation: Up To Six Figures And More

Title: Jr. Technician Opportunity with Elite Line Services!
Description:
Elite Line Services is a major single source maintenance solution in the industry with the bandwidth to service all of your equipment maintenance needs. We maintain all original equipment manufacturers for material handling equipment, BHS, PBB, Facilities, GSE and vehicles. Our hybrid programs efficiently cross utilize technicians between equipment types to provide seamless coverage that protects the best interest of our customers. Whether this is getting full warranty value for new parts and systems or applying experienced and specialized technical support for mature equipment needs, ELS has you covered.

 

Our Benefits: 

Elite Line Services offers a wide variety of benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Short and Long Term Disability, Company Paid Life Insurance, 401k, Tuition Assistance, EAP, Paid Leave, and Paid Whole Sale Shopping Membership (Sam's Club).


Responsibilities 



•Assist with basic maintenance assignments involving but not limited to preventive, routine and emergency maintenance, clearing system jams; shift inspections, cleaning, and/or electrical and mechanical adjustments.
•May diagnose equipment failures under the guidance of senior personnel; ensures equipment is running safely.
•Take direction and seeks the guidance and expertise of senior level personnel and accepts training and mentoring from them.
•Read and interprets repair manuals, basic schematics and supervisor/manager's instructions.
•Work in tight and/or high spaces utilizing appropriate PPE and fall protection equipment.
•Complete forms connected with work assignments according to established procedures.
•Perform additional duties/assignments as may be required by management.
•Follow and complies with all company and federally established policies and procedures; completes all applicable training courses assigned by the company.
•Assist Technicians with basic maintenance such as sweeping, cleaning and greasing.
•Complete all safety training as assigned by the Company.
•Compliance with all ELS safety programs, policies and procedures.
•Perform additional duties/assignments that may be required by management from time to time.

 


Qualifications 




BASIC REQUIREMENTS:

•High School Graduate or General Education Degree (GED)
•Minimum 1 year of previous mechanical experience, 1 year previous BHS or PBB  experience, or be able to pass a mechanical aptitude test.
•Ability to work a non-traditional schedule including weekends and holidays.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
•Previous work experience in an Airport environment.
•Previous experience working on conveyors and/or passenger boarding bridges

Additional Responsibilities 


Elite Line Services (ELS) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, gender, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status or medical condition.

Description:
ELS-Sr Technician



Daifuku ELS

Elite Line Services is a major single source maintenance solution in the industry with the bandwidth to service all of your equipment maintenance needs. We maintain all original equipment manufacturers for material handling equipment, BHS, PBB, Facilities, GSE and vehicles. Responsibilities

Completes basic maintenance assignments involving but not limited to preventive, routine and emergency maintenance, clearing system jams; shift inspections, cleaning, and/or electrical and mechanical adjustments.
•Monitor system operation; diagnoses equipment failures; ensures equipment is running safely.
•Diagnose equipment failures and ensures equipment is running safely.
•Provide direction, guidance and expertise to other personnel assigned to assist in maintenance and repair activities;      conducts training and mentoring responsibilities, assigns tasks, may act as lead in the absence of senior personnel.
•Read and interprets repair manuals, basic schematics and supervisor/manager's instructions.
•Work in tight and/or high spaces utilizing appropriate PPE and fall protection equipment.
•Complete forms connected with work assignments according to established procedures.
•Perform additional duties/assignments as may be required by management.

Title: DIRECTV Sales - Weekly Salary - Stop being stressed!
Description:
Hello and thanks for your interest in working with Elite Mobility Inc. Directv's Preferred dealer for Northeast Ohio. 

We are a direct sales organization that works hand in hand with at&t and DIRECTV. We specialize in outside sales (business sales, and consumer sales) and also Event sales (trade shows, big home and garden shows, car shows, county and state fairs).

We have two types of compensation: 

Base Salary of $300 per week. This salary has nothing to do with how many sales you do, and is a guaranteed salary paid weekly. In addition to your base pay salary we pay individually on products sold. 

DIRECTV VIDEO SALE: $40
UVERSE VIDEO SALE: $75
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $88.00
FOR ADVANCED SALESPEOPLE WE OFFER A 100% COMMISSION OPTION:

DIRECTV SALE: $160
UVERSE SALE: $75
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $350 plus $50 for any camera sold, up to two cameras. 
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Schedule and hours: 

We work Monday Through Friday from 12 noon to 7:30pm. 

We have 3 scheduled team meetings: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. The other two days, we meet to turn in paperwork and receive territory from upper management.

Do we offer advancement opportunities?: 

Yes we do, infact we are a preffered dealer for DIRECTV and At&t. This means at&t and Elite Mobility have teamed up to grow at&t's footprint, in turn they finance our expansion as an organization. Qualified salespeople that have higher than average sales numbers will be given an opportunity to manage a sales team. Our organization has a set standard and procedure for once a sales team hits their quota two months in a row, a location and franchise office will be opened up for that sales manager. That sales manager will then be promoted out of a sales role into a general manager role. The pay for the GM position begins at $75,000 per year plus commission and bonus's.
Compensation: Weekly salary plus bonus when goals are met.

Title: Academic Freelance Writers - REMOTE
Description:
WHO WE ARE
Ultius, Inc., a Delaware Corporation, is a technology company that provides an Internet-based marketplace for consumer-focused document preparation services within three main tiers of business: custom sample writing, editing, business writing. Ultius is a global leader in connecting consumers with qualified American freelance writers. Our online platform provides American freelance writers with steady, work at home jobs in exchange for attractive pay rates. With over 2,000 writing professionals, and 24/7 editorial and support team members, Ultius drives the knowledge economy.

Ultius is also deeply committed to providing knowledge based jobs for American graduates who are struggling with the current economic climate. Our mission is to conveniently deliver high quality content for our global client base and our writers are an integral part of that process. 

Working at Ultius will not only sharpen your writing and editing skills, but it will also allow you to take part in a fast-growing company that is focused on writer success. Thousands of professionals from around the country enjoy the autonomous and lucrative nature of the job. Join the company that values your unique capabilities as a writer and editor. 

Most of our core management team started out in the writing position which has resulted in a freelance ecosystem that offers fair and transparent terms. It's no surprise that many of our writers utilize our platform as a primary source of income.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We are currently looking for talented freelance writers who are strong in the academic style. Unlike other writing services, there is no bidding and we never force you to take an order. We provide login credentials to our website, ultius(dot)com, where you can view orders, track compensation, communicate with clients and editors on existing orders, utilize our help section, and much more. We are continually updating our site with additional material and information to assist our writers. The most important professional qualities for success as an Ultius writer are careful adherence to deadlines and close attention to order instructions. You can view the full order requirements before you claim each order, which allows you to determine whether or not you can meet the order's expectations.

QUALIFICATIONS
The preferred candidate will have at least a 4 year degree from an accredited, American based college or university or be in active pursuit of such a degree. Here is a list of general requirements:

-Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
-Academic research and formatting skills
-Personal computer with internet access
-Prompt and polite communication
-Mobile phone
-Ability to follow clear instructions
-Excellent communication skills
-American English as a first language
-PayPal account

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
You can complete as many orders as you like, as long as the complete instructions set forth by the client have been met and all orders are submitted on time. We are a fast-growing company and truly value great writers. We occasionally offer generous bonuses for writers who make an effort to pick up last minute, urgency orders. We also promote from within and take writer's experiences with us very seriously. Many of our employed staff members have moved up our company's ranks after starting in this position.

HOW TO APPLY
Please respond by going to our website ultius(dot)com, clicking on the Future Writers tab, and applying via the Apply Now link. You may also respond to this job post. Be sure to send your resume or CV and a cover letter. Pending review of your initial resume and application, you will be asked to write a sample paper in order to demonstrate your writing skills. In the world of online writing, a sample paper is used in lieu of an in-person interview. The sample paper is used only to gauge your writing ability. It does not get sold, published, or viewed by any party besides the hiring personnel.

COMPENSATION
We have a sliding pay scale that generally runs from $7.50-22 per page. The regular freelance queue pays $7.50-13 per page, the urgency queue pays $12-19 per page, and the graduate level queue pays $11-22 per page. Applicable order bonuses are in addition to these payout ranges. Payouts are automatically set by our ordering system when the customer creates their order. The main factors affecting payouts are time frame, skill level, and whether the order requires editing or original writing. We compensate writers twice per month via PayPal, the trusted way to pay online.

WHO MAKES A GREAT ULTIUS WRITER
We have a talented group of writers, but there are some specific qualities that our writers tend to have. Some of these qualities are as follows:

-Passion for the writing process
-Yearning for more knowledge
-Love for research
-Willingness to communicate with customers and editors to clarify order details
-Value anonymity with customers
-Urge to increase writing ability
-Freedom to create schedule
-Satisfaction of knowing that payments are sent on time, every time

If this sounds like you, we want you to apply!

~Unfortunately, we CANNOT accept writers from CA, NY, or MA. Thank you for understanding.~

When Starbucks began operations in 1971, less than 2% of American coffee drinkers were purchasing specialty coffees. Today, 54% of all coffee beverages consumed in the United States are for the purchase of specialty coffees...it's become a $38-billion dollar a year industry.

Starbucks drove the train that created the specialty coffee market. For 23 years, we have jumped on their caboose and have gone along for the ride. During these past two decades plus, we have sold thousands of super-automatic specialty coffee bars to virtually every type of business throughout the United States.

We have engineered and created the finest and most unique super automatic specialty coffee machine in the world that will generate tens of thousands of dollars in net profit into any retailers' business bank accounts without costing them one penny out of their pockets. ZERO RISK!

We are seeking a professional Business-to-Business Sales Rep to call on small and medium-size retailers in your marketing area.
Please take a look at this video to see what is in it for YOU:


Then, to get a better understanding of our Specialty Coffee Kiosk and what is in it for our customers, take a look at: 

Then go to our website: . If you like what you see, please email your resume.

If we believe you are the person we are seeking, we will chat. Then, if we both believe we are right for each other, you will be sent a series of e-mails that provide all the specific details. If you are accepted, you will be able to begin immediately.

Title: ADMINISTRATIVE GENERALIST - KOPPLIN, KUEBLER & WALLACE
Description:
KOPPLIN, KUEBLER AND WALLACE the nation's premier Private Club Search and Consulting firm is currently looking for an experienced:
 

ADMINISTRATIVE GENERALIST
Job Brief
Kopplin, Kuebler & Wallace is seeking to fill a newly created position to enhance and support the firm's Search and Thought Leadership goals. This position is many things: Administrative Assistant, Partner Support and Marketing Developer / Coordinator. 
Job Description
We are looking for an experienced individual capable of overseeing a variety of administrative, operational and creative functions.  The incumbent must have exceptional time management, organizational and communication skills and thrive working independently.
Immediate Responsibilities Include:
•	Manage client to partner/partner to client communications including both written and phone contact
o	Provide follow up conversations with potential and identified candidates for each search assignment
o	Take forwarded calls from search directors and forward appropriate information to potential clients and candidates
o	Develop proposals/RFI's as directed by Partners
•	Manage candidate onboarding (screening/process orientation/communication/logistics/follow up)
o	Call potential new candidates and help to develop new sources of club management talent
•	Develop and implement strategies aiming to promote the organization's mission and "voice", primarily through Partner 
        speaking and presentation engagements, and other promotional means
•	Direct and oversee the distribution of marketing materials
o	Develop written materials, at the direction of the Partner, for each search assignment from beginning through conclusion
•	Create and publish firm newsletter 
•	Ghost Writing for Partner. Assist in writing articles for trade magazine and presentations for speaking engagements and 
        media support
•	Bookkeeping support for Partners (expense reports, billing etc.) 
•	Presentation preparation as needed, mostly in PPTX format, but others as needed
•	Forge and maintain relations of trust with clients and partners
•	Act as public relations representative of the company in ways that strengthen its profile in the industry
•	Devise remedial actions for any identified issues and conduct crisis management when necessary
•	Ensure procedures are implemented and in place for the effective management of all client communications and follow up
•	Develop and enhance social media presence
•	Create, maintain and distribute sales and marketing collateral
•	Help develop consulting processes (checklists) and best practices
•	Provide administrative support where needed and other duties as designed

Requirements
•	Independent Contractor with the ability to work from home and support a home office
•	Familiarity with the Club industry, along with having worked in it in a leadership capacity is highly preferred
•	Experience in developing strategies and plans
•	Ability to work independently in any setting
•	Available to work a flexible schedule, with some nights and weekends, committed to quick turnaround times
•	Maintain professional and hospitality standards in communication and branding
•	Ability to apply successful networking techniques
•	Understanding of basic bookkeeping and QuickBooks
•	Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
•	Proficiency in public relations, i.e. press releases and social media 
•	In depth knowledge of corporate governance principles and managerial best practices
•	An analytical mind capable for "out-of-the-box" thinking to solve problems
•	Proficiency in creative design
•	Understanding of Microsoft Suite and general software applications 
•	Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities
•	Degree in relevant field or at least 5 years of proven ability is desired

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN APPLYING, PLEASE REPLY TO THIS POSTING AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE.

For further information about the firm please visit our website:

Title: Earn $650/mo teaching part-time - online from home - 60-90 mins/day
Description:
The VIPKID Teach English Online opportunity:

Looking for a flexible, professional online teaching opportunity? VIPKID is the world leader in online English education for kids 12 and under.

Rediscover the joy of teaching with VIPKID's platform and curriculum. No commute, no grading, no lesson planning required! Instruct kids in your spare time during early mornings or evenings.

Teaching just 60 minutes part-time per day earns you between $420-650 a month. It's as easy as making a Skype call, with interactive and fun curriculum and lesson plans made for your use.

- Ranked #5 by Forbes on its 2017 "Top 100 Remote Work" companies
- The most active online English teaching community in the world
- Top-ranked online teaching company on Indeed and Glassdoor with 4-star rating and 86% CEO approval
- Backed by Sequoia Capital and Tencent Holdings (currently valued at $1.5 billion)

Please search for VIPKID on YouTube, Facebook, and Glassdoor to see the rave reviews from the 20,000+ North Americans that teach for us.

Requirements and Qualifications to become an Online English Teacher/Online ESL Teacher:

- BA degree or higher
- Experience with any kind of teaching (1+ years)*
- Eligible to legally work in the U.S. or Canada
- Desire to engage and inspire young learners

*Note on Teaching Experience: This can include educators, professors, tutors, teaching assistants, elementary teachers, traditional teaching experience or the equivalent in mentoring, tutoring, or alternative education.

While helpful, there's no requirement for teaching certificate, state certification, TESOL, TEFL, or ESL experience. All classes and business are conducted in English.

Other experience you may have that are not requirements, but are preferred:

- Online English Education / Educator / Online English Teaching / Online Instructor
- Home-Based Online English Teacher / Online English Tutor / Online English Tutoring
- Online English Teacher Assistant / Online English Elementary Teacher
- Summer Teacher / Casual Teacher / Assistant Teacher / Teaching Assistant
- Elementary School Teacher / High School Teacher
- Substitute Teacher / Teacher Assistant / Lead Teacher

The Basics of the Online English Teacher Role:

- The classes: 25-minute full immersion English language, 1-on-1 classes
- The pay: Depends on your experience, but as reported on Indeed, averages around $9.5 per 25-minutes class, i.e.$19/hour
- The curriculum: U.S. Common Core aligned lesson material, designed by our in-house curriculum team
- Time of day: You choose your schedule from available class slots; peak student demand hours are listed below
- Location: Conveniently teach remote from your own home - no commute!
- What you need: You only need is computer, a strong internet connection, and a headset 
- Benefits: Learn best online teaching experiences from our professional team at no cost
- The culture: You will learn about Chinese culture, families, and lifestyle through classroom exchanges with our students

Contract type: Independent contractor
Start date: Immediately

Peak times: The following hours tend to be the most requested time periods to teach from our families:

- Monday-Sunday 6-10am EST
- Saturday-Sunday 9pm-10am EST

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply through our Teacher Recruitment Portal: 

MORE INFORMATION

FAQs for applicants:

MEMBER SERVICES REPRESENTATIVE
Location: Richmond Heights, OH

Type: Part Time


Job Summary

The Member Services Representative will be responsible for creating a positive member experience by providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

Greet members, prospective members and guests, providing exceptional customer service.
Handle all front desk related activities including:
Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions.
Check members into the system.
New member sign-up.
Take prospective members on tours.
Facilitate needed updates to member's accounts.
Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner and elevate to Assistant Manager or Manager as needed.
Assist in maintaining the neatness and cleanliness of the club.
Qualifications/Requirements 

Customer service background preferred.
Basic computer proficiency.
A passion for fitness and health.
Upbeat and positive attitude!
Punctuality and reliability is a must.
Exceptional customer service skills; able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member's expectations.
Strong listener with the ability to empathize and problem solve.
Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language.
High School diploma/GED equivalent required.
Must be 18 years of age or older.
Physical Demands

Title: Choose Your Own Schedule Driving With Uber and Get Paid Weekly!
Uber Delivery Partners (Cars) NEEDED!  Fun & Flexible! Earn More!
6 WEEKS OF FREE TRUCK PAYMENTS + A $500 SIGN ON BONUS!
Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! We'll tell it to you straight -- we have an awesome program -- we're proud of it -- you'll like working here, but it won't all be sunshine and rainbows.  What we can offer you is a good job; stability; good equipment; a down-to-earth, kick a@@ company owner who genuinely cares about drivers. We have a solid lease purchase program -- you won't be rich but you're going to be earning a good living, and you'll have the pride of owning your own truck.  




 


Let us tell you a little about our program. We offer two lease options:







  


  

We offer full service, 100%, bumper-to-bumper warranty on all of our equipment.  This means that drivers will never again have to pay out of pocket for maintenance, oil changes, PM's, or any repair bills while they are working towards paying the truck off.  Breakdowns will never break the bank! 


 

  
We offer new equipment.  The oldest truck in our fleet is a 2014.  We offer 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017s! :



 

  
For orientation, we provide you with a rental car or flight to one of our terminals.  We put you in a PRIVATE ROOM, in a nice hotel!  We provide all your meals while you're here.
Compensation: Check out our lease purchase calculator on our website for pay details

Title: Life Insurance Agents Wanted!
Description:
Lincoln Heritage Life Insurance Company is the Nation's Leader in Final Expense.  The Lincoln Heritage Funeral Advantage® program is an affordable and convenient way for individuals to get Final Expense life insurance.  If you are interested in making a career for yourself, call us today!  1-888-713-6020.

Requirements:  

•	Life Insurance License
•	Valid driver's license & vehicle
•	Access to a computer
•	Motivated & ready to work
•	Sales experience a plus

Benefits/Incentives:

-Advanced Commissions
-Residual Income Opportunity
-Company Sponsored, In-House Lead Program---TV /Direct Mail ---no cold calling!
-1 Page Application
-Simplified underwriting with 24/7 assistance
-Marketing materials---inserts, door hangers & more
-Benefits: Health/Dental for Qualifying Agents (and their families). Based on Production.
-Marketing Tools You'll Need to Succeed
-Home Office Support & Reporting

Job Duties:

-Work your leads!
-Manage and train your sub-agents
-Meet with your client to find the product that fits your clients' needs
-Close the sale
-Submit application to our home office & GET PAID SAME DAY!

How does our program work?

-Lincoln Heritage generates thousands & thousands of high quality, compliant leads through our nationwide direct mail & television commercial programs.
-Interested responders will return the direct mail lead piece, or phone in to our call center to have an agent call/meet with them.
-A letter is then mailed from our home office to all responders that same day, thanking them for their interest, and letting them know we will have an agent contact them.
-Leads are distributed through our online lead portal that you can access 24/7.
-You will receive an email confirmation every time new leads have been assigned to your account.
-Now it's your turn to go out and meet with the client(s), and show them how our program can benefit them and their families.

Why should you work with Lincoln Heritage?

As a family owned business, we pride ourselves in the service we provide to our agents and policyholders.  Our goal is to make our agents' work easier by doing continuous lead testing so that our leads are always fresh, creating new marketing pieces that will walk you through your presentation with your clients, and offering our knowledge and assistance at any time.  

Lincoln Heritage maintains an A-(Excellent) financial rating with A.M. Best and an A+ with the BBB.
•	©2017 Londen Insurance Group, Inc. All rights reserved.
•	Lincoln Heritage Life Insurance Company and Lincoln Heritage Funeral Advantage are registered trademarks of Londen Insurance Group, Inc. Funeral Advantage is a trademark of Londen Insurance Group, Inc.

Description:
American Global Express, a small nationwide dry van carrier is looking for owner operators!

100% Owner Operator Fleet!

This allows us to provide the personal attention each of our operators deserve, no one ever sits without the load and the rate they deserve.  We offer multiple high dollar loads daily to every owner operator, you decide!  We aren't committed to multiple loads at last years rates from customers, that we try and convince you to haul.  We are free to take loads at the current high market rates! Don't miss out on your chance to take advantage of record setting rates in today's Spot Market!! 

CALL US TODAY!  KEITH 314-278-8841 or TOM 314-363-4200 !! OR fill out our simple Online App - go to
