Title: ★ $5,000 Sign on Bonus ★ FLATBED ★ Out & Back Freight
Administrative Assistant/Office Supervisor
Description:
Position Available for the Right Candidate!

A full-time opening for an administrative assistant/office supervisor in Brunswick, OH is currently available for a self-motivating individual with a positive attitude!

We are a professional disaster recovery company that is growing and we need your help! The ideal candidate is comfortable in Microsoft Office (especially Word, Excel and Outlook), a proficient typist, detail-oriented, holds impeccable organization skills and a communication guru! Once you join our team, you will be helping ownership and management to impress our customers, clients and employees! Light accounts payable, light accounts receivable, customer interaction, preparing reports for insurance companies, managing vendors, some bookkeeping, and new client intake!

We'd prefer someone with experience, but we prioritize intelligence and passion above all else! If we think you are the right fit but you lack experience, we will train you!

Requirements:

1.	Reliable Transportation
2.	Tech Savvy ( Enough to manage multiple applications, programs and help troubleshoot basic questions from our field staff)
3.	Drug-Free
4.	Great Attitude
5.	Patient
6.	Eager and Willing to Learn
7.	Highly Effective Communication Skills (Written, verbal, phone, email etiquette, etc.)


Bonus Items for Consideration:

1.	Microsoft Office Proficient
2.	QuickBooks Experience
3.	Experience in Collections or Accounts Receivable
4.	2-Year Degree
5.	Industry Experience

Our mission statement:

Providing fast, efficient, and high-quality services following damage from catastrophe or disaster, PuroClean Professional Services brings home and business owner relief, peace of mind and leadership during a difficult time of loss. Our mission is to enrich the lives of our customers and colleagues with unwavering respect, empathy, and compassion.

If this speaks to you and what you'd like out of a career, please contact us immediately because we would love to hear from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and cover letter if you are interested in joining our team! No phone calls please.

Title: LOGISTIC SPECIALIST

RECEIVE AND COORDINATE CUSTOMER REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTATIONS.

Title: NOW HIRING Inside Sales Agents
Description:
Do you have the gift of gab? Are you looking for a laid back job with tons of earning potential and growth? Now is the time to quit working at your dead end job and pursue a wonderful new opportunity with a company that is growing.

Our company is now seeking Call Center Agents to enroll customers into their utility companies Energy Choice Program. We work with the largest Energy Suppliers in the United States offering both job security and top notch pay!

This requires NO collections, NO retrieving personal information, etc. This is a straight forward campaign designed to help customers through-out the US save money on their utility bills at no cost to them.

We are currently offering the right candidates a base hourly pay plus commissions, bonuses, cash spiff incentives, and more.

We are hiring a broad range of individuals with or without experience. We do offer PAID TRAINING to ensure you are as successful as possible. Your success is our success.

In-Office Call Center Agents would be assigned their own desk and computer. Our dialer would simply call customers in advance for you simplifying your job and increasing your weekly pay potential. We typically play games through-out the week to offer cash incentives, vacations, etc. to those enrolling customers into these energy savings plans.

Please keep in mind, it costs customers nothing to sign up into these programs, nothing to cancel out of these programs, and they will save up to 20% off of their electric and/or gas rates. This savings offer is at no obligation to the customer, therefore making your job that much easier.

So if you're tired of your job, seeking a new career, looking for better pay, and more stability, we would like to interview you.

We have full and part time positions available.

Title: Industrial - Manufacturing Sales - $20-$40/hr + Commissions (Virtual)
Description:
1. Do you have experience in the manufacturing world? 
 2. Do you have experience in electronics, plastics, steel, rubber, chemical, gases or equipment and machining sales and know how to speak directly to engineers, plant managers, production managers and eventually purchasing managers?
 3. Have you worked for small, medium and large companies, but find yourself preferring to work in a small company environment? 
 4. Do you feel that you work better in a virtual environment from your home as opposed to commuting to an office?
 5. Do you find that you like the hunt, opening up new opportunities from scratch and being able to penetrate markets that take precision, accuracy and both influential and consultative selling? 
 6. Do you have the ability to produce results where others fail or squander their time? 
 7. Are you proficient in using a CRM such as Salesforce or a program like Act! to make the best use of your time? 
 8. Do you feel that at times, the sales work you've done in the past has not been appreciated, or that it went into a black hole where you did not see the results of your labor? 
 9. Do you feel that you have the talent, skills and ambition to succeed, but have not found the right kind of company? 
 10. Do you have the ability to travel a few days a month to cultivate relationships?
 11. Do you feel that you really understand marketing and business development, and how sales -- while supported by those two components -- is the ultimate resource for any company's growth and future? 

 We have a very unique business model. We are a dynamic group that leverages companies' operational and manufacturing capabilities by producing valuable marketing and sales results. This position is a hunting position and your goal is to set up conference calls and obtain RFQs so our company may quote on new projects. 

 This position starts off on a part-time basis, but could move into a full-time position very quickly. You will be paid weekly via the Upwork platform. This is a long-term position that pays $20-$40 per hour, plus commissions. Our company utilizes several time-saving systems to help support and leverage results faster. 

 Please respond with your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this position.

Now Hiring Part-Time School Bus Drivers in Euclid, OH-- $17/ HR, Paid CDL Training, & $1000 Sign On Bonus

At First Student, our Bus Drivers are an integral part of the communities they serve. They are committed to safety, customer service and have genuine, caring attitudes for children. We are your friends, family, and neighbors!

We are proud to offer: 

-$1000 Sign On Bonus for permitted & licensed drivers*
-Flexible Hours
-$17/ HR Starting Wage
-Competitive Benefits
-Paid CDL Training

As a First Student Bus Driver, your major responsibilities will be to:

-Safely transports passengers
-Perform pre/post trip vehicle inspections
-Assists students in the loading and unloading process

Requirements of a School Bus Driver:

-Good verbal communication skills
-At least 21 years old
-Valid driver's license for at least 3 years
-Be subject to a background check, drug screen & physical

Our drivers have flexible hours and time off during school holidays.  Through our commitment to putting customers first, dedication to safety, and ambition to deliver the best means we've created a working environment that you'll love.

And, because we're a huge company with 120,000 staff and over 2.5 billion customers worldwide, you'll also enjoy real security, a brilliant future, and fantastic training.

Apply today to become a part of our team!

Conditions may apply

*Offer ends 10.31.2017

Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Customer Service Representative position available!
Description:
LoanMax Title Loans - Customer Service Representative

Are you looking for a stable, full time, entry level position with career potential? If so, you've come to the right place! We are looking for an individual who has a highly professional demeanor and is honest, reliable, and punctual. We are currently hiring for the following location:

13216 Cedar Rd.
Cleveland Heights, OH  44118
216-678-9015

You can apply by either dropping your resume off at our local location or reply to this ad with your resume attached.
Note: Resumes must include employment history, employment dates, description of each position, and educational background. A cover letter is preferred.

Incentives:
•	Full Time Positions: Monday - Friday 10am-6pm and rotating Saturdays 9am-2pm. Closed Sundays!
•	Health benefits
•	Paid Holidays
•	Vacations
•	Paid time off
•	Paid on-site training
•	Competitive Salaries

Requirements:
•	Must be 18 years or older
•	Must be able to work full time
•	A high school degree or equivalent
•	Basic computer and data entry experience
•	Minimum 2 years customer service experience
•	Collections experience preferred
•	Criminal background check
•	Consumer credit check
•	Drug screen

Primary Responsibilities:
•	Provide superior customer service
•	Loan processing
•	Cash handling
•	Collection calls
•	Clerical work

Our background:
LoanMax Title Loans is one of America's most respected title loan companies. We currently own and operate nearly 1,000 offices in more than twenty states nationwide. Since the day we opened in 1990, we have been committed to helping customers get the hassle-free cash they need. 
We believe our Customer Service Representatives are the heart of our business. We pride ourselves in the service we provide to our customers, and we have high expectations for our Customer Service Representatives. We are looking for an individual that is motivated, honest, dependable, and seeking a long term career opportunity.

Please feel free to visit our website for further information:

Title: "Fall" Into The Perfect Work At Home Employment Opportunity!
Description:
"Fall" Into The Perfect Work At Home Employment Opportunity!

Ameridial has been recognized by Matt Granite from Cleveland, Ohio TV Station WKYC as a major work from home employer and workforce provider for Fortune 500 companies and we currently have positions available in the Cleveland area!

We are seeking experienced work at home representatives to take inbound sales calls for some of our most well-known and respected clients.  If hired, you will be taking calls for nutritional supplements as well as for a variety of Christian ministry programs. 

You can earn hourly base pay plus excellent commission working early mornings on weekends from the comfort of your own home.  Although weekends are required due to being our busiest time, additional hours are sometimes available throughout the week and are determined based on your performance and flexibility. 

Qualified Candidates Must Possess:
•	High School Diploma/GED
•	6 Months Sales Experience
•	6 Months Work at Home Experience
•	Type 15 WPM
•	Excellent Communication Skills
•	Above Average Computer Navigation Skills

System Requirements:
•	High Speed Internet
•	Windows XP, 7, 8, 10, or Vista
•	USB Headset

We Offer:
•	Paid Training
•	Virtual Training
•	Weekend Hours
•	Base Pay Plus Commission
•	Attendance Bonus
•	Contests

Apply Online:  www.ameridial.com/application  and choose Work at Home as your preferred location in the Commercial division.

Training begins November 1st and 15th!

*Training is typically three days, Wednesday-Friday, from 9am-5pm and is completed virtually.

Title: Dunbar Armored is hiring for Teller positions!
Description:
SEEKING ENERGETIC, RELIABLE INDIVIDUALS FOR OUR CLEVELAND CASH PROCESSING CENTER.

Previous Cashier or Teller experience is a plus, but will train. Work in a clean, production environment with no interaction with the public.

* $10.00/hour, Part-time hours
* Company-supplied uniforms

TO APPLY:

Step 1: Complete the online job application and assessment at .

Step 2: Call (216) 642-9321 for more information.

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for the secure, timely and accurate processing of customer deposits brought to Cash Vault Services via armored car by counting currency, separating or segregating currency, packaging/un-packaging currency, sealing/unsealing bags and maintaining inventory counts and levels. All tasks are designed to protect the property of our employees and customers.

The essential functions of this position are:

-Process deposits in accordance with specified customer requirements while under constant camera coverage.

-Maintain satisfactory job performance defined by the Dunbar Cash Vault Procedures & Responsibilities for tellers.

-May assist in controlling access to the facility via use of entry buttons and video.

-Check in routes when necessary abiding by armored guidelines.

-Assist in preparation of any Federal Reserve Bank Shipments.

-Be flexible in work schedule to coincide with the fluctuating daily/weekly work flow.

The minimum Knowledge, Education, Experience, Skills, and/or Abilities required to perform this job are, including any physical requirements:

-High school degree/equivalency.

-Must have some cash handling experience. 

-Must be detailed and accurate and possess an awareness for security.

Dunbar is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their race, gender, religion, disability, veteran or other protected status. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities.

Title: Contractors Needed- Full House Rehabs
Description: Growing real estate development firm is seeking contractors to help handle our increasing volume of whole house rehabs.  Qualified contractors must be able to renovate a home from start to finish- Demo, plumbing, carpentry work (interior/exterior), drywall, flooring (tile), painting and everything else required to complete a full rehab.  All projects are located in Point of Sale jurisdictions so any experience with POS inspection a plus.  We have contracts available for 8-10 homes per month for the next two years.  Qualified contractors must be able to provide quality workmanship in a timely manner at a competitive price.  Homes are to be completed within 4-5 weeks.  This is an incredible opportunity for the contractor looking for a volume based operation to team up with!!!  Take your company to the next level!

Title: Line Service Technician (CLEX)
Description:
**Please apply online www.atlanticaviation.com/careers**

Overview

Did you ever want to work in aviation but didn't know how to break into the industry?  Do you like working in a fast-paced environment, often outdoors, around some of the most incredible professionals in the industry?  Did you ever wish that you could work for a company where you could grow your career?  If so, Atlantic Aviation just may be the employer for you!
 
Headquartered in Plano, Texas, Atlantic Aviation operates the country's largest premier network of fixed base operations (FBO). With over 65 FBOs in 30 states, Atlantic provides a wide range of aircraft ground handling services including fueling and line services, ground transportation, catering, hangar, and ramp space. Our dynamic growth and outstanding customer service continue to set us apart in the aviation industry.  Customer satisfaction remains at the forefront at every location.  All our associates receive extensive professional training, so customers can be assured of the same high level of service, no matter which Atlantic facility they choose.
Responsibilities

We are seeking self-motivated, safe, positive, enthusiastic, goal oriented individuals for immediate openings as a Line Service Technician/Aircraft Fueler (LST) at CLEX.  Corporate aviation continues to be a viable means of travel for many who do not like the long lines and delays often times encountered with the airlines and many corporations are now leasing or purchasing their own private aircraft.  Our Line Service Technicians provide the ground handling services for these aircraft.  Line Service Technicians wear many different hats such as parking and fueling these multi-million dollar aircraft as well as maintaining our hangars to meet the high standards of our customer base.  You will be the first point of contact for clientele when arriving on our ramp and you will get the opportunity to interact with many large corporations' flight departments and high profile clients.  Customer service is of the highest priority, as well as professional and safe service.
 

We are proud to be an EEO/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled employer
We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance testing
Qualifications

Experience with aviation ground handling services is very much desired.  Atlantic Aviation has a thorough training program to ensure that all of our employees meet and exceed the highest levels of safety and customer service.  Prospective applicants simply need a strong sense of safety and customer service to apply. This position does require you to work in all weather conditions, and flexibility with your schedule is a must as we operate 24 hours a day.  As a minimum requirement, each applicant must possess the following:
High school diploma or GED certificate
Be at least 18 years of age
A valid state drivers license and meet the company's insurability requirements
 
 
Atlantic Aviation...take off into your future!

Title: Automotive Entry Level Express Technicians
Description:
Ganley Westside Imports is presently seeking entry level Express Auto Techs. Part time and full time positions available. 

Responsibilities:
Include, but are not limited to:

Perform all required automative maintenance services
Entry level knowledge of automobiles
Effective analytical and communication skills
Excellent reading, computer, and mathematics skills
Ability to learn new technology and repair and service procedures and specifications


Job Requirements

As a Express Technician, you must be highly self-motivated with a beginner level of auto repair expertise. You must also be highly detail-oriented with solid organizational and time-management skills. It is also important that you have excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.

Specific qualifications for the Technician position include:


Automotive experience a plus.
Vocational or Trade school training a plus. 
Some weekend hours are required. Multiple shifts to choose from. 
High school diploma or GED.
Valid driver's license with four points or less in last three years.
Willingness to submit to criminal background check and drug screen.
Ability to drive manual transmission cars required.

If you are in alignment with our values of integrity, transparency, professionalism and teamwork and you are the best at what you do, now is the time for you to accelerate your career as part of the best company in automotive retail.

Apply online, in person at the dealership or email resume to Paul Mauer

Ganley Westside Imports 
25600 Lorain Rd 
North Olmsted, OH 44070

Title: ROUTE SERVICE TECHS NEEDED ASAP!!!
Description:
Furniture Repair Technicians Needed Now!!!!

Now Hiring Career Minded Individuals!!!!!

Ready to raise the bar on customer satisfaction?

An In-Home Furniture Repair Technician works closely with the customer care team to repair and satisfy any furniture damages or manufacturer defects our customers experienced. The ideal candidate must have exceptional customer service skills, in addition to having the craft necessary to successfully repair wood, upholstery, and leather products. Responsible for setting the standard for the quality of the merchandise our customers will receive. Must have proven repair skills to meet our goal of total customer satisfaction!

Expectations:

•Home Furniture Repair Technicians travel to customers' homes to assess and complete furniture repairs. 
•Demonstrate professionalism, confidence, and positive energy while working in our customers' homes.
•Able to communicate well with customers in order to service and repair warranted items.
•Ability to work independently or within a team environment.
•Accountable for commitment to US Quality Furniture Services safety procedures and guidelines.
•Maintain, and supply their own service repair vehicle.
•Inspect, repair and evaluate customer service repairs.

Title: Customer Service Representative - Part Time (Work From Home)
Description:
Spiraledge is a leading internet retailer and healthy living company. As the parent company of fast growing e‐commerce sites SwimOutlet.com 🏊 & YogaOutlet.com 🙏🏼, Spiraledge Inc. has been recognized as a Gold‐Level Fit‐Friendly Worksite 🏆 at its headquarters in Campbell, CA. Both 

SwimOutlet.com and YogaOutlet.com have been named an Internet Retailer Hot 100 Company.
SwimOutlet.com is the largest online specialty store for aquatics in the United States and has the largest selection for swimming, fashion swim, beach and surf!

YogaOutlet.com is the fastest growing multi-branded online yoga retailer, offering a broad selection of yoga brands and yoga-inspired products to all levels of yogis and fitness enthusiasts.
Benefits for part-time employees include 401K with matching and employee discount from any of our sites. 

Position Summary:

This is a remote position. It requires residence anywhere in Ohio or Connecticut and 2 weeks of full time virtual training.
 
The customer service representative responds accurately and efficiently to our customer needs regarding products and order inquiries via phone, e-mail and Live Chat. The ideal candidate has excellent communication skills, genuine empathy and the ability to represent our brand with pride. Representatives are expected to adapt to changes, contribute to improving the overall site experience, and follow through on resolving customer issues with good judgment and a sense of urgency.

Responsibilities:

•	Maintain high levels of customer service
•	Answer customer calls and respond to emails
•	Research required information using available resources
•	Manage and resolve customer complaints
•	Provide customers with product and service information
•	Process orders and resolve issues according to procedure
•	Identify and escalate priority issues and route calls to appropriate resource
•	Follow up customer calls where necessary
•	Document all call information according to standard operating procedures
•	Adhere to the work schedule with regard to start and stop times and breaks
•	Maintain a positive work atmosphere that strengthens the team
•	Perform other duties and projects as assigned
•	Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures and instructions

Qualifications:

•	B.S. degree with 1+ years of phone based customer service or call center experience a plus
•	Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
•	Strong written and verbal communication skills
•	Attention to detail and follow through
•	Proficient use of Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel and Windows software
•	Ability to utilize the computer and phone simultaneously with accuracy and efficiency
•	Ability to work independently and in a team environment
•	Ability to maintain a positive attitude when dealing with all customers and co-workers
•	Fast typing skills (40 + WPM)
•	1 year previous customer service or call center experience
•	The ability to work remotely from the same location for all shifts. Remote work location must meet the following requirements:
•	A room in your home with a shutting door, containing a desk and a chair for working
•	This set up must be comfortable and ergonomically safe.
•	Quiet work location so that during all shifts, callers and call auditors must not hear pets, children, television, radio or other sounds that disrupt excellent service. Note: Background noise including television, children and pets can result in immediate termination.
•	An Internet connection of 9 Mbps capacity. DSL or Cable Internet only - No dial up
•	Ability to work remotely from the same location for all shifts
•	Basic ability to resolve computer, internet and phone connectivity issues
•	Ability to report to the local office for training and regular meetings as requested/assigned
•	Passion for living an active lifestyle or sports a plus! 
When applying, please submit your salary requirements in your cover letter.

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to sit, talk and hear frequently; use hands and fingers to type, write; reach with hands and arms for tasks such as keyboarding, opening filing cabinets, and some light lifting as necessary to function in an office environment.

Part Time Shifts Needed - Must be able to work one of the following shifts: 

Shift: 

1. Monday 6am-12:30pm EST (3am-9:30am PST)
Tuesday 6am-12:30pm EST (3am-9:30am PST)
Saturday 9am-3pm EST (6am-12pm PST)

2. Saturday-Wednesday 1pm-7pm EST (10am-4pm PST)

3. Monday 11am-8pm EST (8am-5pm PST)
Tuesday 11am-4pm EST (8am-1pm PST)
Saturday & Sunday 11am-8pm EST (8am-5pm PST)

Please respond with your availability and salary requirements; resumes without this information will not be considered.

Title: Roofer / Carpenter
Description:
Celebrating over 30 years of business. This well established company has proven to tackle the most difficult of projects by thinking through a problem and creating a solution that lasts!  This is the baseline of our business as we know that building trust is based on good honest work, by good, responsible, honest people.

Our main focus is with restorations and installations of wood and slate roofing materials, siding, copper sheet metal work as well as masonry and carpentry.  Much of our work is historical restorations.

Seeking crew leaders and  one project manager.

also:

Looking for individuals or assembled crews who are capable of solving chronic building problems.
Applicants must be proficient in carpentry, roofing, painting, masonry, sheet metal, mechanical.. 

Exterior and interior projects include all phases of construction and property maintenance repair and restoration: plumbing, electrical, drywall, hardware, windows, doors etc.

The candidate must be in good physical shape and will undergo our drug screening and background checks with their application.

Much of  our work involves repairs and solutions for chronic problems at our customer's homes.  Historical restoration and renovations are our specialty.

Valid Driver's license. / Reliable vehicle / at least basic tools.
Rock climbers,  tree workers and military veterans are a natural for this type of work.

Most projects in Cuyahoga and surrounding counties, although many are throughout northern Ohio.

Please reply with detailed explanation of experience and/or resume.  Also include past pay and requested compensation as well as references.  Pictures of your past work may also be submitted.

Roof / Carpentry / Paint / Power wash / power wash / mason / Gutter / sheet metal / copper / solder/ standing seam / flat seam /Wood / shake / shingle / asphalt / fiberglass / slate / flat / skylight /  kitchen / bath / plumbing / electric / tile / floor /

Description:
The On-Site Customer Service Representative is responsible for coordinating catering operations of Air Chef in a manner that is consistent with company policy and procedures, resulting in outstanding customer service and client loyalty. The Onsite Customer Service Representative will be based at our client's headquartered in Richmond Heights, OH.

Qualifications and Requirements
- High School diploma. 
- Experience in managing client relationships in a business environment, multi-tasking during the course of regular business and exceptional organizational skills.  
- Ability to read and interpret documents such as manuals and procedure documents. 
- Verbal and written communications skills must be timely and effective. 
- Good grammar and voice, basic computer and keyboarding skills, and excellent customer service skills. Prior experience in catering. 
- Experience in the aviation industry is a plus. Ability to travel during training process.

The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential function of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 6 WEEKS OF FREE TRUCK PAYMENTS + A $500 SIGN ON BONUS!
Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! We'll tell it to you straight -- we have an awesome program -- we're proud of it -- you'll like working here, but it won't all be sunshine and rainbows.  What we can offer you is a good job; stability; good equipment; a down-to-earth, kick a@@ company owner who genuinely cares about drivers. We have a solid lease purchase program -- you won't be rich but you're going to be earning a good living, and you'll have the pride of owning your own truck.  




 


Let us tell you a little about our program. We offer two lease options:







  


  

We offer full service, 100%, bumper-to-bumper warranty on all of our equipment.  This means that drivers will never again have to pay out of pocket for maintenance, oil changes, PM's, or any repair bills while they are working towards paying the truck off.  Breakdowns will never break the bank! 


 

  
We offer new equipment.  The oldest truck in our fleet is a 2014.  We offer 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017s! :



 

  
For orientation, we provide you with a rental car or flight to one of our terminals.  We put you in a PRIVATE ROOM, in a nice hotel!  We provide all your meals while you're here.
Compensation: Check out our lease purchase calculator on our website for pay details

Title: Home Manager/Manager in Training

Connections in Ohio, Inc. is seeking an energetic and passionate person for a fantastic management opportunity! The Home Manager will oversee a team of Direct Care staff as they support individuals with developmental disabilities in their community homes.

Managers will provide administrative support to their team through processing of payroll, coaching, evaluations, completing schedules, training and attending ISP and Administrator meetings. They will also work with their team to provide direct care/supported living services to the consumers.

This is a full-time position. We offer competitive wages with an increase after a successful 90 day training period as well as generous paid leave, outstanding health benefits and 401k.

Previous management and scheduling experience is preferred but not required.

Description:
Looking for a great opportunity based in the Cleveland, OH area? PAM Transport is currently hiring truck drivers, and no previous experience is needed! We offer company sponsored CDL training, which allows you to go through trucking school to get the training needed to become a professional truck driver with PAM. 



- Earn up to $50,000 1st year
- $1,200 Sign On Bonus
- Company Sponsored CDL Training
- Best-In-Class Benefits
- Drive Newer Trucks




In about a month, you can earn a Class A CDL and be ready to hit the open road with a driver mentor for paid on-the-job training. Drivers at PAM Transport can earn up to $50,000 in addition to a $1,200 sign on bonus in their first year, with excellent benefits and advancement opportunities too.


One of the greatest benefits to working for PAM are the different career opportunities available in a driver's first year. Taking advantage of these options will help maximize an employee's earning potential:

-  - Driver Mentors get paid to help new PAM drivers get real on the road experience.

PAM offers its experienced drivers a positive atmosphere with plenty of OTR and Dedicated lanes, as well as team driving runs and enhanced HazMat pay. This makes it a great place for drivers to grow professionally while advancing their career.

Title: Over the Road Truck Driver | Hiring Now
Now Hiring Cooks, Kitchen Managers and FOH Staff
Description:
The Burgers 2 Beer restaurant group is looking for individuals who display an impressive....errr epic level of positivity, teamwork and willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done attitude. If this describes you, then we'd like you to apply to one of the fastest growing restaurants in the Cleveland area. Because, hey, burgers can't make friends by themselves.... 

How do you know if this is the right job for you?
Servers : We need Serving talent. The holding a full drink tray while smiling so big that everyone in the room orders another round kind of talent. Salesmanship skills so good you can sell a Ketchup Popsicle to a gentleman wearing white kind of talent. The ability to be in seven different places at once kind of talent. 
Bartenders: We need Bartending talent. Bartenders with the "let's have another round smile", The photogenic memory remembering every guests favorite drinks and having it ready at their favorite seat before they even know that want to order one kind of talent. The ability to talk to those who don't talk as well as listen to those who don't stop... 
Cooks: We need Kitchen talent. You added spices to your ramen noodles in college. You relish the first time you get to cook for someone on a date. You want to grill, fry, and chop your way through life. We want you to realize that dream. 
Shift Leader: How does someone "break in" to the Management of Fun? They start as a shift leader. Shift leaders are our most responsible hourly staff. These individuals have demonstrated an interest in management and need a little experience to develop into our future leaders. Initiative, customer service skills, a responsible disposition, good communication, and the ability to motivate others are musts for individuals hired into this vital role.
FYI: Our dishwashers aren't the only ones cleaning up in our restaurants. We are on the rise and guest satisfaction scores are at record highs. If you're looking for a solid, stable company with plenty of opportunities for future growth, let us hear from you today. We have opportunities in Highland Heights, Concord, Solon, Lakewood, Downtown and future locations to be announced soon. 

Please specify which location or locations you would most like to work in.

Title: VOLUNTEERS WANTED for Recipe Testing!
Description:
Food lovers, amateur home chefs, and people new to cooking needed! An international culinary company is looking for participants to test their newest recipes and provide feedback via a brief online survey.
This is a great opportunity for people who love food and enjoy cooking from home as well as people who want to try out cooking and receive something for their efforts!

Testers will be given step-by-step recipes with detailed shopping lists. They will be asked to purchase ingredients and cook up to 3 recipes within 5-7 days and provide feedback in the form of an online survey for each recipe.
For every survey completed, testers will be eligible to receive a gift of appreciation such as an eGift Card or free product promotions (gifts are stated before each round of survey signups)!

This is a volunteer position; testers are chosen for signups at random and will be notified about one week prior to testing to confirm availability.

Please visit  and complete the questionnaire for further consideration.
Compensation: This is a volunteer position with no set hrs or pay. Gifts for each survey completion are stated before agreeing to each survey.

Title: DIRECTV Sales - You are something special - Prove everyone WRONG
Description:
Hello and thanks for your interest in working with Elite Mobility Inc. Directv's Preferred dealer for Northeast Ohio. 

We are a direct sales organization that works hand in hand with at&t and DIRECTV. We specialize in outside sales (business sales, and consumer sales) and also Event sales (trade shows, big home and garden shows, car shows, county and state fairs).

We have two types of compensation: 

Base Salary of $300 per week. This salary has nothing to do with how many sales you do, and is a guaranteed salary paid weekly. In addition to your base pay salary we pay individually on products sold. 

DIRECTV VIDEO SALE: $40
UVERSE VIDEO SALE: $75
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $88.00
FOR ADVANCED SALESPEOPLE WE OFFER A 100% COMMISSION OPTION:

DIRECTV SALE: $160
UVERSE SALE: $75
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $350 plus $50 for any camera sold, up to two cameras. 
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Schedule and hours: 

We work Monday Through Friday from 12 noon to 7:30pm. 

We have 3 scheduled team meetings: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. The other two days, we meet to turn in paperwork and receive territory from upper management.

Do we offer advancement opportunities?: 

Yes we do, infact we are a preffered dealer for DIRECTV and At&t. This means at&t and Elite Mobility have teamed up to grow at&t's footprint, in turn they finance our expansion as an organization. Qualified salespeople that have higher than average sales numbers will be given an opportunity to manage a sales team. Our organization has a set standard and procedure for once a sales team hits their quota two months in a row, a location and franchise office will be opened up for that sales manager. That sales manager will then be promoted out of a sales role into a general manager role. The pay for the GM position begins at $75,000 per year plus commission and bonus's.

Title: Insomnia meds not working? - Payment varies by study up to $1250
Description:
Do you or a loved one have Insomnia? If so, you may be eligible for research studies in your area. 



Research studies are an important part of developing potential future treatment options. Without them, progress in medicine would not be possible. Right now, doctors are looking for people with trouble staying asleep to volunteer for local research studies. 

Get Started Now
SEE IF YOU QUALIFY 
OR CALL
1-855-226-3472



For more information, visit 



Those who qualify may receive*: 
•	Payment that varies by study up to $1250

•	No-cost study medication 

Plus, no health insurance is needed!

Visit  or call us toll-free at 1-855-226-3472 anytime - 24 hours a day, seven days a week. 

Space is limited!





Acurian is a company that recruits people for clinical research studies. We are currently working with pharmaceutical companies to find individuals who are willing to participate in clinical research studies in your area. 

* In a clinical research study, the participants may receive investigational study product or may receive an inactive substance, or placebo, depending on the study design. Participants receive study-related care from a doctor/research team for the duration of the study.  Reasonable payments will be made for participation and the length of the study may vary.

Title: STNA / Resident Caregiver for Assisted Living Home  - PART-TIME
Description:
Please follow the instructions below to be considered for this position:

A private Christian assisted living HOME in Mentor is seeking a dependable, trustworthy STNA, HHA OR EXPERIENCED CARE-GIVER for PART-TIME WORK - 24 hours total per week. This position involves FIRST SHIFT (7AM-3PM) either Monday or Wednesday and SECOND SHIFT (3PM-11PM) EVERY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

An experienced STNA, HHA or training and experience commensurate with this is required. First aid certification, a clear criminal back-ground check and a two-step TB test are necessary but may be acquired upon hire. Drug testing will also be required.

The HOME cares for a maximum of five elderly residents. Individuals seeking this position must be NON-SMOKERS, self-motivated, and have a heart and desire to serve the elderly. They must be able to work alone, confident in the full responsibility for the care and welfare of the residents. The job entails the ability to make HOME-COOKED MEALS FROM SCRATCH (lunch and dinner).  If you do not have this ability, please do NOT respond to this ad. General housekeeping and occasional laundry duties are also a part of this job.

Compensation - starting pay is $10-$11/hour (depending on skills/experience) for a 30-60 day trial period; increases considered after training and dependent on skill and performance level.

If you are interested, please submit a resume and a cover letter including your phone number and a description of why you would be a good candidate for this job. You will be contacted for an interview if deemed qualified.

Title: Entry Level Marketing Manager
Description:
Have fun at work again!  Picture yourself in a marketing position where you will love coming to work! Gain greater job satisfaction, and represent a trusted brand.

Company 9 is a consulting firm that accomplishes business development activities by researching and developing marketing opportunities and plans; implementing sales plans; managing staff.

We offer a unique and warm environment with a family feel!  We believe in "working hard, and having fun while doing it." Join a tight-knit group of people who love what they do.  With a welcoming and supportive environment, it's hard to not feel good about going to work!  Get excited about all the opportunity in front of you.  Here, your hard work will never go unnoticed. 
 
Entry Level Marketing  Manager Job Duties:
-Accomplishes marketing objectives by selecting, training, coaching, and counseling employees; Planning, monitoring, and reviewing job contributions; planning and reviewing compensation actions; enforcing policies and procedures. 

-Build relationships with clients and offer products that can meet the client's expectations.  

-Achieves marketing and sales objectives by contributing strategic marketing and sales plans; implementing production, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change. 

-Projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products; analyzing trends and results; establishing pricing strategies; recommending selling prices; monitoring costs, competition, supply, and demand. 

-Accomplishes marketing and sales objectives by planning, developing, implementing, and evaluating advertising, merchandising, and trade promotion programs; developing field sales action plans. 

-Identifies marketing opportunities by identifying consumer requirements; defining market, competitor's share, and competitor's strengths and weaknesses; forecasting projected business; establishing targeted market. 


Some benefits to you:
-Competitive compensation + Bonuses 
-Paid Training 
-Great benefits  
-Brand recognition - Voted "Best & Brightest Companies to Work For" 
-Family-like atmosphere - Fun environment! 
-Paid Travel Opportunities 
-Unparalleled work environment 
 
To Apply: Submit a copy of your resume for consideration or contact our Human Resources Manager at (216)-406-9163.

Title: Service Utility - Ohio CAT - 709
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY: 

This position will require the ability to operate multiple sizes and brands of heavy and Ariel equipment, load and unload equipment safely off and onto trucks and trailers, wash equipment, check/inspect and communicate any damages when equipment is brought back, perform minor repair/inspections and PM Services on the equipment, work in all-weather types, great organizational and communication skills and ability to work with customers in a professional and courteous manner.  

COMPETENCIES LIST AND DESCRIBE:   

General technical service skills, mechanical aptitude or experience with construction or power equipment required, Must be organized, self-motivated, and able to work without direct supervision and work Flex/Shift hours. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.  Some computer and software skills required. 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS 

High school graduate minimum, College and/or continued education in a technical field a plus.  Experience related to construction or power equipment service and repair is required. 
 
Additional Information:
Ohio CAT conducts its operations through three divisions: The Equipment Division, the Power Systems Division and the Agri Division. In addition, the company operates CAT Rental stores at 8 of its locations, and remanufactures and repairs all makes of hydraulic components at its Hydraulics Division in Bolivar, Ohio (Complete Hydraulic Service). Ohio CAT has 24 branches and approximately 1200 employees.

You are welcome to view all Ohio CAT opportunities, set-up an online profile and apply directly by visiting us at:  and click the "Search" button to see all Open Positions at Ohio CAT. Click the pencil icon to apply for a position.


If you are experiencing issues when trying to create a user profile, log into our application system, or any other features of this site, you are likely running into Web Browser Compatibility issues. There are features on our system that are not compatible with the most recent versions of Internet Explorer, 10 and 11. Please use the following guide to set your browser to "Compatibility View", and your issues should be resolved. 
1.	Open the "Tools" list in the tool bar (press the "Alt" key if your tool bar is not showing).	Select "Compatibility View Settings"
2.	Click "Add" to add ohiocat.com to your Compatibility View list, then click "Close"
3.	The website should then reload on its own without the compatibility issues.
We hope that this solves any application problems that you may be having. Thank you for your interest in Ohio CAT career opportunities.

Title: BECOME AN AUTHORIZED DIRECTV DEALER
Description:
Every 8 seconds, someone signs-up for DIRECTV services**... Why not leverage one of America's strongest brands and benefit from the rewards?
Looking for qualified individuals and business owners to become Authorized DIRECTV dealer in your area (individual commission based sales positions are also available thru existing dealers).  The opportunity to become an authorized local DIRECTV dealer involves marketing and enrolling customers for the best in television.  DIRECTV provides the best television experience in English and Spanish, as well as leading International channels in Chinese, Tagalong, Vietnamese, Korean, Russian, and more.  DIRECTV provides a lucrative compensation package including marketing/co-op funds, quality bonuses, as well as a residual that builds-up over time! 
Please see below for Requirements and Benefits, and let us know if you have any questions: 

*Successful New Dealers* include: 
•         Business owners who want to diversify their products & service offerings 
•         Business owners with a strong desire to add revenue streams or increase revenue
•         Business owners who employ existing sales team for other product lines

Benefits to New Dealers:
•         Generous compensation!  (Dealers can earn $450 per new activation)  
•         Low inventory cost
•         Face-to-face consulting and training program for staff
•         Quick-turn cash flow program
•         Co-op advertising program
•         Online on-demand training program
•         Showroom / Demo program

* Upon approval of your pre-screen application, a background & credit check will be performed on the business owners listed*

Sales positions are available with existing dealers ...... We can connect you with the Best in your area.
Please call Mike Colson / Strategic Account Manager at 614-402-8084 to schedule a time to review if either opportunity can be a great fit for you. 

**Based on gross subscriber additions from Q4 2011-Q3 2012. DIRECTV is a registered trademark and is used with permission.

Title: Drivers Wanted - No Experience Needed - Flexible - Up to $1,500/week
Assistant Managers @ Wendy's
Description:
MUY! is currently the 3rd largest franchise restaurant company in the U.S, operating over 700 Pizza Hut, Wendy's and Taco Bell restaurants, employing over 20,000 hourly staff!

As an Assistant Manager with Wendy's, you'll be offered competitive benefits, monthly paid performance bonuses, tuition reimbursement, strong earning potential and "promote from within" philosophy, work/life balance and so much more!

Positions available now, so submit a resume or visit a location today for consideration!
-5251 Turney Rd., Garfield Heights
-27400 Chagrin Blvd., Orange Village
-6899 Rockside Rd., Independence

Our best candidate is a results-oriented professional with a strong customer focus!

The Assistant Manager is responsible for supporting the Restaurant General Manager in the management of the entire restaurant's operations, which include (but not limited to):
•	Training, developing and mentoring staff
•	Creating a warm, welcoming work and dining environment
•	Monitoring and reinforcing food safety procedures
•	Maximizing store sales and profit goals
•	Maintaining QSC standards
•	Ensuring protection of Wendy's brand and assets
•	Demonstrating drive for results
•	Going above and beyond to serve our guests

Benefits (include, but not limited to:)
•	Competitive base salary*
•	Medical, dental, vision, RX
•	401k
•	Bonuses paid monthly
•	Tuition Reimbursement
•	Paid Time Off
•	Short and Long Term Disability
•	Strong career and salary growth potential
•	An excellent support network and promotion from within
•	The personalized training, support and tools you need to reach your goals
•	Defined career paths for those who pursue a long-term career
•	Comprehensive, paid training program, meal discounts, direct deposit and more

Minimum Qualifications ( include, but not limited to ):
•	HS Diploma or equivalent & possess all documents required by state and federal law.
•	Minimum of 2 years Shift Supervisor or 1 year Restaurant Manager/Assistant Manager experience required (preferred in high volume QSR &/or fast casual concepts)
•	Flexibility to work 50-55 hours per week, rotating shifts, incl weekends and holidays
•	Valid DL in good standing & access to private trans required
•	Consent to background screening, incl criminal, driving and drug screening
•	Demonstrated ability to lead and manage your own team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
•	Working knowledge of cost of goods sales
•	Excellent problem solving and decision making skills, results oriented and customer focused
*salary is based on relevant experience

Wendy's is an equal employment opportunity employer who may provide reasonable accommodation to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Company Overview

Jan-Pro is the world's largest and most trusted company for commercial cleaning services. 
Since 1991, we have been the leader in the fastest growing industry in the U.S.  If you have documented account management or customer service experience; have the ability to interact effectively with customers and franchisees alike and have excellent follow-up skills, this could be an excellent career opportunity for you. JAN-PRO has over 93 regional locations in North America and we continue to be the leader in our industry year after year.
 

Job Description 

This position will require a person who is an independent self starter with the ability to multi task and possess exceptional organizational skills.  
The primary focus of this position will be to manage a customer base and insure each JAN-PRO customer is getting the highest quality commercial cleaning in the industry while achieving 99% or higher customer retention monthly. This is accomplished through on site customer inspections, prompt customer follow-up within 24 hours, and serving as a business coach and mentor for assisting JAN-PRO independent unit franchisees in becoming successful business owners.

Description:
Snider-Blake is currently looking to fill 1st shift (7A-3P or 6:30A-3P) shipping/production/janitorial positions for our client in the Solon area starting at $8.15/hour and ranges up to $9.00/hr depending on position!! Production position involves packaging and labeling small items; shipping position involves loading/unloading containers with products, wrapping pallets, staging products for shipping. Title: AmeriCorps Member / Reading Tutor
Description:
Thousands of Ohio students experience reading difficulty. Our program is designed to provide individual and small group reading tutoring to students who need extra support.

Members of our program receive training at the Central Ohio ESC in December, and then will be placed in a school where he/she will serve as a reading tutor for approximately 20-30 students (grades K-3) over the course of the school year.

Members serve 40 hours per week from January 5 - June 30.

Members receive $985/month plus an Education Award of up to $2,960 - this can be used to pay tuition, student loans, or other education expenses. Members who are 55 and over by December 4, 2017 are eligible to transfer their award to their child, grandchild, or foster child.

Title: DIRECTV Sales - You are something special - Prove everyone WRONG
Description:
Hello and thanks for your interest in working with Elite Mobility Inc. Directv's Preferred dealer for Northeast Ohio. 

We are a direct sales organization that works hand in hand with at&t and DIRECTV. We specialize in outside sales (business sales, and consumer sales) and also Event sales (trade shows, big home and garden shows, car shows, county and state fairs).

We have two types of compensation: 

Base Salary of $300 per week. This salary has nothing to do with how many sales you do, and is a guaranteed salary paid weekly. In addition to your base pay salary we pay individually on products sold. 

DIRECTV VIDEO SALE: $40
UVERSE VIDEO SALE: $75
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $88.00
FOR ADVANCED SALESPEOPLE WE OFFER A 100% COMMISSION OPTION:

DIRECTV SALE: $160
UVERSE SALE: $75
Protect America Home Security/Home Automation: $350 plus $50 for any camera sold, up to two cameras. 
At&t Mobility (at&t cellphones) $25 per line sold. New customers only.
Schedule and hours: 

We work Monday Through Friday from 12 noon to 7:30pm. 

We have 3 scheduled team meetings: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. The other two days, we meet to turn in paperwork and receive territory from upper management.

Do we offer advancement opportunities?: 

Yes we do, infact we are a preffered dealer for DIRECTV and At&t. This means at&t and Elite Mobility have teamed up to grow at&t's footprint, in turn they finance our expansion as an organization. Qualified salespeople that have higher than average sales numbers will be given an opportunity to manage a sales team. Our organization has a set standard and procedure for once a sales team hits their quota two months in a row, a location and franchise office will be opened up for that sales manager. That sales manager will then be promoted out of a sales role into a general manager role. The pay for the GM position begins at $75,000 per year plus commission and bonus's.

Title: 6 WEEKS OF FREE TRUCK PAYMENTS + A $500 SIGN ON BONUS!
Description:
Are you tired of the same old trucking bull$h!t?  Tired of all of the trucking cliches? We are, too! We'll tell it to you straight -- we have an awesome program -- we're proud of it -- you'll like working here, but it won't all be sunshine and rainbows.  What we can offer you is a good job; stability; good equipment; a down-to-earth, kick a@@ company owner who genuinely cares about drivers. We have a solid lease purchase program -- you won't be rich but you're going to be earning a good living, and you'll have the pride of owning your own truck.  




 


Let us tell you a little about our program. We offer two lease options:







  


  

We offer full service, 100%, bumper-to-bumper warranty on all of our equipment.  This means that drivers will never again have to pay out of pocket for maintenance, oil changes, PM's, or any repair bills while they are working towards paying the truck off.  Breakdowns will never break the bank! 


 

  
We offer new equipment.  The oldest truck in our fleet is a 2014.  We offer 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017s! :



 

  
For orientation, we provide you with a rental car or flight to one of our terminals.  We put you in a PRIVATE ROOM, in a nice hotel!  We provide all your meals while you're here.
Compensation: Check out our lease purchase calculator on our website for pay details

Common tasks include:
1.	Dust furniture, equipment, partitions, walls, etc.
2.	Clean and disinfect sinks, countertops, floors, toilet, mirrors, tables, chairs, refrigerators, microwaves, etc in restrooms, break rooms and/or kitchenettes
3.	Replenish supplies in restrooms, break rooms and kitchen
4.	Sweep, mop, vacuum and/or hand scrub floors using brooms, mops and vacuum cleaners
5.	Empty trash cans and recyclables into disposal areas
6.	Wipe down walls and woodwork, doors, wall hangings, baseboards, etc.
•	Identify potential safety or cleaning issues and communicate them to Supervisor and in the comments section on the daily checklist.
•	Handle special requests from Supervisor as appropriate and note handling on the daily checklist and company paperwork
•	Comply with all safety policies and procedures relating to performance of tasks, use of products or supplies and incident reporting.
•	Clean and maintain all equipment and supplies used, daily.
•	All other duties per Supervisor's request.

Skills and Competencies

•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
•	Detail oriented - pays attention to details at each customer's location, with extra attention to any special requests.
•	Friendly and Professional - able to deal with customers when they are on-site while cleaning is being performed
•	Team player - ability to work within a team where members depend on each other to get work done.
•	Self starter - able to identify work that needs to be done and do it without being instructed to do so.
•	Desire to learn, seek new challenges and take on additional responsibilities
•	Reasoning ability. Good common sense with ability to solve practical problems.

Work Environment

•	Physical demands include walking and standing, climbing, bending, kneeling to clean floors by hand, push and pull objects, lift and move objects (including 20 lb vacuum), repetitive bending and lifting, and repetitive arm movements.
•	Uniforms, provided, must be worn during work hours

Job Type: Contractor
Compensation: Base Pay plus incentives. Pay raise after 90 days

Title: Outside Veterinary Sales (Cleveland)
Description:
Trupanion is seeking experienced, pet passionate people to be Territory Partners throughout the United States!

A Trupanion Territory Partner serves as a consultant to Trupanion, and is the exclusive representative for our pet health insurance product within a specified area. Our territories are EXCLUSIVE; we have one Partner per territory.

As a Territory Partner, you will be an independent business owner who earns revenue from Trupanion while helping veterinarians and pet owners provide the highest quality medical care to their pets. This is truly an opportunity where you can make a difference. You will be a significant link between veterinary hospitals and our company. Territory Partners build relationships and educate veterinarians, vet techs, and office staff about how having clients who are insured by Trupanion will not only benefit their practice, but also the lives of the companion animals and families they serve.


A Territory Partner will:

Possess a strong entrepreneurial drive, including an attitude of persistence and patience, and be comfortable with sales.
Be a subject matter expert on the animal health industry and day-to-day operations of veterinary hospitals.
Have a thorough understanding of the entire companion animal medical insurance industry, including the Trupanion product.
Manage an aggressive sales cycle, while spending time on the road, visiting clinics and veterinary hospitals within the territory.
Build and maintain relationships with veterinary clinics, hospitals and veterinary staff.
Have experience building a book of business and breaking open a new market/territory.

Desired traits for a Territory Partner:

Pet passionate, with a strong belief in our mission to give responsible pet owners the ability to provide the best care for their pet when it becomes sick or injured.
An eagerness to learn effective sales techniques
Financially comfortable with commission and long-term recurring residual revenue model.
Strong presentation skills

Title: Shipping / Receiving, Polishing, and Maintenance
Description:
Job Description:

Position Summary:
Perform all tasks involved with polishing, shipping, receiving, general cleaning and maintenance, which includes driving a company vehicle.  Must follow standard work methods and practice safe work habits to ensure job performance is as efficient and safe as possible.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Shipping / Receiving:  Packing customer orders & driving to vendors to pick up and drop off orders, putting stock / inventory away.

Polishing:  Polishing and sand blasting of stainless steel parts, and cleaning parts as required as well as engraving and stamping parts.

Maintenance:  General maintenance around the shop and office as well as general cleaning in the shop and office, yard maintenance which includes mowing grass.

Percentage of Time:  40% Polishing, 40% Maintenance, 20% Shipping & Receiving, but may vary based on workload and customer demand.

Perform all other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements
Minimum Requirements:
Experience with polishing and/or S&R is a plus, must have valid driver's license.  Prior manufacturing or distribution experience is preferred.
 
Essential Mental Functions:
Must be able to read and understand written routings and procedures pertaining to parts that will be worked on.  

Essential Physical Functions: 
Must be physically capable to occasionally lift heavy objects over 50 pounds, and may involve standing or walking for long periods throughout the day.

Equipment Used:
Polishing machines, belt sanders, engraving machine, hydraulic press, company vehicles, and lawn mowers.

Other:
Must be able to work as part of a team.

Title: Outside Sales Representative - Champion Windows -1093
Description:
This position is appropriate for confident, independent, self-starters who want to make a lot of money. Successful Outside Sales Representatives thrive in a one call close environment. They earn trust quickly and educate customers about why Champion is their best and safest home improvement investment.

Your specific duties as an Outside Sales Representative includes:
•	Generating in-home sales opportunities.
•	Building trust and educating customers.
•	Identifying customer needs and wants.
•	Effectively evaluating, measuring and specifying home improvement project options.
•	Building effective proposals and utilizing a consultative selling approach.
•	Negotiating and closing the sale.
•	Submitting project and contract documentation on a timely basis.
•	Attending daily sales/training meetings.
•	Servicing customers at the Champion showroom and home and garden shows on an occasional basis.
•	Maintaining a professional appearance and demeanor at all times
You must be passionate, highly goal-oriented, and entrepreneurial with the ability to take full advantage of all sales opportunities. You must also be detail-oriented with strong organizational, time management, prioritization, and follow-up skills. It is also vital to your role as an Outside Factory Representative that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, and that you possess the ability to easily establish rapport with your customers. You must also have a strong work ethic and be eager and willing to learn our proven sales process.
Specific qualifications for the Outside Sales Representative position include:
•	High school diploma or GED; Associate's or Bachelor's degree a plus
•	Valid driver's license and clean driving record
•	Ability to pass drug screen, credit check, and criminal check
•	Basic computer skills
•	Solid telephone skills
•	Quick decision-making and problem solving skills
•	Ability to lift up to 40 lbs
•	Basic math skills (particularly making calculations using a Tape measure)
•	Sales experience or training a plus (particularly in-home sales)
Benefits
You will enjoy the benefits of uncapped commission opportunities. You will be supported with a great brand, high quality products, excellent service and the best warranty in America. Champion is recognized for outstanding training that will prepare you to be successful.
Your benefits package includes:
•	Paid training
•	Health insurance
•	Dental insurance
•	Disability insurance
•	Flex spending account
•	401(k)
•	Bonus opportunities
•	Career growth based on performance

Champion Window is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Apply online at :

Title: Experienced Press Brake Operator 2nd shift
Description:
Duties & Responsibilities
Responsible for producing parts from metal by making precision bends, punches or cuts into material
Make adjustments necessary to machine to control speed, material, feed and path of cut
Ensure machine is producing quality parts and make necessary adjustments
Ensue machine is working to full capacity, stocked with needed materials
Quality check finished product to ensure it is ready for next step of production process
Inspection of parts with protractor, calipers, height gauge
Read blue prints and product plans to ensure proper set up
Understand CAD/CAM technology
Follow safety procedures of the facility
Meet necessary production numbers
Other related duties as assigned
Skills & Experience
GED or High School diploma required, certificate from a technical or vocational school is preferred.
2-3 years of experience in a manufacturing environment; preferably operating a press brake or sheet metal fabrication.
Math Skills: Good math skills will help press brake operators understand complex instructions, how schematics work and make sure items are designed and built correctly.
Problem Solving Skills : Press brake operators will need to know why machines are not at peak performance, how to increase output and how to fix errors.
Attention to Detail : Press brakes are precision equipment. Being off by millimeters could be a critical error. Keen attention to detail is required.
Mechanical and Technical Skills : MUST understand CAD/CAM technology.
Stamina: Press brake operators often work long hours doing repetitive movements.
SUCCESSFUL Candidates will demonstrate the following:
A high sense of urgency & integrity
Be a productive member of the Team
Demonstrate passion toward job/company
Be self motivated
Flexible/Adaptable to a fast-pace, changing environment

SEND RESUMES AND WORK HISTORY TO

Title: Full/Part Time Manufacturing Operator Positions up to $16 an Hour!!
Description:
Pentair is hiring Full and Part Time Manufacturing Operators Now!  Full Time is 5-6 days, 40+ hours a week with full benefits package.  Part Time is 3 days, 24 hours a week and eligible for paid holidays!   

Employees are hired as "Manufacturing Operators." Within the manufacturing operator position, there are 3 main job assignments that an employee can be trained and placed in. These are: Winder, Assembly Operator, and Blowmold Operator. We pay based on experience.  Starting pay up to $16/hour.  Earn more as you learn more!  You may stop in and complete an application or apply via our website: www.Pentair.com.

Winder Position Summary: 
This position is responsible for winding tank liner with fiberglass strands that are coated with a mixture of resin and hardener.
Duties and Responsibilities:
1.  	Prepare liner for winding, assemble liner with winding tooling and if needed apply a release agent on the surface (silicone inlets)
2.	Wind tanks. This entails watching for knots, inlet build up and circ location
3.	Roll tank out: roll extra resin off the tank
4.	Hang tank on oven line
5.	Other duties as assigned. 
6.	Demonstrates Pentair's "Win Right" culture when interacting with with customers, co-workers and suppliers
7.	Follows all 5S and lean activities, as well as safety regulations policies and procedures

Assembly Position Summary: 
This position is  responsible for offloading, assembling, filling, testing and packaging Polyglass tanks.   This position is also responsible for performing quality inspections on each tank by identifying and communicating any potential non-conforming product.   
Duties and Responsibilities:
1.  	Responsible for unloading tanks from the conveyor line, inspecting for defects, and cleaning inlets.
2.	Responsible for placing tanks on basing fixture to achieve desired height.
3.	Responsible for preparing tanks for filling operation and place unit into resin load dispenser.
4.	Responsible for removing tanks from resin load and weigh to specification.
5.	Responsible for finishing packaging and place on skid per schedule card.
6.	Responsible for performing all Polyglass assembly responsibilities as needed based upon business demands  (Unload tanks from the conveyor line, inspect for defects, and clean inlets, Leak test tanks via water dunk test or gas detection, complete final assembly of base on the tanks, and package tanks in Gaylord).
7.	Responsible for system assembly operations (Pro-Elite & Angelfish). 
8.	Other duties as assigned. 
9.	Demonstrates Pentair's "Win Right" culture when interacting with customers, co-workers and suppliers
10.	Follows all 5S and lean activities, as well as safety regulations policies and procedures

Blowmold Position Summary:	
Produce the liners and/or aircells using blowmold presses.  The liners and aircells will be used to make a finished product.
Duties and Responsibilities:	
1.  	Make liners and/or aircells which entails: placing inserts in mold; lifting processed parts out; trimming parts; flaming liners; and operating press - throughout this entire process, cutting and grinding all scrap and flash.
2.	Weighs and records part weights
3.	Inspects parts
4.	Records all scrap and all production processed
5.	Labels and boxes product
6.	Performs general clean up duties within the BlowMold area
7.	During downtimes, may assemble boxes, give other operators breaks, and transport product to the winding department.
8.	Other duties as assigned. 
9.	Demonstrates Pentair's "Win Right" culture when interacting with with customers, co-workers and suppliers
10.	Follows all 5S and lean activities, as well as safety regulations policies and procedures

Physical Demands and Work Environment:
Position requires constant standing and walking as part of the job. There is lifting of up to 50 lbs. maximum on a daily basis. When working with wide body tanks (weighing more than 50 lbs.) there is lifting equipment available.  Some sitting, stooping, bending, kneeling, and reaching overhead is necessary. Extensive use of hands.


Skills and Experience Requirements:
1.  	Manufacturing experience preferred.
2.	High School Diploma or equivalent preferred.
3.	Must comply with all safety standards and procedures.
4.	Ability to read and understand standard work instructions
5.	Decision making ability to resolve problems and prioritize multiple tasks
6.	Leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills
7.	Ability to communicate effectively.

The intent of this job description is to provide a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. 

Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Compensation: Up to $16 an hour starting pay based on experience

Title: Maintenance Supervisor
Description:
A premier real estate company has an immediate job opening for a Maintenance Supervisor for an upscale apartment community in Madison Ohio. 

 The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR is responsible for the overall upkeep and maintenance of the Apartment Community. The responsibilities of the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR are:

 A. Keep property is best maintenance condition
 B. Maximize efficiency of the Maintenance Staff.
 C. Minimize the expenses whenever possible.
 D. Protect the Owner's Property.

 The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must be a "hands-on" maintenance person. The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must be able to just about anything that pertains to Building Maintenance, such as plumbing, electrical, painting, heating, air conditioning and appliance repair.

 It is the responsibility of the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR to coordinate and monitor all aspects of the Maintenance Program. In this regard, the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR must work closely with the Maintenance staff in order to ascertain full knowledge and control over the entire maintenance program.

 The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR will work closely with the Property Manager. Good communications between the MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR and the Property Manager is crucial for the proper and efficient operation of the Apartment Community. The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR works directly with the Property Manager and for the Maintenance Director. 

 The MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR responsibilities and authority include but are not limited to the following:

 A. ATTITUDE

 1. Maintain a professional, courteous, knowledgeable and helpful attitude with the Residents and fellow employees. Promote this attitude in all of your personnel.
 2. Do not socialize with Residents but maintain a professional manner. Do not discuss company business with them or engage in idle talk or rumors.
 3. Be honest and truthful in all communications with the, Property Manager. Dishonesty will not be tolerated.

 B. RESIDENT CARE

 1. Assist Residents with problems and requests to the best of your ability and to limits of your authority.
 2. Maintain curb appeal of the exterior of the building and common areas of the building.

 C. MANAGEMENT

 1. Continually supervise maintenance and personnel. Take action to improve the general appearance of the property, always be alert for any deferred maintenance problems. Establish daily employee goals. Show each employee exactly what you want him or her to do so they know what is expected.
 2. Require all full time employees to adhere to the scheduled hours of work.
 3. Monitor employee compliance with the policies of Retiree Housing Management.
 4. Encourage employees to submit suggestions for improving work conditions or job efficiency.
 5. Discuss employee performances with the Property Manager if problems arise and possible written reprimand and or dismissal is necessary. Advise the Maintenance Director so that he can help you follow the proper dismissal procedure.
 6. Report any employee injury to the Property Manager and Maintenance Director immediately.
 7. Present to the Maintenance Director ideas on improvement projects and labor needs.

 D. POLICY

 1. Comply with the dress code and or wear uniforms. Work attire must be neat and clean at all times.
 2. Adhere to scheduled hours of work.

 E. SCHEDULING WORK

 1. Daily 
 (a) Complete all Maintenance request and fill out completely or assign to proper staff person. Track progress and make sure it is completed properly and paperwork is turned in.
 (b) Schedule contractors and sign off on completed work orders and invoices.
 (c) Order all materials and supplies. Check in order, sign invoice and give to the Manager.
 (d) Cover building Emergency on-call as scheduled

 2. Weekly
 (a) Meet with the Property Manager once a week. Discuss work procedures, priorities, goals and special jobs to be completed. Assist Management in distributing notices.
 (b) Complete all turn units and schedule contractor as needed. Oversee units to completion and notify office when ready to rent (3-5 day) turnaround.
 (c) Fill out main office paperwork and submit to Property Manager
 (d) Make recommendations to Maintenance Director to improve general conditions of property.
 (e) Communicate with Maintenance Director three (3) times a week or more often if needed.
 (f) Assist Pest Control (when applicable)

 3. Monthly:

 (a) Complete and total walk through of Bldg, filling out preventative maintenance schedule for bldg and complete all needed work found. 



 4. Bi-Annually
 (a) Assist in apartment inspections with the Property Manager
 (b) Complete total filter change (Spring & Fall)

 F. INSPECTIONS

 1. Walk grounds weekly and look for missed trash, maintenance problems and damages. Complete work as needed.
 2. Watch for non-residents running the bldg and for solicitors on the property. Report to the Property Manager.
 3. Review maintenance work of employees periodically for quality.
 4. Assist Property Manager twice a year for apartment condition inspections.

 G. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
 1. Working off ladders up to 20 feet off the ground. Working off stepladders up to 10 feet inside apartments.
 2. Work under sinks and around appliances by bending down or lying on your back.
 3. Moving appliances including refrigerators, washers, dryers and ranges.
 4. Lifting and carrying up to 80 pounds
 5. Bending over appliances or mechanical equipment for repairs or cleaning.
 6. Walking and or standing for an entire workday
 7. Climbing flights of stairs to access work on higher floors
 8. Assembling small parts in appliances, mechanical equipment, plumbing and electrical fixtures, etc.
 9. Reading repair instructions
 10. Logging or describing in writing work hours, repairs made and or materials used.
 11. Working in clement weather
 12. Operating hand and power tools
 13. Painting 
 14. Cleaning 



 H. SAFETY

 1. Be safe and always think safety
 2. Furnish all employees needed safety equipment, such as a set of goggles, or particle masks for their use.
 3. Periodically check employees for use of safety equipment.

 I. TOOLS

 1. Supply your own tools for all common maintenance repairs. The Bldg will furnish specialty tools only for unusual repairs. (i.e. drain snake, extension ladders)

 J. TURNOVER

 1. Perform as much work as possible in house with your Maintenance personnel.
 2. Clean, paint, make repairs to the vacant Apartments to the satisfaction of the Property Manager
 3. Check and repair all electrical and pluming fixtures, window and door locks, etc., to ensure they work properly.
 4. Change all vacant unit door locks.
 5. Complete all work and make unit ready in 3-5 days from move out

 K. CONTRACTOR
 1. Work with Contractors as needed. Ensure that the resident's safety is always a prime consideration, and work is done per LBP O&M Policy (where needed)
 2. Complete work associated with the Contractor's work as needed.
Compensation: Compensation based on experience and qualifications
